Description:
Help keep The Foreign Desk free!

If you rely on our platform and work to get news from #Iran, #Afghanistan, #Israel, #Syria, #China and all over the world, please consider making a contribution that will help us continue our vital work.

In the last two months alone, we have worked around-the-clock to get vital and underreported news and analysis on Iran’s revolution out to social media as well as providing critical content from the ground to major news outlets.

You may not know, The Foreign Desk is a 501C3, which means we are a non-profit news outlet that relies on generous donors like yourself to continue our operations. That also means your contributions are tax-deductible. 

At a time when the mainstream media displays bias and censorship more than ever, news consumers like you rely on free, independent journalists more than ever. 

At The Foreign Desk, we are committed to pushing back on mainstream media culture and bringing our readers and podcast listeners critical, accurate and often underreported news, highlighting stories about human rights, global security, and U.S. foreign policy.

With your help, we can continue delivering critical coverage of breaking news from around the world with our daily email, our weekly podcast, our Zoom events and daily exclusive articles, all for free. No ads. No subscriptions. No paywalls.

We humbly ask you to be our partners in this endeavor. Every dollar we raise will go to expand and develop our news platform. 

Patrons who contribute $250 or more will receive a signature The Foreign Desk red mug as a symbol of our gratitude for your support.

Happy holidays, and thank you for your loyal patronage of The Foreign Desk.

Link to donate is available in our bio.
Image Text: HELP KEEP THE FOREIGN DESK FREE DONATE NOW FOREIGN DESK Lisa's THE TOP TEN DAILY EMAIL FOREIGN DESK vithLISADAFTARI

Description:
Cross-chain DEX (decentralized exchange) aggregator Transit Swap was exploited, resulting in US$23 million lost funds, crypto auditor SlowMist said on Sunday. The hacker has returned 70% of the stolen funds, Transit Swap said on the same day.⁣
⁣
Transit Swap has not returned the funds to users, saying it is collecting data to develop a refund plan.⁣
⁣
At 4:25 p.m. Sunday Hong Kong time, SlowMist said on Twitter that US$1.07 million BUSD had been stolen. Later, it updated the amount of total stolen funds to US$23 million in a blog post.⁣
⁣
Before the hacker made the refund, Transit Swap said it had obtained the exploiter’s IP and email address and was actively reaching out.⁣
⁣
Transit Swap says they are still trying to recover the remaining 30% of the funds.⁣
⁣
In August, blockchain analytics firm Chainalysis estimated that US$2 billion worth of cryptocurrency has been drained as of August from cross-chain bridges in 2022, which accounted for 69% of total stolen funds.⁣
⁣
More at Forkast.News⁣
By: Ningwei Qin⁣
📸 Canva ⁣
⁣
#cryptocurrency #cryptocurrencies #cryptotrading #cryptonews #cryptocurrencynews #cryptomining #blockchainnews #blockchaintech #blockchaintechnology #crypto #cryptomarket #hack #stolen #funds #bitcoin #transitswap #blockchain #web3 #digitalassets #btc #fintech #exploit #invest #investors #investment #finance #technology

Description:
🏜A $100-billion package of finance is required to help #Iraq adapt to #climate_change impacts such as droughts, rebuild agriculture infrastructure destroyed by the terrorist group #ISIS, and secure the water sector after being hampered by constrictions of dams along the #Tigris and #Euphrates rivers in neighboring #Turkey and #Iran.

🏜 As high temperatures, droughts, and water scarcity made Iraq the world’s fifth most vulnerable country to “climate breakdown” according to the United Nations, Jusoor Post conducted an interview with Sahar Hussein Al Jassem, Deputy Chief of the Iraqi National Center of Climate Change (#NCCC) at the Ministry of Environment, on the sidelines of the 2022 United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP27) that was held in the Egyptian city of Sharm El-Sheikh on November 6-19.

🏜 Jassem, who is a member of a 100-member delegation that attended #COP27, told Jusoor Post that Iraq has asked for $100 billion in its Nationally Determined Contribution (#NDC) report to be distributed to the development of 13 sectors. “The priority sectors include food and water security, health, climate risks, ecological systems, and energy. We will work on these five sectors in the period between 2020 and 2025,” she said.

🏜 Consequently, in a way to convince the major financial climate institutions that Iraq is strongly in need of financing in order to be able to adapt to these climate crises, the Iraqi negotiating delegation at the COP in Sharm El-Sheikh included for the first time representation from the Iraqi parliament.

🏜 “It is the first time that the delegation includes representatives from the parliamentary committee of health and environment, because we count on COP27 when it comes to financing,” she added, noting that a series of meetings took place with financial institutions like Global Environment Facility (#GEF).

🔗 http://bit.ly/3EsVAuE

#jusoor_post
Image Text: Jusoor post Deputy Chief of Iraqi NCCC to Jusoor Post: We need $100B to adapt to climate change impacts A $100 billion package of finance is required to help Iraq adapt to climate change impacts such as droughts, rebuild agriculture infrastructure destroyed by the terrorist group ISIS よ JusoorPostEn

Description:
Apple Releases iOS 16.1 With Support for iCloud Shared Photo Library, Matter, Live Activities and More

iCloud Shared Photo Library
- Separate library for seamlessly sharing photos and videos with up to five other people
- Setup rules allow you to easily contribute past photos based on start date or people in the photos when you set up or join a library
- Library filters for quickly switching between viewing the Shared Library, your Personal Library, or both libraries together
- Shared edits and permissions let everyone add, edit, favorite, caption, and delete photos
- Sharing toggle in Camera lets you choose to send photos you take straight to the Shared Library, or enable a setting to share automatically when other participants are detected nearby using Bluetooth

Live Activities
- Live Activities from third party apps are available in the Dynamic Island and on the Lock Screen for iPhone 14 Pro models

Fitness+
- Apple Fitness+ is supported on iPhone even if you don't have an Apple Watch

Wallet
- Key sharing enables you to securely share car, hotel room, and other keys in Wallet using messaging apps such as Messages and WhatsApp

Home
- Matter, the new smart home connectivity standard, is supported enabling a wide variety of smart home accessories to work together across ecosystems

Clean Energy Charging
- New setting that can try to reduce your carbon footprint by selectively charging when lower carbon emission electricity is available

Books
- Reader controls are automatically hidden as you start reading

This update also includes bug fixes for your iPhone:
- Deleted conversations may appear in the conversations list in Messages
- Dynamic Island content is not available when using Reachability
- CarPlay may fail to connect when using a VPN app

#parisatech #iphone14 #ios #tech #lernen #vpn #apple
Image Text: PARISA PARISATECH IOS 16.1! APPLE RELEASES IOS 16.1 READ THE DESCRIPTION WINNIA

Description:
Shanzy is an Arts student. She faced a lot of transportation problems as she had to go here and there to grab her art supplies and research for different projects. So her father decided to buy her a scooty to ease her everyday life. 
Shanzy going to her university on a scooter inspired more girls in her batch to get one and go around more feasibly. Now the only problem she and her fellows were facing was the unpleasant ride because of all eyes staring at them, unwanted comments passed on the streets, and sometimes even being followed and stalked by random people. 
Being harassed in a public space made them constantly worried about physical safety and feel a heightened sense of anxiety, or to be “on edge” at all times.

Just then they were introduced to Iyzil in one of their university seminars about “Women claiming public spaces without the fear of being harassed” and how Iyzil is doing its part to assure Pakistani women are empowered for their own safety.

Shanzy learned about the app’s Responders Ring feature, added all her five scooty fellows to her Iyzil responders ring. Now she has her own scooty gang and whenever any of her fellow members face any kind of street harassment or any other emergency situations, they just hit the panic alarm and whoever’s close by comes to rescue her friend. And also, Iyzil 24x7 Professional Monitoring Team contacts them to make sure that they are safe or if the situation is serious they involve emergency service on users consent.

Shanzy and her scooty gang say that they found saviors in Iyzil's Professional Monitoring Team and feel more empowered with Iyzil when on road.
 
Now you can always Feel Safe, Stay Safe with Iyzil

For IOS: https://bit.ly/download_Iyzil_AppStore

Description:
The Binance Smart Chain (BSC) — the blockchain operated by the world’s largest crypto exchange, Binance Global inc. — has suspended operation as developers have identified a potential exploit on the network, according to an official Binance Twitter account.⁣
⁣
Blockchain security and data analytics company Peckshield Inc. tweeted on-chain analytics that suggested the network had suffered an exploit with hackers making off with roughly two million BNB, the native token of the chain, worth US$572 million.⁣
⁣
The extent of the hack and when the network will be running again are not currently known. Binance has not commented directly on the loss reported by Peckshield.⁣
⁣
The issue arose on a cross-chain bridge, BSC Token Hub, which resulted in an extra BNB token being created, Binance founder and chief executive officer, Changpeng Zhao, confirmed via Twitter.⁣
⁣
Zhao said all funds are safe and that the issue is now contained.⁣
BNB was trading down 2.9% to US$286 in the past 24 hours to 8:30 a.m. in Hong Kong.⁣
⁣
Cross-chain bridges allow for cryptocurrencies to be moved from one blockchain to another, but are considered to be highly vulnerable to exploits.⁣

Image Text: BINANCE CRYPTO BINANCE Binance suspends Smart Chain on potential exploit; Peckshield reports US$572 mln hack
description_lower:
the binance smart chain (bsc) — the blockchain operated by the world’s largest crypto exchange, binance global inc. — has suspended operation as developers have identified a potential exploit on the network, according to an official binance twitter account.⁣
⁣
blockchain security and data analytics company peckshield inc. tweeted on-chain analytics that suggested the network had suffered an exploit with hackers making off with roughly two million bnb, the native token of the chain, worth us$572 million.⁣
⁣
the extent of the hack and when the network will be running again are not currently known. binance has not commented directly on the loss reported by peckshield.⁣
⁣
the issue arose on a cross-chain bridge, bsc token hub, which resulted in an extra bnb token being created, binance founder and chief executive officer, changpeng zhao, confirmed via twitter.⁣
⁣
zhao said all funds are safe and that the issue is now contained.⁣
bnb was trading down 2.9% to us$286 in the past 24 hours to 8:30 a.m. in hong kong.⁣
⁣
cross-chain bridges allow for cryptocurrencies to be moved from one blockchain to another, but are considered to be highly vulnerable to exploits.⁣
⁣
more at forkast.news⁣
by: lachlan keller⁣
📸 binance youtube⁣
⁣

Description:
🇺🇳 The UN rights chief urged Iran Thursday to immediately halt violence against protesters, as countries debated whether to launch an investigation into Tehran's deadly crackdown.

Volker Turk opened an emergency session of the UN Human Rights Council, where countries were called to discuss Iran's "deteriorating human rights situation" and determine if a high-level international investigation is warranted.

The meeting, requested by Germany and Iceland with the backing of more than 50 countries, follows two months of protests in Iran sparked by the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, after she was arrested for an alleged breach of the country's strict dress rules for women based on Islamic sharia law.

"I call on the authorities immediately to stop using violence and harassment against peaceful protesters," said Turk, the United Nations' high commissioner for human rights.

"The unnecessary and disproportionate use of force must come to an end," he said, warning that Iran was in "a full-fledged human rights crisis."

"Accountability is a key ingredient of the pursuit of justice for human rights violations," he told the 47-member council, urging the body to vote in favour of an investigation.

Iranian authorities have grown increasingly heavy-handed in their response, as the demonstrations have spread across the country and swelled into a broad movement against the theocracy that has ruled Iran since 1979.

Turk said more than 300 people had been killed since Amini's death. Norway-based group Iran Human Rights has put the toll above 400, including more than 50 children.

"The security forces... have used live ammunition, birdshot and other metal pellets, tear gas and batons," said Turk.

#jusoor_post
Image Text: Jusoor post UN rights chief urges Iran to halt violence on protesters The UN rights chief urged Iran Thursday to immediately halt violence against protesters, as countries debated whether to launch an investigation into Tehran's deadly crackdown d JusoorPostEn

Description:
Google Chrome is by far the world’s most popular web browser used by millions around the world but in what may be a cause of concern for millions of its users it has been ranked as the most vulnerable browser by Atlas VPN, a part of Nord security.

A total of 3,159 cumulative vulnerabilities have been discovered in the popular web browser, out of which 303 have been reported this year. The Atlas VPN team has not disclosed the severity but has just published the number of vulnerabilities. The figures are from the VulDB vulnerability database. The report summarises vulnerabilities reported in the database between January 1, 2022, to October 5, 2022.

Mozilla’s Firefox browser comes second with 117 vulnerabilities, and Microsoft Edge comes third with 103 vulnerabilities, which is 61% higher than the previous year. Since its release, it has had 806 vulnerabilities in total, the report states.

Apple’s Safari is the second-most widely used browser worldwide after Google Chrome and is also the safest browser with just 26 vulnerabilities reported for 2022 and 1,139 vulnerabilities overall since its debut. The report advises users to be particularly careful while choosing plug-ins as they can be malicious and has asked users to choose only reliable providers.

Recently Indian cyber agency the Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-IN) issued a high-severity advisory regarding vulnerabilities in Chrome through which hackers can gain access and execute malicious operations in the system.

Google has one of the most transparent vulnerabilities reporting processes out of all the companies, and according to experts, the same will be fixed via updates. Current users can safeguard themselves by updating their browsers to the latest version.
.
.
.
#NewsCapital #BreakingNews #India #Google #Chrome #Browser #Safari #Firefox #Unsafe #Safe #Vulnerable #Hack #Security #Technology

Description:
I have received multiple messages from iranian women asking me to share this message — their government is shutting down their internet access and the last time this happened a massacre occurred.

Network data from NetBlocks confirm a near-total disruption disruption to internet service in parts of Kurdistan province in west Iran from the evening of Monday 19 September 2022. The regional telecommunications blackout in and around Sanandaj follows a partial disruption to internet service in Tehran and other parts of the country on Friday when protests first broke out. The Instagram social media platform and WhatsApp messaging app were subsequently restricted nationally on Wednesday 21 September, followed by a nation-scale shutdown of mobile networks.

The incidents come amid widening protests against the government after the death of Mahsa Amini from Saqqez in Kurdistan province after her arrest by Iran’s morality police for allegedly violating Iran’s strict hijab headscarf rules.

Observable connectivity was restored some 3.5 hours after the disruption came into place in Iran’s Kurdistan region, amid reports of at least four protesters killed by authorities. Users have also reported the disconnection or severe slowing of internet service in multiple cities since the first disruption was registered on Friday 16 September 2022. The network disruptions are likely to severely limit the public’s ability to express political discontent and communicate freely.

#Iran #IranCensorship #News #InternetShutDown #IranNews

Description:
DraftKings (DKNG) shares dove lower in mid-morning trading on Monday after a report from The Action Network that customer accounts were compromised.

According to the outlet, a number of customers were hit with sizable withdrawals and were locked out of accounts as hackers changed login details. The company acknowledged an account issue in a tweet late on Sunday evening via its customer support Twitter account.

“We are aware of reports of customers having issues with their accounts, and we are investigating,” the tweet read. “If any customers are having issues with their accounts, please contact Customer Experience Team at support@draftkings.com.”

The tweet received a number of angry replies from customers echoing the report’s allegations.

“Messaged the "24/7" support team multiple times as my money was being stolen,” one such reply read. “Could have easily been stopped in real time as I identified the scam immediately but no one was there on the 2 busiest sports betting days of the week.”

#dkng #draftkings #fanduel #betting #sports #sportsbetting #hack
Image Text: cubE LEARN DISCUSS INVEST 000 0010 DRAFTKINGS DROPS 10% ON REPORT OF HACK THAT DRAINED CUSTOMER ACCOUNTS WWW.CUBEWEALTH.COM

Description:
Fat women are often put into a category of fetishisation when considered sexually. This combined with the high prevalence of fat phobia in our society means when fat individuals do experience PSH it is often supercharged with entitlement and violence.

Meg- our streets now @themindfulmedic_ 
💙

👇
Our Streets Now is a campaign working to end public sexual harassment (PSH) through cultural and legislative changes. Public sexual harassment is unwanted sexual attention by strangers in public spaces including gyms, bars, parks, and the streets. PSH can be leering, unwanted comments, beeping from passing vehicles, and even following.
👇
As a campaign, we use real-life testimonies from victims in order to illustrate the impact and reality of PSH. If you would like to share your experience (s) of PSH, you can submit yours via our website.
💖

#ourstreetsnow #feminism #intersectionalfeminism #lgbtq #vawg #publicsexualharassment #catcalling #fat #fatphobia #fatphobic #bodypositivity #bodypositive #bodyneutrality

Description: ⚠️SAD BREAKING NEWS, PLEASE SHARE AND SPEAK UP FOR MAHSA AMINI WHO WAS KILLED IN POLICE CUSTODY! ⚠️ The death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini who was arrested in Tehran, Iran by morality police – a dedicated unit that enforces strict dress codes for women, such as wearing the compulsory headscarf – has sparked an outpouring of anger and widespread protests. To limit the protests and prevent this from going viral, Iran has responded with Internet blackouts and Instagram blocks, which is why we must ALL use our social platform for good to get the word out and share this sad post with our followers — we must not allow Mahsa Amini’s death to be in vain! Protests with thousands of people are growing by the day, leading to clashes with security forces and at least seven people have been killed along with several hundred people injured so far. Sadly, videos have also emerged of protestors being shot at with pellets and beaten by government soldiers as the protesters chant, “Women, life, freedom” with many women proudly removing and burning their headscarves to rounds of applause. But because of the Internet and Instagram block, many people around the world are not aware of what’s happening in Iran, so let’s all help spread these protestors’ important message by sharing this post with our followers and tagging people, celebrities, influencers and news media who need to see and share this too. Mahsa Amini is just one of thousands of women who have been arrested and tortured in Iran with their only crime being not meeting the “morality” standards of the regime so let’s speak up for her and all other women who have been treated so terribly for too long! Let’s show Iranian women that their lives matter, that the world cares, that they’re not alone in their fight! #womensrights #mahsaamini #mahsa #mahsa_amini #karmagawa

Description:
Today I’d like to support all my Iranian followers, students, and everyone impacted by the death of 22-year-old #mahsaamini and by the protests that erupted in many parts of Iran. 

I know that this is an exceptionally challenging time for those with personal ties to Iran, as people cannot get in touch with their families and friends.

I’m appalled by the continuing harassment and repression of women as I’ve always advocated for women’s independence, their right to choose what job to do, who to marry and what to wear. 

It is hard sometimes to describe what it’s like to be a woman today, but I can’t even begin to imagine what it must be like to be a woman in Iran. 

Dear Iranians, I hear you and I’m with you❤️

Description:
As internet and Social media gets banned in Iran and widespread protests have killed 31 across the country, Veteran journalist Christiane Amanpour said Thursday that an interview with Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi was scrapped after he insisted she wear a headscarf, the focus of major protests in the cleric-run state.

Amanpour, the chief international anchor of CNN who also has a show on US public broadcaster PBS, said she was ready for the interview Wednesday on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly when an aide insisted she cover her hair.

"I politely declined. We are in New York, where there is no law or tradition regarding headscarves," Amanpour, who was born in Britain to an Iranian father, wrote on Twitter.

The number of people who have died in the protests that have rocked Iran after the death of Mahsa Amini has risen to 31, AFP reported on Thursday, 22 September.

Additionally, the Iranian government also blocked access to WhatsApp and Instagram.

Instagram and WhatsApp are two of the most widely used apps in Iran after the blocking of other social media platforms in recent years like Facebook, Twitter, Telegram, YouTube, and Tiktok.

Iran has been swept by nearly a week of protests since the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who died after being arrested by morality police that enforce the clerics' rules on how women dress.
.
.
.
#TheTatva #TatvaNews #Iran #President #Hijab #Interview #Burqa #Iranian #Protest #Women #Police #Tehran

Description:
Breaking News: #TaranehAlidoosti , one of Iran's most beloved actresses, has been arrested by the Islamic Republic. IRNA reports that Taraneh Alidoosti was brutally arrested in her home in front of her daughter, for an Instagram post expressing solidarity after execution of #MohsenShekari and for posting a photo of herself without compulsory hijab holding a sign of solidarity with #WomenLifeFreedom. She is being held in section 209 of Evin prison - where prisoners are notoriously tortured - and she requested her medication. Taraneh starred in the Oscar-winning movie, The Salesman. 
Please #BeTheirVoice and share her story.
#iranrevolution #freeiran #stopexecutionsiniran
#WomenLifeFreedom #mahsaamini 

#ترانه_علیدوستی یکی از محبوب ترین بازیگران زن ایران توسط جمهوری اسلامی بازداشت شد.  به گزارشIRNA، ترانه علیدوستی به دلیل انتشار پست اینستاگرامی در ابراز همبستگی پس از اعدام #محسن شکاری و انتشار عکسی از خود بدون حجاب اجباری در حالی که نشانه همبستگی با #زن_زندگی_آزادی در دست داشت، به طرز فجیعی در خانه اش مقابل چشمان دخترش بازداشت شد.  او در بند 209 زندان اوین - جایی که زندانیان شکنجه می شوند - نگهداری می شود و درخواست داروی خود را کرده است. 
 لطفا #صدای آنها باشید و داستان او را به اشتراک بگذارید.

  #مهسا_امینی

Description:
Google Chrome is by far the world’s most popular web browser used by millions around the world but in what may be a cause of concern for millions of its users it has been ranked as the most vulnerable browser by Atlas VPN, a part of Nord security.

A total of 3,159 cumulative vulnerabilities have been discovered in the popular web browser, out of which 303 have been reported this year. The Atlas VPN team has not disclosed the severity but has just published the number of vulnerabilities. The figures are from the VulDB vulnerability database. The report summarises vulnerabilities reported in the database between January 1, 2022, to October 5, 2022.

Mozilla’s Firefox browser comes second with 117 vulnerabilities, and Microsoft Edge comes third with 103 vulnerabilities, which is 61% higher than the previous year. Since its release, it has had 806 vulnerabilities in total, the report states.

Apple’s Safari is the second-most widely used browser worldwide after Google Chrome and is also the safest browser with just 26 vulnerabilities reported for 2022 and 1,139 vulnerabilities overall since its debut. The report advises users to be particularly careful while choosing plug-ins as they can be malicious and has asked users to choose only reliable providers.

Recently Indian cyber agency the Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-IN) issued a high-severity advisory regarding vulnerabilities in Chrome through which hackers can gain access and execute malicious operations in the system.

Google has one of the most transparent vulnerabilities reporting processes out of all the companies, and according to experts, the same will be fixed via updates. Current users can safeguard themselves by updating their browsers to the latest version.

@sreevatsa.vembar writes
.
.
.
#TheTatva #TatvaNews #India #Google #Chrome #Browser #Safari #Firefox #Unsafe #Safe #Vulnerable #Hack #Security #Technology
Image Text: Get more dong สith the new Chrome Google Chrome is the most unsafe and vulnerable browser, not only surveils you 24x7 but breaches security: Report However Chrome is most used, Safari has least vulnerabilities.

Description:
TSR Staff: Tee! @Mylifeastiara
_________________
The saying is normally “it be your own kids” but this Michigan mother has definitely flipped the script! After a year of catfishing, it’s been revealed that this woman has been harassing two teens, one who was her 
daughter. 
_________________
According to @mercurynews, 42-year-old Kendra Gail Licari, was charged Monday two counts of stalking a minor, two counts of using a computer to commit a crime and one count of obstruction of justice. 

The obstruction charges come in after Licari tried to pin the mess on another minor. She went through lengths of using software to hide her location, teen slang , and certain abbreviations in hopes to throw them off. 
_________________
Law enforcement complied a total of 349 pages of harassing text messages that date back to 2021. After Licari was confronted by the FBI she reportedly made a full confession but it’s still unknown on why she started the harassment in the first place. 
_________________
Licari was released on a $5,000 bond and is expected to appear back in court December 29th. ( 📸: Isabella County Jail)
Image Text: Say What?! Teen Finds Out That Anonymous Cyberbully Who Harassed Her For A Year Was Her Mother T.R TEENS

Description:
#Georgia man, 31, pulls off biggest heist ever from inside prison as he steals $11m from billionaire and buys $4.4m atlanta mansion using smuggled-in cell phone...

14 years for a*med r*bbery allegedly impersonated a billionaire while locked up in a maximum-security prison and stole $11million - using the cash to buy a mansion in #Atlanta. 

Arthur Lee Cofield Jr, is accused of accessing the accounts of Sidney Kimmel, whose entertainment company is behind films such as 'Crazy Rich Asians' and 'Moneyball', from inside a Georgia prison with the help of contraband cell phones.

Cofield, 31, is said to have stolen the identity of the movie mogul, who is worth $1.5billion, and then moved an eight-figure-sum out of his account to purchase a $4.4million property, the Atlanta Journal-Constitution reported.

The scheme is believed to amount to one of the largest heists pulled off from inside an American prison.

Description:
#Roommates, an Iranian court has issued the first death sentence linked to recent protests, convicting the unnamed person an "enmity against God" and "spreading corruption on Earth," which has sparked outrage. According to @CNN, this comes following weeks of nationwide demonstrations sparked by the death of 22-year-old #MahsaAmini in September. The morality police had detained the Kurdish-Iranian woman for allegedly not wearing her hijab properly.
______________________
Iran's Revolutionary Court issued the sentence to the unnamed protester who allegedly set fire to a government building, reported state media. The person was convicted of "disturbing public order and peace, community, and colluding to commit a crime against national security, war and corruption on Earth, war through arson, and intentional destruction.” 
______________________
In addition, five others who participated in the protests received sentences of five to ten years in prison and will be convicted of "collusion to commit a crime against national security and disturbance of public peace and order." Reports also added that these decisions are preliminary and can be appealed. @washingtonpost also reports more than 15,000 Iranians have been arrested and several hundred killed in nearly two months of anti-government protests. 📸:(@gettyimages)
Image Text: Iran Issues First Death Sentence Linked To Recent Protests TOR

Description:
Before I left Iran in 2011, I worked as a science journalist for 14 years, besides photography. My field was a safe haven. Astronomy was ignored by the clerical state. This was not the case for social and political journalists who have been forced to be either neutral or silent, and otherwise face prison, torture, or death. Many of them live in exile, to be the only voice of Iranians. But even there, they are attacked or kidnapped by the regime forces. Their families in Iran were harmed or threatened. The regime closed all major international press offices and banned entry of foreign reporters. In 2015, @washingtonpost journalist @rezaian was one of the last who worked in Iran, and imprisoned for 1.5 year. 
In the recent posts I explained why millions are protesting on the streets in Iran, in schools, universities, markets & industries. A free press is a vital organ of any opposition. The Islamic Republic has been one of the world’s worst enemies of journalists and bloggers for 43 years. According to Reporters Without Borders rsf.org, Iran ranks 178 of 180 in the press freedom index, next to North Korea (pic 2). Over 1000 journalists & citizen-journalists have been arrested, disappeared, or murdered by the regime since 1979. This savage suppression never stopped Iranians in their movement. Now majority of 86M population demand regime change with a united voice: #WomenLifeFreedom. 
Currently, the journalists who broke the news of #MahsaAmini death in September before the uprising started, may face the death penalty for alleged espionage. #NiloofarHamedi #ElaheMohammadi (pic 3) only did their job, perfectly legal. Several photographers that I know are also arrested including @yaldamoaiery (pic 4). YouTube podcaster Jadi Mirmirani (pic 5) who received Iran science popularization award in 2021, sharing latest web technology, was arrested. Anyone who lights a candle is a potential enemy of the regime. 
About 15000 protesters, many students, are arrested so far. Some are prosecuted, without a proper lawyer. Several are handed death sentences. International attention can save many in prison, pushing for @UnitedNations resolution to stop violence on Iranian protestors.

Description:
Iconic actor Taraneh Alidoosti (Oscar-winning film The Salesman) was arrested at her home on Saturday for an @instagram post to her 8 million followers in which she criticized the Islamic Republic for imposing the death penalty on protesters after the first execution of #IranRevolution & said, "His name was Mohsen Shekari. Every international organization who is watching this bloodshed & not taking action is a disgrace to humanity.” She’s being held at the notorious Evin Prison. 

In November, she also posted a picture of herself without mandatory hijab, holding a piece of paper reading “ژن ژیان ئازادی” (Women Life Freedom).
I’m proud to be part of a coalition artists worldwide standing in solidarity with Taraneh. We’d like to invite you to post a selfie holding up a sign that says “Women Life Freedom” - the English translation of the slogan Taraneh was holding in the photo.

The IR is trying to delete all records of this photo because of the massive impact it had when she posted it.  We want to show support & solidarity for Taraneh by recreating it all over the internet & all over the world. Join us, & please sign the petition for her release—link in bio. For letter & full list of signatories, link in bio.☝🏽
#FreeTaranehAlidoosti

Description:
At least 92 members of civil society — including activists, journalists and lawyers — have been arrested in the three weeks since demonstrations broke out over the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, according to the Center for Human Rights in Iran (CHRI), a New York-based advocacy group. It is a well-honed strategy that Iran’s leaders have used for years to crush dissent and prevent protest movements from threatening their grip on power. Many of those detained have been jailed before.

Dozens of people have been killed by security forces during the nationwide demonstrations, according to rights groups, and the government has sought to blame foreign powers for the uprising. But the protesters — almost all of them young, many of them women — appear undeterred and continue demonstrating in the streets.

“They want to put anyone who can become a voice of the protesters or play a role in how these protests develop behind bars right now,” said Hadi Ghaemi, the executive director of CHRI. “The protests are leaderless and grass-roots. The impact will be determined when there’s a collective voice. And these are the kind of people that can be that collective voice.”

Journalists also have been rounded up in the crackdown, with at least 29 detained since Amini’s death in mid-September, according to CHRI. Among those detained was Niloufar Hamedi, from the Shargh daily newspaper, who was one of the first to report on Amini’s case and is now in solitary confinement in Evin, according to a tweet from her lawyer.

Read more by tapping the link in our bio.
Image Text: ែបក្ខ Iran arrests lawyers, journalists, activists over Mahsa Amini protests

Description:
@the.wellness.therapist :
To the international community, Iran has lost access to the internet. They are risking their lives by simply refusing to wear the hijab & to peacefully protest. The regime of the Islamic Republic of Iran has shut down their connection to the outside world. They are being killed in the dark. I humbly ask for your support in sharing their stories & how they are courageously risking life & limb just to be heard. 

Iranians are asking for those outside of Iran to their voice. Share their stories. Don’t let their deaths be in vain. Scroll to learn ways to help them & share this post along with others.
 

1. Repost footage of protests to all social media platforms 

The Islamic Republic of Iran regime  is blocking the internet. Iranians have to use VPN & other dangerous methods to get content out. When we reshare the videos/photos that do get out, we are helping to amplify the voices of Iranians. They want us to help get their stories out. 

Doing so also scares the regime because they don’t want the international community to see what is happening. Footage being widespread online also raises morale of Iranians to keep protesting. 

2. Use specific & creative hashtAgs to get thE word out 

Use these tags when you post: 
#mahsaamini #jinaamini #zhinaamini #Mahsa_Amini #iran #iranprotests

The tags above are designed for those who are already aware of whats happening in Iran. To get the story out to those who aren’t aware of it, use other popular hashtags such as: 

#food #fall #halloween #family #love #photography #news #politics etc. get creative! 

3. No war. No western intervention.
Keep your support focused on Iranian people fighting for their own liberation. Say No war on Iran. Iranians don’t want Western foreign intervention. They want to fight for their own liberation. They just want support from the international community. They want the atrocities documented. 

4. Organize to support iranians where you live 
Go out in the streets & make some noise. Attend support rallies in your country. DISCLAIMER: Due to sanctions against Iran, it is illegal to fundraise to send money there legally. If you see people collecting funds, be weary.

Description:
Tesla CEO Elon Musk has finally taken over as Twitter boss and his first job was to reportedly fire Indian-origin CEO Parag Agrawal, Chief Financial Officer Ned Segal, the company's policy chief Vijaya Gadde and others.⁠
⁠
According to a CNBC report citing sources on Friday, Agrawal and Segal have left the company's San Francisco headquarters and will not be returning.⁠
⁠
Gadde, the head of legal policy, trust, and safety was also fired, The Washington Post reported.⁠
⁠
(For full story head to link in bio)⁠
⁠
#tesla #elonmusk #twitter #paragagarwal #indian #spacex #musk #billionaire #ceo #starlink

Description: Repost from @karmagawa ⚠️SAD BREAKING NEWS, PLEASE SHARE AND SPEAK UP FOR MAHSA AMINI WHO WAS KILLED IN POLICE CUSTODY! ⚠️ The death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini who was arrested in Tehran, Iran by morality police – a dedicated unit that enforces strict dress codes for women, such as wearing the compulsory headscarf – has sparked an outpouring of anger and widespread protests. To limit the protests and prevent this from going viral, Iran has responded with Internet blackouts and Instagram blocks, which is why we must ALL use our social platform for good to get the word out and share this sad post with our followers — we must not allow Mahsa Amini’s death to be in vain! Protests with thousands of people are growing by the day, leading to clashes with security forces and at least seven people have been killed along with several hundred people injured so far. Sadly, videos have also emerged of protestors being shot at with pellets and beaten by government soldiers as the protesters chant, “Women, life, freedom” with many women proudly removing and burning their headscarves to rounds of applause. But because of the Internet/Instagram block, many people around the world are not aware of what’s happening in Iran, so let’s all help spread these protestors’ important message by sharing this post with our followers and tagging people, celebrities, influencers and news media who need to see and share this too. Mahsa Amini is just one of thousands of women who have been arrested and tortured in Iran with their only crime being not meeting the “morality” standards of the regime so let’s speak up for her and all other women who have been treated so terribly for too long! Let’s show Iranian women that their lives matter, that the world cares, that they’re not alone in their fight! #womensrights #mahsaamini #mahsa #mahsa_amini #karmagawa

Description:
Morteza Talaei is a retired second brigadier general with Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps.
•
He was in charge of Tehran's police in 2003 when Iranian-Canadian photojournalist Zahra Kazemi was beaten to death in custody.
•
His appearance at a Toronto-area gym last year sparked outrage and allegations that Canada is a haven for high-ranking members of Iran's regime and their relatives.
•
Kazemi was arrested in 2003 for taking photos of Tehran's notorious Evin prison, where protests were taking place over students detained by the regime.
•
Iran's government eventually admitted she had been beaten but maintains her death was accidental. The attending physician, who fled to Canada, said Kazemi showed signs of "very brutal rape," torture and head trauma before her death.
•
Now, almost 20 years after Kazemi's death, the federal government has announced it is targeting Talaei — along with three other Iranians and five entities — under the Special Economic Measures Act for gross and systemic human rights violations committed in Iran.
•
Swiss-based Iranian independent journalist Abdollah Abdi posted images of Talaei at the gym in 2021, raising questions about what he was doing in the country.
•
Abdi said Talaei later told him he was visiting his daughter but insisted it was a private matter.
•
An Iranian journalist inside Iran, Fariborz Kalantari, tweeted that the question isn't why Talaei was in Canada but rather how his daughter obtained Canadian residency.
•
The National Post was the first Canadian media outlet to report on the photos.
•
U.S.-based Iranian journalist and activist Masih Alinejad has called on Canada to find out how the former "chief of Tehran police and IRGC commander was allowed to enter the country."
•
For more on the intense pressure from the Iranian-Canadian diaspora and the Conservatives to get tough on Iran, check our link in bio.

•
•
•
(Photos and Video: Raheb Homavandi/Reuters, Abdi Media - Abdolla Abdi/Twitter, Masih Alinejad/Twitter; Reporting: Ashley Burke, Nahayat Tizhoosh/CBC News) #CBC #CBCNews #Iran #Sanctions #Canada #MahsaAmini #IranProtests

Description:
The niece of Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is calling on people to pressure their governments to cut ties with Tehran over its violent suppression of anti-government protests. 

In a video posted online by her France-based brother, Farideh Moradkhani urged “conscientious people of the world” to support Iranian protesters. The video was shared this week after her reported arrest on Nov. 23, according to the U.S.-based rights monitor HRANA.

The unrest, now going on three months, was sparked by the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in police custody in Tehran for violating the Islamic Republic’s strict dress code. Protesters have faced a brutal crackdown by Iranian security forces using live ammunition, rubber bullets and tear gas. At least 451 people have been killed, including 63 minors, according to HRANA. Another 18,173 have been detained, the rights monitor reports.

Moradkhani is a longtime activist whose late father (married to Khamenei’s sister) was an opposition figure. The branch of the family has opposed Khamenei for decades and Moradkhani has previously been imprisoned for her activism.

Link in bio for more.

Image Text: IRAN IRAN Farideh Moradkhani, niece of ranian leader, asks world to cut ties with Iran to support protestors POLITICO
description_lower:
the niece of iranian supreme leader ayatollah ali khamenei is calling on people to pressure their governments to cut ties with tehran over its violent suppression of anti-government protests. 

in a video posted online by her france-based brother, farideh moradkhani urged “conscientious people of the world” to support iranian protesters. the video was shared this week after her reported arrest on nov. 23, according to the u.s.-based rights monitor hrana.

the unrest, now going on three months, was sparked by the death of 22-year-old mahsa amini in police custody in tehran for violating the islamic republic’s strict dress code. protesters have faced a brutal crackdown by iranian security forces using live ammunition, rubber bullets and tear gas. at least 451 people have been killed, including 63 minors, according to hrana. another 18,173 have been detained, the rights monitor reports.

moradkhani is a longtime activist whose late father (married to khamenei’s sister) was an opposition figure. the branch of the family has opposed khamenei for decades and moradkhani has previously been imprisoned for her activism.

link in bio for more.

Description:
SpaceX hosted a demo flight to showcase the capabilities of Starlink satellite internet service on a private jet last week as the internet service vies for more customers.

During a one-hour flight from Burbank to San Jose, California, SpaceX demonstrated the capabilities of Starlink to deliver WiFi for Netflix, YouTube, as well as video chats from 30,000 feet in the air, Bloomberg reported.

Bloomberg previously reported that SpaceX has pitched its internet service to four of the largest airline carriers in the US, including Delta, to no avail. The publication said that Musk's technology uses smaller and lower-flying satellites than competitors, which allows the WiFi signal to arrive faster. But, the smaller satellites might not be enough to power larger planes with more user demand, Bloomberg said. SpaceX has said Starlink can service planes of all sizes.

What's more, regulators have expressed doubt in SpaceX's satellite internet service. In August, the Federal Communications Commission rejected a $866 million subsidy for Starlink, saying the company "failed to demonstrate that the providers could deliver the promised service" and labeling it a "still-developing technology."

Read the full story by Grace Kay at the link in our bio.

(Credit: Rachael Lupton/Insider, Saul Martinez and AaronP/Bauer-Griffin via Getty)

#spacex #elonmusk #starlink #wifi #satellite #airplane

Description:
Is there a line in this song resonates with you most?

An Iranian protest anthem that has become the soundtrack to the national uprising was again thrust into the international spotlight over the weekend when @coldplay performed a cover and broadcast it live around the world.

The British band played the song, Baraye, in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on Friday and Saturday night at the start of their world tour, with the exiled Iranian actor @golfarahani on stage and singing in Farsi.

Baraye, which means “For …” or “Because of …”, was written by one of Iran’s most popular musicians, @shervinine, with verses taken from online posts by Iranians explaining why they have been demonstrating against the country's regime. Days after the song was released, the 25-year-old was arrested and his song deleted from Instagram.

Iran has been gripped by protests since the death in custody on 16 September of Mahsa Amini, a 22-year-old of Kurdish origin who was arrested in Tehran by the “morality police” over her headscarf. Amini was allegedly beaten, taken to hospital in a coma and later died.

Since then, protests led by women have been met with violence by authorities, with at least 270 people dead and 14,000 arrested, according to the group Human Rights Activists in Iran.

Friday’s concert was streamed via satellite to cinemas in 81 countries, although not in Iran, where playing or singing the song could lead to arrest.

#Iran #Baraye #Coldplay #GolshiftehFarahani #ShervinHajipour
Image Text: Coldplay perform. Iranian protest song with exiled actor

Description:
Priyanka Chopra, who left India to be with her husband Nick Jonas in the US, is known for not just acting but also for actively participating in events of the United Nations and UNICEF. 

The actress, who in 2000 won the Miss World beauty pageant often speaks up for girl empowerment, girl child rights, gender issues, and the importance of education on global platforms. 

Priyanka Chopra recently interviewed US Vice President Kamala Harris after representing India at the UN General Assembly (UNGA). From abortion laws to equal pay, the actress discussed some of the most important issues with Harris during their interaction. 

Amid the ongoing Iran protests, Priyanka Chopra aka PeeCee has lent her support to the courageous women of Iran and has also encouraged people to add their voices to this movement that erupted after following the death of a young woman named Mahsa Amini. 

On Friday, Priyanka triggered a controversy with her remarks on the ongoing Iran protests. While many in India lauded the actress for taking a stand, others questioned the actress for ignoring similar issues rampant in India. 

Taking to Twitter, a user wrote, "Priyanka Chopra’s concern for Iranian women is hugely appreciated, but her silence on Bilkis Bano and the state-enabled persecution of Muslims, especially marginalised women in her home country, India is worth introspection ?" 

Another said, "Celebrities can’t gain woke points by speaking about issues outside of their country, while simultaneously ignoring similar issues that are rampant in India." While a third person on the micro-blogging platform wrote, "Priyanka Chopra comes out in support of everyone except Indians." 

"Your activism of convenience is pukeworthy. This means nothing when you choose to look away from the plight of hijabi women in India who are denied education for wearing a piece of cloth over their head, harassed by hindutva goons and state. You are a Hypocrite!" another wrote on Twitter.
Image Text: it +ENT ENT 'You're A Hypocrite', Priyanka Chopra Receives Severe Backlash For Supporting Iran Protesters

Description:
On Sunday, reports emerged that the personal data of approximately 400 million Twitter users had been compromised and put up for sale on the dark web. 

The hacked data includes users' names, email addresses, phone numbers, and other information from organizations such as the World Health Organization, NASA, and the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting. 

The hacker responsible for the breach has reportedly contacted Twitter, threatening the company with potential fines under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) for the data leak. 

The hacker has also offered to sell the data and stated that they are willing to work with middlemen. Some experts believe that the data leak may have been caused by a flaw in the API.

#indianstartupnews #news #starup #business #twitter #hack #data #API #hacked #stolen
Image Text: ISN Twitter data of 40 crore users, including Sundar Pichai and Salman Khan, up for sale on dark web indianstartupnews.com

Description:
🚨 Caught up. A #Michigan woman is accused of targeting two teens in a year-long #catfishing scheme where she harassed them on social media.

Kendra Licari, 42, was charged earlier this week with two counts of stalking a minor, two counts of using a computer to commit the crime and another count of obstruction of justice. 

According to FBI investigators, Licari targeted her daughter and her daughter’s boyfriend since last December and attempted to cover up her act by filing a complaint with the Beal City Schools‘ administration. 

Around that time, Licari worked as a girls‘ basketball coach at the school and at the end of the season, she was asked not to return due to coaching changes.

School district officials said the cyber bullying occurred off of school grounds and the school’s devices were not used. 

They decided to involve local authorities to look into the case as the harassment started in early 2021. 

Isabella County prosecutor David Barberi said the investigation was intense since Licari allegedly used slang to make it seem like the catfish was the same age as her daughter.

After authorities were stuck with no other options, they turned to FBI’s computer crime deviation in April and discovered a few months later that they believed Licari was involved in the cyberbullying. 

Superintendent William Chilman said in a statement that the FBI officials were able to track down the IP addresses used to send the messages to her daughter.

After Licari was confronted about the cyber harassment, she broke down and made a full confession. 

She was released often her arraignment and faces multiple charges which included using a computer to commit the crime, stalking a minor, and obstruction of justice. Each count is a five-year felony.

However, it is unclear why Licari committed the crime and she is expected to appear in court on December 29.
Image Text: TEEN DISCOVERS ANONYMOUS CYBERBULLY WHO HARASSED HER FOR A YEAR WAS HER MOTHER J JACKFROOT

Description:
According to a report by research-based online publication Cybernews, the phone numbers of 487 million WhatsApp users have been stolen and sold on a "well-known" hacker forum which includes information of 3.8 Million Bangladeshi users. 

The database, supposedly from 2022, contains users from 84 nations, including the US, the UK, Egypt, Italy, and India. All of the numbers, according to the hacker responsible for the attack, belong to WhatsApp users who appear to be "active."

According to the report, the stolen database contains the phone numbers of over 32 million US customers and over 11.5 million UK subscribers. However, it appears that the breach most heavily impacted Egyptian users, with approximately 45 million people possibly at risk.

Additionally, the hacker claims to be in possession of over 35 million Italian user phone numbers, close to 10 million Russian user numbers, and over 6 million Indian user phone numbers.

With over two billion monthly active users worldwide, WhatsApp may have experienced one of, if not the largest data breaches in its history.

Source: https://www.thedailystar.net/tech-startup/news/data-over-500-million-whatsapp-users-stolen-report-3180786

Description:
Caroline Farrow is a mother of five and married to a Catholic priest. As a Christian, her views on family and gender could be described as socially conservative. Her belief that men are born men and can’t change to be women and vice versa are traditional views that have been the norm since the world began. But now such views, according to the police, are hateful.

“On Monday, 3 October officers attended an address in the Guildford area as part of an investigation into allegations of malicious communications (sending of indecent, grossly offensive messages, threats, or information) and harassment.

“A 48-year-old woman was arrested on suspicion of both offences,” Surrey Police said in a statement. Read more, link in bio.
Image Text: GP UK Catholic Mother Arrested In England in Front of Her Children Over Anonymous Posts on Chat Room and Twitter Posts Read More wwW w.thegatewaypundit.com

Description:
“Bricks of a revolution”
On view at Four Freedom park through Jan 1st, Part of the “eyes on Iran” Exhibition
Organized by @forfreedoms 

Engraved with the names of a fraction of those arrested during this revolution, these bricks represent the strength of the activists who are currently risking their lives, inside and outside prisons, to fight oppression. This installation is an homage to political prisoners and all those bravely paving the way to revolution in Iran. 

The Islamic Republic is heavily suppressing all forms of dissent and opposition. 
Your attention matters.
#MahsaAmini #مهسا_امینی 

Since 16 September 2022, Iranian people have taken to the streets to protest against the Islamic Republic following the brutal murder of Mahsa Jina Amini, a young Kurdish woman, at the hands of government forces. 

The Islamic Republic has been a major source of oppression against women, religious and ethnic minorities, and Iranian society as a whole. Freedom is non-existent, the economy is deteriorating, the environment is degraded. Protests spanning across 146 cities have rapidly turned into Iran’s first ever feminist-led revolutionary movement. Its motto is “Jin, Jiyan, Azadi” in Kurdish, “Zan, Zendegi, Azadi” in Farsi, or “Woman, Life, Freedom” in English. 

Over 18,000 people have been arrested since the start of this revolution. Amongst them are people of all genders, ages, beliefs, and sexual orientations: children, striking workers, artists, lawyers, actresses, athletes, nurses and doctors, students and teachers, families of those arrested or killed. All those actively opposing the current regime know they are at risk of incarceration.

In addition, the Islamic Republic’s parliament has formally called upon the judiciary to impose death penalties against all jailed protesters. Though few have been sentenced to death so far, this move provides the grounds for others to suffer the same faith. Even one death sentence is one too many. This is one of the many strategies used by the government to deter opposition and protest. Other strategies include violence, torture, rape, as well as intimidation, harassment, and threats against activists and their families.

Description: At this point, it seems extremely clear that Donald Trump violated several laws by spiriting government documents out of the White House to Mar-a-Lago and refusing to give them back. But if the Justice Department is going to charge him, it probably needs more than a provable legal violation. Some combination of bad faith on Trump’s part and real harm to the government would likely do the trick. The bad faith has been proven many times over in the form of Trump lying repeatedly to the government and even moving documents around to apparently evade detection. As far as real harm goes, the Washington Post’s latest report states that the stolen documents “included highly sensitive intelligence regarding Iran and China” that “could expose intelligence-gathering methods that the United States wants to keep hidden from the world.” Read the latest on the increasingly significant stakes of Trump’s legal troubles at the link in bio.
Image Text: Nen EW ORK: Uh-oh: Trump's Stolen Documents Had Classified Info on China and Iran CHAIT: BY JONATHAN

Description:
How did the prime minister get his facts so wrong?
•
It’s a question many people were asking after Justin Trudeau sent out a now-deleted tweet on Nov. 14, denouncing "the Iranian regime's barbaric decision to impose the death penalty on nearly 15,000 protestors."
•
In fact, as of Nov. 16 a total of five protesters now face the death penalty.
•
Three protesters were sentenced that day, as reported by Iranian state media and foreign news outlets. Two others were sentenced on Nov. 13 and 15.
•
So how did Canada’s leader and other celebrities get fooled? 
•
It would appear that Trudeau fell victim to misinformation, the kind in which snippets of information get mashed together to produce something false and misleading.
•
Trudeau's office said the tweet was based on "initial reporting that was incomplete and lacked necessary context," pointing to news stories from Newsweek and Yahoo News. (Newsweek has since corrected its story.) 
•
But the damage was done.
•
Multiple state-linked media outlets in Iran have taken aim at Trudeau on Twitter, with one depicting him in clown makeup and labelling the prime minister a "fake news maker." 
•
Ouch.
•
There are ways to avoid such missteps, even if you aren’t a world leader. Check out this post for tips on spotting misinformation and stopping its spread.
•
•
•
(Reporting: Laura McQuillan/CBC, Marie-Danielle Smith/The Canadian Press; Photos: Justin Tang/The Canadian Press, AFP/Getty Images, West Asia News Agency/Reuters, Leon Neal/Getty Images, Ozan Kose/AFP/Getty Images, Angela Weiss/AFP/Getty Images, Photo illustration: Kacper Pempel/Reuters) #Iran #IranProtests #Misinformation #JustinTrudeau #Canada #Twitter #CBC #CBCNews

Description:
Elon Musk shared an idea for a potential Twitter competitor with his brother Kimbal Musk ahead of offering to purchase the company, according to a series of private texts that were released amid Musk's court battle with Twitter.⁠
⁠
"I think a new social media company is needed that is based on a blockchain and includes payments," Musk texted Kimbal Musk on April 10, the same day he announced he would no longer be joining Twitter's board of directors.⁠
⁠
The billionaire had outlined his idea for the social media company the day before.⁠
⁠
(For full story head to link in bio)⁠
⁠

Description:
🙏please share🙏
#SoheilaGolestani
Iranian actress-director Soheila Golestani was abducted from her home by #Iran’s security forces in #Tehran last week and taken to an unknown location after she published and appeared in a viral video staging a silent #protest with her colleagues without the #hijab. The video was a symbolic act of defiance in support of women’s rights and the revolutionary uprising which has swept Iran since the death of #MahsaAmini, a 22-year-old Kurdish woman who was murdered while in custody of the morality police in Tehran.⁠
⁠
“Our true heroes are the nameless people. We do not cross out our mistakes. We practice and learn again. The ways are countless and the hope for a new day is strong,” Soheila wrote on her Instagram just before she was abducted. Her colleague, theatre Director Hamid Pourazari who appears in the video was also detained and taken to an unknown location by security forces. ⁠
⁠
There are growing concerns over the health of Soheila who suffers from a rare brain tumor and epilepsy and is at risk of seizures without medication and medical care. The Islamic Republic continues to deny vulnerable prisoners access to lifesaving healthcare and limits contact with their families. ⁠
⁠
The campaign of mass arrests in recent months which includes a growing number of women artists, journalists, activists and children is an attempt to silence voices and opposition. Those who are detained risk long prison sentence, torture and the death penalty. ⁠
⁠
TYTW is deeply concerned by reports of these arbitrary mass abductions and arrests of women and girls. TYTW stands with the brave women of Iran, and across the globe, fighting for #humanrights and bodily autonomy for women and girls everywhere. We must not allow the Islamic Republic of Iran to silence these women’s voices. Please share this post and bring global attention to the plight faced by the women and girls of Iran.

REPOST from: 
 @tooyoungtowed 
🙏💐🙏

Description:
Iran has arrested a prominent actress Taraneh Alidoosti days after she criticized the execution of a man who was involved in the nationwide protests. Alidoosti had condemned the hanging of Mohsen Shekari, who was killed in December in the first known execution linked to the protests, according to CNN.

Taraneh Alidoosti was arrested as there was a “lack of evidence for her claims,” CNN reported citing Fars news agency. In November, Alidoosti shared a picture of herself on Instagram without the Islamic hijab and holding a sign reading “Women, Life, Freedom” to offer support for the protest movement.

After Shekari’s execution, Taraneh Alidoosti in another post said, “Your silence means supporting tyranny and tyrants,” adding that “every international organization who is watching this bloodshed and not taking action, is a disgrace to humanity,” according to CNN. Since then, her account on Instagram has been deleted. She has featured in the 2016 Oscar-winning movie, “The Salesman” and has starred in various popular Iranian TV shows.

In its report on Alidoosti, Fars news agency said, “Some celebrities make claims without evidence and publish provocations and have been thus arrested,” according to CNN. The local rights group, Committee to Counter Violence Against Women in Iranian Cinema, in a post on Twitter said that it wasn’t clear which government department had taken Alidoosti into custody.

Earlier in November, Taraneh Alidoosti denied reports that claimed that she had left Iran. Alidoosti announced that she planned to live in Iran and affirmed her support for the families of prisoners.

According to CNN, Taraneh Alidoosti wrote, “I will stand by the families of prisoners and the killed and will demand justice for them. I will fight for my home and I will pay any cost to stand for my rights.”

As per the news report, several Iranians have been sentenced to death by execution during the nationwide protests which erupted after the death of 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini. Amini was arrested by Iran’s ‘morality police’ for allegedly not wearing her hijab properly. According to Norway-based Iran Human Rights, 458 people have been killed in the unrest since September.
Image Text: ANTI-HIJAB PROTEST IRAN ARRESTS PROMINENT ACTRESS TARANEH ALIDOOSTI FOR SUPPORTING ANTI-HIJAB PROTESTS Earlier in November, Taraneh Alidoosti denied reports that claimed that she had left ran. Alidoosti announced thatshe planned to live in Iran and affirmed her support for the families of prisoners. siasat.com

Description:
Open Letter to Governor Dapo Abiodun of Ogun State, Nigeria.

Dear Gov. Dapo Abiodun,

I am writing to bring your attention to the harassment going on with our youths in your state.

I hereby demand that no son or daughter of Yoruba Land should be molested or harassed for wearing Yoruba Nation outfits by the  DSS or any Security Personnel. We would not allow such in Ogun State or any Yoruba State.

All Sons and Daughters of Yoruba have right to Self Determination according to United Nation and African Union. 
We have rights to peacdful gathering, and all our Yoruba Nation rallies since last year till date have  been peaceful.

Again, All Yorùbá sons and daughters have the right to wear any Yoruba outfit any day and any time within Yoruba States.

Thank you.

Chief(Dr) Sunday Adeyemo
Igboho Oosha.
Image Text: PODIUMNEWS TOR HEADLINES OPEN LETTER TO GOVERNOR OF OGUN STATE, NIGERIA- CHIEF (DR) SUNDAY ADEYEMO IGBOHO

Description:
Meghan stands with Iranian Women🇮🇷💛: As you would have seen on my previous post Meghan showed support for Iranian women. You may recall, the Archewell President,  @mandanadayani is an Iranian-born and American activist, attorney, entrepreneur! She reports directly to the Sussexes and she started in June 2021!

Her role 👩🏻‍💼: She oversees growth strategy and day-to-day operations at the organisation, which includes the nonprofit Archewell Foundation as well as the media businesses Archewell Audio and Archewell Productions. 

@mandanadayani’s statement at the time: “I am so inspired by the vision and unwavering dedication of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex to create a more united, truthful, safe, and equitable world. I am thrilled to build upon our shared mission to drive systemic cultural change.”

Meghan was invited to speak at Spotify's female-run employee resource group, Women @Spotify, which is an employee-led group that fosters inclusivity and build community on Tuesday. She spoke at the event on feminist issues, wearing a shirt that had the message: "Women. Life. Freedom," written in the Farsi language. During her talk, Meghan praised the "courage" of protesters in Iran, who have been protesting since 16 September following the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini. Mahsa died in police custody on 16 September after she was arrested for allegedly incorrectly wearing the hijab. Eyewitnesses say she was beaten by police while in custody, resulting in her death. 

#meghanmarkle #duchessofsussex #royals #podcast  #royalfamily #archetypes #dontbelievethetype #iran #iranprotests #mashaamini

Description:
This is what the protests in Iran are about: women, life, freedom.

➡️Woman: the creatrix of life
➡️Life: the freedom to live
➡️Freedom: the opportunity for life

It’s all connected♻️

When you suppress one, you suppress all 

These protests are much more than the right to show our hair 

It’s the right to be seen as an equal🟰 
Not as a fraction of a human like we are considered under Iranian law today (and I am a citizen)

In Iran, a woman’s voice is considered half of a man for in court for every one male witness you need two women. Because only 2 womens voices can be equal to 1 mans.. can you imagine?

And this is just one of the many rights we are fighting for

The right to have custody of our children (even an abusive husband gets full custody)
The right to travel without a man’s permission
The right to be in positions of power
The right to equal land
The right to sing
The right to dance

The right to exist as a female

Without being seen as a threat or distraction that must be covered by weak men

Right now young women are the biggest threat to this regime
They are targeting us because they fear our wisdom, our courage, our ferocity for truth

My prayer is that woman, life and freedom can be honored in Iran and around the world 

And that we don’t need another hashtag of another name of one of our lost ones💔

Baraye Azadi. For freedom. 

Please share this post to raise awareness as right now the media is not reporting on this + they’ve shut off internet in Iran so people don’t talk about the massacres occurring

I also did a recent @highestselfpodcast explaining what is going on in Iran, which you can tune in on profile 🙏🏽

#mahsaamini #jinaamini #nikashakarami #hananehkia #freeiran #iranprotests #womenlifefreedom #barayeazadi #shervinhajipour #zhinaamini

Description:
Iranian women are brave & ferocious ✊🏽
The way Iranian women who are in the elite use their privilege for the voice of their people makes me realize what we do here in the West is not enough. 
How are we using our privilege ? 
She is doing this for basic human rights for all Iranians. 💔

#Repost @iraniandiasporacollective
・・・
#TaranehAlidoosti, one of Iran’s most beloved actresses’, has been arrested by the Islamic Republic. IRNA reports that Taraneh Alidoosti was arrested in her home in front of her daughter, a week after an Instagram post expressing solidarity after the execution of #MohsenShekari. Taraneh starred in the Oscar-winning movie, The Salesman. The last image shows a group of well-known Iranian cinematographers and artists gathering in front of #Evin Prison this morning as a show of support for her. Please #BeTheirVoice and share her story. 

#iranrevolution #freeiran #stopexecutionsiniran #womanlifefreedom

Description: Iranian state broadcaster was hacked! Iran's semi-official Tasnim News Agency reported that the 9 p.m. newscast by the Islamic Republic of Iran News Network (IRINN) under Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting (IRIB) was hacked for a few moments by anti-revolutionary elements. The clip of the incident shows IRIB/IRINN airing a segment on Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei attending a meeting in the southern city of Bushehr, which was interrupted with a video of a cartoon mask with a beard and heavy brows against a black backdrop. The video of the mask was followed by a screen showing a photo of Khamenei with a target superimposed on his face alongside photos of Nika Shahkarami, Hadis Najafi, Mahsa Amini, and Sarina Esmailzadeh - all young women who have died in Iran in the last month. Amini, 22, died after being detained by morality police. The other three, two of them just teenagers, died in the protest movement that has erupted since Amini's death. Alongside the photos on screen was a message that read, "Join us and rise up" and "The blood of our youth is dripping from your grip," along with the social media handles for the hacker group Edaalat-e Ali, which translates to Ali's Justice. The image remained on screen for several seconds. Edaalat-e Ali took credit for the hack, posting the clip on their social media account saying, "On the request of people, we fulfilled our promise and did the unthinkable to free Iran." Nationwide protests have gripped Iran for weeks following the death of Amini after she was taken into custody by the government's morality police for apparently not wearing her hijab properly. Her death has sparked violent clashes between demonstrators and authorities, reportedly leaving scores dead. #computerscience #iran #computerengineering #IoT #AI #cybersecurity #hacking #hacker #pentest #tech #code #coding #python #php #linux #java #webdev #programming #webdeveloper #digital #technology #security thecybersecurityhub.com
Image Text: Iran state TV hacked during live news broadcast

Description:
A 5.8-magnitude earthquake was recorded in southern Iran today at 7.17pm, UAE time, according to the UAE's National Centre of Meteorology (NCM).

The NCM has confirmed it was "slightly felt by residents without any effect in the UAE".

A number of residents in Dubai have reportedly felt tremors, according to tweets.

Read more on the Khaleej Times website.

#UAE #Iran #Earthquake #KhaleejTimes
Image Text: UAE residents feel tremors as 5.8- magnitude earthquake hits southern Iran KT

Description:
The U.S. Soccer Federation briefly removed the emblem of the Islamic Republic from Iran’s flag in the federation’s social media posts. U.S. Soccer released a statement saying it made the change to show “support for the women in Iran fighting for basic human rights.” The official flag returned to U.S. social media posts Sunday afternoon.

The federation also replaced the vertical red bars on the U.S. crest with rainbow-colored ones in support of LGBTQ rights, but it displayed the altered crest only in areas visible to the players, staff members and media.

#worldcup #worldcup2022 #worldcupqatar2022 #worldcupqatar 

Read more at the link in bio.
📷: Ashley Landis / Associated Press
Image Text: ROBUSON 10 MYAR U.S. Soccer Federation briefly protests Iran ahead of Tuesday's World Cup match. Los Angeles Times

Description:
The U.S. Soccer Federation briefly removed the emblem of the Islamic Republic from Iran’s flag in the federation’s social media posts. U.S. Soccer released a statement saying it made the change to show “support for the women in Iran fighting for basic human rights.” The official flag returned to U.S. social media posts Sunday afternoon.

The federation also replaced the vertical red bars on the U.S. crest with rainbow-colored ones in support of LGBTQ rights, but it displayed the altered crest only in areas visible to the players, staff members and media.

#worldcup #worldcup2022 #worldcupqatar2022 #worldcupqatar 

Read more at the link in bio.
📷: Ashley Landis / Associated Press
Image Text: ROBUSON 10 MYAR U.S. Soccer Federation briefly protests Iran ahead of Tuesday's World Cup match. Los Angeles Times

Description:
​Iranian authorities arrested one of the country’s most renowned actresses Saturday on charges of spreading falsehoods about nationwide protests that grip the country, state media said.⁠
⁠
The report by IRNA said Taraneh Alidoosti, star of the Oscar-winning movie “The Salesman,” was detained a week after she made a post on Instagram expressing solidarity with the first man recently executed for crimes allegedly committed during the protests.⁠
⁠
The announcement is the latest in a series of celebrity arrests, that have included footballers, actors and influencers, in response to their open display of support for anti-government demonstrations now in their third month⁠
⁠
According to the report published on the state media’s official Telegram channel, Alidoosti was arrested because she did not provide ’’any documents in line with her claims.″⁠
⁠
It said that several other Iranian celebrities had also ″been summoned by the judiciary body over publishing provocative content,″ and that some had been arrested. It provided no further details.""⁠
​- AP⁠
​⁠
​​​🔗Head to our bio to download the Ground News app and compare the articles of 251 sources covering this story.

Description:
More than 5.4 million Twitter user records, including personal phone numbers and email addresses, are up for grabs on the dark web in a massive data dump that some believe the Elon Musk-owned firm is attempting to cover up.

The data dump was identified by Chad Loder, the founder of cyber security awareness company Habitu8, who shared the news in a post to his Twitter account on November 23 - and his account was suspended shortly after posting.

Loder announced the attack impacted users in the European Union and the United States and the data exposed is enough to unleash phishing attacks to obtain login credentials. 

Removing Loder's tweets and suspension has sparked concerns that Twitter is trying to hide the issue, with some Twitter users saying Musk 'banned [Loder] for exposing how weak Twitter security is.'

The user data was first posted on a hacking forum with a $30,000 price tag in July, but the recent sale offers this information for free, according to Bleeping Computer.

Source: https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-11477871/Twitter-hack-sees-5-4-MILLION-phone-numbers-email-addresses-leaked-dark-web.html

Description:
People who have thrived online are finding their once-pleasant social networks increasingly toxic. One solution has been migrating—from Facebook to LinkedIn, for instance. Another is putting on a virtual mask: VTubers—or virtual streamers—say they can have a big online presence without the unpleasant side effects.⁠
⁠
Derived from “virtual YouTuber,” VTubers use avatars or images to portray themselves online while keeping their offline identities mostly hidden.⁠
⁠
Several times a week, hundreds of people log onto Amazon’s Twitch service to watch a Betty Boop-like cartoon character named Pumpkin Potion. The person behind the avatar, Rachel Gravelle, plays piano and chats with her audience about what’s going on in her life for up to seven hours at a time. In nine months, Pumpkin has attracted more than 15,000 followers.⁠
⁠
The growing interest in posing as an avatar raises the question: Why be famous and anonymous at the same time? Some didn’t find an audience streaming as themselves, or found being on-camera tiring. Some choose to stay incognito to avoid the harassment or negativity that many popular creators face.⁠
⁠
“When interacting with the audience, my words and actions are genuinely Rachel,” Gravelle said. “It’s me, but with an old-timey coat of paint.”⁠
⁠
Read more at the link in our bio.⁠
⁠
Photo Illustration: @rrebekkaa
Image Text: LIVE le! 1 होतति How to Be Internet Famous and Anonymous at the Same Time Cartoons, anime characters and digital pets are taking over Twitch as virtual streamers grow their followings- without revealing their faces or names. WSJ
