Description:
Now that the UN has removed Iran from the Council for the Study of Women, the media thinks that all is done. I was very hesitant to publish the emails of the CEO's of some of the major media companies. There is no doxxing going on here. I have included an email that you can use if you want. Be respectful. Chances are there's a gatekeeper that will read it first, but if we send enough emails, they'll have to take action:

suzanne.scott@foxnews.com
Ben.Sherwood@disney.com
Joseph.Ianniello@cbs.com
JShell@nbcuni.com (NBC/MSNBC)
jason.kilar@warnermediagroup.com (CNN)
gpruitt@ap.org Gary Pruitt
paul.gigot@wsj.com 
dbaquet@nytimes.com Dean Baquet
tim.ryan@latimes.com
graham@washpost.com Donald Graham
edward.felsenthal@time.com
tim.davie@bbc.co.uk
Catherine.Tait@cbc.ca

Email template:
---------------
Dear [Media Exec],

I am writing to express my concern over the lack of coverage of the ongoing protests in Iran and the reported executions of protestors. As leaders in the media industry, it is your responsibility to inform the public about important events happening around the world, and the situation in Iran deserves urgent attention.

As you are likely aware, the people of Iran have been protesting in large numbers against the government and its policies, with some reports suggesting that the protests may be the largest the country has seen in decades. These protests are a crucial moment in Iran's history and deserve the attention of the international community, including the news media.

Furthermore, there have been disturbing reports of the Iranian government cracking down on the protests with violence, including the use of live ammunition and the execution of protestors. It is essential that these reports be investigated and covered in the media in order to hold the Iranian government accountable for its actions and to provide a voice for the protestors.

I urge your news organizations to prioritize covering the Iran protests and the reported executions of protestors. The people of Iran deserve to have their stories heard and their struggles highlighted in the face of such grave injustices.

Sincerely, 
[Your Name]
---------------

💚🤍❤️ #mahsaamini
Image Text: Wake Up and Report On Iran

Description:
The government in Iran is committing unprecedented atrocities, including against women and children. More atrocities will take place without meaningful global action.

We've outlined how the international community can help stop the carnage in a briefing available on our website. You can help support our advocacy work with world governments by urging your elected representative to call for the establishment of an urgent special session at the UN Human Rights Council so that governments can collectively address the violence against protesters, and establish an independent mechanism with investigative, reporting, and accountability functions to address the Islamic Republic’s crimes.

Description:
Iranian security forces have intensified a crackdown on anti-government protests in several Kurdish cities, as demonstrations elsewhere in Iran appeared to spread to the country's vital energy sector.

While university students have played a pivotal role in the protests with dozens of universities on strike, unconfirmed reports on social media showed workers at Abadan and Kangan oil refineries and the Bushehr petrochemical plant have joined in.

A video on Twitter showed dozens of workers blocking the road to the Bushehr site in Assaluyeh on Iran's Gulf coast, and chanting "death to the dictator".

Iran's Oil Ministry was not immediately available to comment.

Protests have swept the country since Mahsa Amini, a 22-year-old from Iran's Kurdish region, died on September 16 while being held for "inappropriate attire", marking one of the boldest challenges to the Islamic Republic since the 1979 revolution.

That revolution, in which the clergy swept to power, was helped by a combination of mass demonstrations and strikes by oil workers and Bazaar merchants.

However, analysts say the Iranian regime will likely contain unrest for now, and prospects of an imminent dawn of a new political order are slim.

See the link in our bio for the full article. 

#ABCNews #Iran #MahsaAmini #NewsUpdate

Description:
Ukraine has quickly devolved into a bottomless money pit for the countless nations and corporations that have been bankrolling its war against Russia.

On Friday, billionaire Elon Musk hilariously trolled a pro-Ukraine reporter who tweeted that SpaceX may no longer be able to supply its Starlink satellite internet terminals free to Ukraine due to the prohibitive costs of operating them.

In response to the Kiev Post correspondent's tweet noting that the move "comes days after Ukrainian Ambassador @MelnykAndrij told Musk to 'f*** off,' the SpaceX founder quipped: "We're just following his recommendation."

Get the full story at the link in our bio. 

#ukraine #ambassador #elonmusk #starlink #conservative #news

Description:
Jamaican Olympic sprinter Usain Bolt has reportedly lost $12 million from an account he had with Kingston-based investment firm Stocks and Securities Limited.

Bolt was recently told there was only about $12,000 remaining in the account, his lawyer Linton P. Gordon said in a phone interview, according to Bloomberg.

The account was said to be part of Bolt’s retirement and lifetime savings.

“It’s distressful news for anyone. And certainly in the case of Mr. Bolt, who established this account as part of his private pension,” Gordon said on Wednesday.

Jamaica’s Financial Services Commission on Tuesday said it had installed its own temporary manager at SSL, following reports of allegations of fraud that had earlier prompted the commission to put the bank under enhanced oversight.

Gordon said regulators have not communicated with him or his client, adding that if Bolt does not see the money returned within eight days, he plans to take the case to the Supreme Court in Kingston.

Bolt, an eight-time Olympic gold medal winner, is considered the world’s fastest man, holding world records in the 100-meter and 200-meter races.

Source: https://www.channelstv.com/2023/01/19/usain-bolt-loses-12-million-in-savings-to-scam/

#News #topnews #photography #media #newsflash #BangladeshNews #Trend #dailynews #dailynewsupdate #newsupdate #breaking #localnews #dhaka #Bangladesh #tfp #thefrontpage #dhakagram #bangladeshi #instadaily #Usain #Bolt #million #savings #scam

Description:
🇮🇷 #NEW #Iran's Defense Ministry has reported that three drones targeted an ammunition production facility in #Isfahan and that at least one was shot down by air defense. The Ministry called the attack unsuccessful, saying the roof of the building sustained minimal damage and that there is no pause to operations there. Slides 1-2. Via theatlasnews.co

Some reports claim this is the facility where the HESA Shahed-136 (Russian designation Geran-2) is manufactured. The Shahed-136 has become well known in recent months due to its use by Russian forces in Ukraine. 

It’s reported that two other targets were struck, unknown if by drone or other, an oil motor company and a service plant. Slides 3-5 apparently show a huge fire reportedly in the Shahid Salimi industrial town in #Tabriz, East Azerbaijan Province. Via Faytuks News on Twitter.

"Confirmed (locally) blast-incidents in the past hour in Iran: 
1. Isfahan, #Isfahan Province
2. Khoy West Azerbaijan Province
3. Azarshahr East Azerbaijan Province
4. Karaj #Alborz Province" Via @no.itsmyturn

Jet activity has been noted above Tehran as well following the wave of blasts see videos on my Telegram channel. 
---

Description:
Footballer named Amir Nasr-Azadani has reportedly been sentenced to death due to his women's rights campaigns. As per reports, Nasr-Azadani was campaigning for women's rights and basic freedom in Iran and was handed a death sentence.

It may be mentioned this move has been condemned by many and FIFPro, the worldwide representative organisation for 65,000 professional footballers, has criticised the Iranian government.

"FIFPRO is shocked and sickened by reports that professional footballer Amir Nasr-Azadani faces execution in Iran after campaigning for women's rights and basic freedom in his country. We stand in solidarity with Amir and call for the immediate removal of his punishment," it wrote on microblogging site Twitter. 

It is mentioned Iran has seen several anti-government protests all over the country in the last few months. The custodial death of Mahsa Amini was a major factor. The 22-year-old had refused to follow the country's Islamic dress code.

#iran #footballer #campaign #women #rights #execution #tnec #news

Description:
Iran has restricted access to Instagram, one of the last remaining social media platforms in the country, amid protests over the death of a woman named Mahsa Amini in police custody, internet shutdown observatory NetBlocks said. The death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was arrested by morality police in Tehran for “unsuitable attire”, last week has unleashed simmering anger.
London-based NetBlocks’ data shows a near-total disruption to internet service in parts of Kurdistan province in west Iran since Monday, while the capital city of Tehran and other parts of the country have also faced disruptions since Friday when protests first broke out.
Social media websites such as TikTok, YouTube, Twitter and Facebook are routinely blocked in parts of the Islamic Republic, which has some of the strictest internet controls in the world. But tech-savvy residents bypass curbs using virtual private networks (VPNs).
#hellopakistan #hellomagazine #pakistanicelebrities #pakistan #instalove #instapost #instadaily #instanews #karachi #lahore #islamabad

Description:
Repost from @heavydiscussion
@ahmedeldin - Keep amplifying the voices of the people in Iran. Particularly women, who are leading this revolt. 

Protests are now being reported in every province in ⁦‪the country‬⁩. The government admits to killing 35 but Amnesty says they shot 19 people dead — including 3 children — on Wednesday night alone. 

This is the culmination of 43 years of oppression. It is starting to seem as though the government has two choices — reform, or revolution. 

Iran's main reformist party called Saturday for an end to the mandatory Islamic dress code for women in force since 1983, after eight straight nights of protests. #mahsaamini #iran

Repost @the.wellness.therapist
To the international community, our sisters & brothers in Iran have lost access to the internet. They are risking their lives by simply refusing to wear the hijab & to peacefully protest. The regime of the Islamic Republic of Iran has shut down their connection to the outside world. They are being killed in the dark. I humbly ask for your support in sharing their stories & how they are courageously risking life & limb just to be heard. 

Iranians are asking for those outside of Iran to their voice. Share their stories. Don’t let their deaths be in vain. Scroll to learn ways to help them & share this post along with others.
 

1. Repost footage of protests to all social media platforms 

The Islamic Republic of Iran regime  is blocking the internet. Iranians have to use VPN & other dangerous methods to get content out. When we reshare the videos/photos that do get out, we are helping to amplify the voices of Iranians. They want us to help get their stories out. 

Doing so also scares the regime because they don’t want the international community to see what is happening. Footage being widespread online also raises morale of Iranians to keep protesting. 

2. Use specific & creative hashtags to get the word out 

Use these tags when you post: 
#mahsaamini #jinaamini #zhinaamini #Mahsa_Amini #iran #iranprotests

The tags above are designed for those who are already aware of whats happening in Iran.

Description: An Iranian hacktivist group says it has started its cyber operations against the Islamic Republic in solidarity with the ongoing protests across #Iran over the death of a hijab victim. State owned websites, including the website of the Central Bank of Iran, were targeted by hackers claiming to be from the ‘Anonymous’ hacking group. A member of the group posted a message to the Iranians on Twitter saying, "We are here with you. The operations against Iran began. wait for us." At least two main websites of the Iranian government and some state-affiliated media webs as well as the state broadcaster IRIB were among the targets, some of whom were back on line after a few hours. One of the websites of the government hosts “smart services” and another is dedicated to publishing government news and interviews with officials. “All database has been deleted,” claimed a social media account believed to be affiliated with Anonymous. A video was also released showing footage of protests in several Iranian cities that have erupted since Mahsa Amini died in custody of the hijab enforcement patrols. “This was the last straw,” an altered voice on the video said of Amini’s death. “The Iranian people are not alone”. Following large anti-government protests in Tehran and Amini’s hometown as well as a couple of other cities in the Kurdistan province, demonstrations have expanded to many Iranian cities and towns, with gunshots reported. #computerscience #computerengineering #IoT #AI #cybersecurity #hacking #hacker #pentest #tech #code #coding #python #php #linux #java #webdev #programming #webdeveloper #digital #technology #security thecybersecurityhub.com

Description:
An India-based “hack-for-hire” gang snooped on Pakistani politicians, generals and diplomats among other targets in various parts of the world, a report by The Bureau of Investigative Journalism revealed on Saturday. The investigation revealed the contents of a leaked database from inside one of the major gangs of hackers, targeting businesses, politicians and journalists. It showed the criminals targeted private email accounts of more than 100 victims on behalf of investigators working for autocratic states, lawyers and their wealthy clients. 

“The most famous Pakistan-related target was Pervez Musharraf, the former president of the country.” On January 10, an Indian hacker, Aditya Jain, was tasked with breaking into the email account of Chaudhry Fawad Hussain, the then Pakistan information minister in Imran Khan’s cabinet, according to the exposé.

#hellopakistan #hellomagazine #pakistanicelebrities #pakistan #instalove #instapost #instadaily #instanews #karachi #lahore #islamabad

“the most famous pakistan-related target was pervez musharraf, the former president of the country.” on january 10, an indian hacker, aditya jain, was tasked with breaking into the email account of chaudhry fawad hussain, the then pakistan information minister in imran khan’s cabinet, according to the exposé.

Description:
Repost @the.wellness.therapist
•
To the international community, our sisters & brothers in Iran have lost access to the internet. They are risking their lives by simply refusing to wear the hijab & to peacefully protest. The regime of the Islamic Republic of Iran has shut down their connection to the outside world. They are being killed in the dark. I humbly ask for your support in sharing their stories & how they are courageously risking life & limb just to be heard. 

Iranians are asking for those outside of Iran to their voice. Share their stories. Don’t let their deaths be in vain. Scroll to learn ways to help them & share this post along with others.
 

1. Repost footage of protests to all social media platforms 

The Islamic Republic of Iran is blocking the internet. Iranians have to use VPN & other dangerous methods to get content out. When we reshare the videos/photos that do get out, we are helping to amplify the voices of Iranians. They want us to help get their stories out. 

Doing so also scares the regime because they don’t want the international community to see what is happening. Footage being widespread online also raises morale of Iranians to keep protesting. 

2. Use specific & creative hashtAgs to get word out 

Use these tags when you post: 
#mahsaamini #jinaamini #zhinaamini #Mahsa_Amini #iran #iranprotests

The tags above are designed for those who are already aware of whats happening in Iran. To get the story out to those who aren’t aware of it, use other popular hashtags such as: 

#food #fall #halloween #family #love #photography #news #politics etc. get creative! 

3. No war. No western intervention.
Keep your support focused on Iranian people fighting for their own liberation. Say No war on Iran. Iranians don’t want Western foreign intervention. They want to fight for their own liberation. They just want support from the international community. They want the atrocities documented. 

4. Organize to support iranians where you live 
Go out in the streets & make some noise. Attend support rallies in your country. DISCLAIMER: Due to sanctions against Iran, it is illegal to fundraise to send money there legally. Be wary of funds collection

Description:
Cryptocurrency exchange Binance temporarily suspended its blockchain network after hackers made off with around $570 million worth of its BNB token.

Binance said late Thursday a cross-chain bridge linking with its BNB Chain was targeted, enabling hackers to move BNB tokens off the network. So-called cross-chain bridges are tools that allow the transfer of tokens from one blockchain to another.

The company said it had worked with network validators — entities or individuals who confirm transactions on the blockchain — to pause creation of new blocks on BSC, suspending all transaction processing while a team of developers investigates the breach.

Binance is the world’s largest crypto exchange by trading volume.

“An exploit on a cross-chain bridge, BSC Token Hub, resulted in extra BNB. We have asked all validators to temporarily suspend BSC,” Changpeng Zhao, Binance’s CEO, said in a tweet Thursday evening.

“The issue is contained now. Your funds are safe. We apologize for the inconvenience and will provide further updates accordingly.”

BNB Chain has since resumed operations.

In total, hackers drained 2 million BNB tokens — about $570 million at current prices — from the network, Binance’s BNB Chain said in a blog post on Friday.

The hack was caused by a bug in the bridge’s smart contract that allowed hackers to forge transactions and send money back to their crypto wallet, according to crypto security firm Immunefi. Smart contracts are pieces of code on the blockchain that allow agreements to execute automatically without human intervention.

Description:
Jessica Chastain sends support to women of Iran

Actress Jessica Chastain insists it is “really important” for her to raise awareness about the ongoing protests in Iran and she has hailed the “women-led revolution” taking place in the country.

The ‘Good Nurse’ actress used her Twitter account in September to shine a spotlight on the tragic death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was murdered by the country’s morality police for not wearing her hijab correctly, and she is closely following the ongoing reaction to the shocking incident, which has sparked waves of women cutting their hair or shedding their head coverings in protest, reports femalefirst.co.uk.

She told ‘Entertainment Tonight’: “It’s really important for me to use my platform to amplify anyone’s struggle for freedom and peace and safety. And what’s happening in Iran right now is heartbreaking to me. I’m following the news every day as I hope everyone is, and my heart’s with those girls.”

Chastain praised the “strength” of the women in speaking out and hailed their actions as “incredible”.

She added: “This is a women-led revolution. And I have such belief in them, and I send them so much strength and love and support. And I think it’s incredible what they’re doing.”

Chastain’s new movie, ‘The Good Nurse’, sees her play Amy Loughren, a nurse who was forced to turn detective when she discovered one of her colleagues was responsible for the murder of dozens of patients across nine hospitals over 16 years.

And the 45-year-old star was keen to make the real-life story because she is keen to “amplify the stories of women”.

She said: “It’s part of the reason I wanted to make the film. I love using my platform to amplify the stories of women, because I find that (in) this country, for some reason, they haven’t been acknowledged up until now. And so, I want to celebrate women’s heroism and their incredible stories, and Amy’s story is mind-blowing and compassionate.”

“She’s a hero.”
.
#jessicachastain #youandimagazine #iran #hijab #thegoodnurse #hollywood #oscarwinner

Description:
Sunday… a day for concerted prayers. I’m lightning candles and prayer-walking for Iranian Love—women and wise men rising for sanity, humanity. Imagining what it would be like to stand on street corner in my own city and voice the desire to be free to wear what I want when I leave the house and not co-exist with the threat of harassment, beatings—or death—from armed “moral police.” 

Darkness is being spot lit for us to heal it. It takes UNIFIED COMMON SENSE to disintegrate eons of insanity. It’s happening! This rising!

And another prayer stream today to the people of Puerto Rico, and millions … so many in India…displaced this year because of flooding. 

💛

May the Light of Christ Consciousness-Buddha Nature-Inclusive Love fill the hearts and minds of ALL BEINGS. 

In full Faith. 

💛 

For Love + restoration,
D

#WomenForWomenInInternational #mahsaamini #UnityConsciousness #Prayer #HeartCentered #Sundaydevotion #inclusivelove #divinelove @womenforwomen @zainabsalbi 🙏
Image Text: No woman should be persecuted for choosing what to wear or standing up for her rights. #mahsaamini #EndVAW WOMEN FOR WOMEN INTERNATIONAL IONAL

Description:
So much tragedy, our hearts keep breaking and stay broken, please our voices must join in as All of Us rise to STAND WITH THE WOMEN AND THE PEOPLE OF IRAN🤘🏼 #nikashakarami ##mahsaamini #womenlifefreedom  Sending love to All🙏🏼💕Posted @withrepost • @lesinsoumisesmtl TW: Rape, brutal violence, organ harvesting 

Nika Shakarami was one of thousands of Iranian women who took to the streets to protest the horrific killing of Mahsa Jina Amini.

She joined the protests in Tehran
on September 20. And then she disappeared.

She had gone with friends, who said she had been fearlessly chanting in Mahsa's name.
But as night fell, the protests grew more intense, and Nika was separated from her friends.

In her last known communication, she told them that she was being chased by security forces.

Then her phone was turned off and her Telegram and Instagram accounts were deleted.

Frantic, her family searched everywhere for her.

She was missing for 10 days.

Then they found her dead body at a morgue in a local detention center.

Her nose had been completely smashed in, her skull broken from multiple blows.

The family were told that Nika had been held by the IRGC and briefly detained in Tehran's
notorious Evin Prison - the IRGC tried to claim that she died after "falling from a great height."

Her family was then pressured by the authorities to not hold a funeral ceremony and bury her in
silence.

Despite being forced into agreeing, the authorities then stole her body and buried her 40km away in order to avoid publicity and suppress further protest.

She was buried on what would've been her 17th birthday.

On top of all that, there are reports stating that Nika was repeatedly raped and suffered sexual torture, and that a large cut down the middle of her torso indicated that her organs had been removed.

WE DEMAND JUSTICE!
Share this and amplify the voices of Iranian women. The world needs to know the oppression and the violence that the women over there are risking, just by existing and fighting for their rights!!!

STAND UP, RISE AND PROTEST!!!

Description:
Remember their names and do not trust them! These are some of the people living in North America who have a long track record of lobbying in support of Khamenei’s regime occupying Iran. They’re mainly active on Twitter, in addition to making media appearances and publishing articles to echo the talking points of the regime in English to a Western audience. They do this by presenting themselves as “progressives” who just want peace and stability. Their main tactic is to use nice sounding terms such as “anti-war” and “diplomacy” to make it seem like they are not on the side of the regime. But their main goal is to keep this ISIS-style dictatorship in power no matter what. They have been lying to their Western audience for years, claiming that people in Iran do not want the regime gone, they just want “reforms”. This, of course, is absolute nonsense. They falsely accuse political prisoners, family members of innocent people killed by the regime, and other Iranian activists, of being “warmongers”. They whitewash the crimes of the regime and have always tried to hijack mass protests in Iran to misrepresent them.

With the recent huge anti-regime protests taking place in Iran and the clear message of the Iranian people, which is that they do not want the Islamic Republic in power, their constant rambling has not stopped one bit. Their tactics slightly change from time to time to fit the situation and not be too evident, but their goal is always the same. Some of them are desperately trying to save face now, even going back to delete their previous articles, tweets, and videos. Of course, it’s too late and completely pointless since people have downloaded, taken screenshots, and saved it all!

Stay alert, know their names, and do not fall for their tricks! Iran will be free one day, and when that day comes, I assure you that Iranian people will not forget or forgive those who for years lobbied for that barbaric oppressive regime while living comfortably in North America!

به امید آزادی ✌️

#نه_به_جمهوری_اسلامی

Description:
Thank goodness for Iranian friends who are the ultimate BS detector in all this. This just came out in The Economist @theeconomist. Can't find an author's name anywhere, nor editorial board endorsement, but it's out there.

Not sure what this reporter is on, or what revolution they're watching, but it's apparent that things are moving inside of Iran, and the regime is on its' heels. Not sure why The Economist has decided to post what is in my opinion propaganda for the regime, and does not accurately reflect things that are going on inside of Iran.

This is the crap that goes out and smothers all of our efforts to get a worldwide coalition of citizens to back the Iranian revolutionaries, and makes people who don't know any better to say, "Oh, it's over.", or "Oh, nothing to do here."

Nonsense. This is the time to topple the weakened regime over.

💚✊🏼❤️ Iran Strong

Photo/story rights @theeconomist
Subscription cancelled.

Description:
Iranian competitive climber Elnaz Rekabi was greeted in Tehran on Wednesday by large, cheering crowds in support of the athlete who competed in South Korea without wearing a mandatory headscarf.⁠
⁠
Rekabi was met by hordes of reporters and admirers at the Imam Khomeini international airport, many of whom applauded, chanted her name and called her a hero.⁠
⁠
All female athletes from the Islamic Republic are required to wear a hijab during competitive sports and international appearances. On Sunday, Rekabi competed in Seoul wearing just a black headband with her dark hair tied in a ponytail. Iran’s flag was emblazoned across her shirt.⁠
⁠
Supporters of Rekabi believe she actively chose not to wear the headscarf in response to intense protests in Iran following the Sept. 16 death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was detained by Iran’s morality police. Amini was accused of breaking a morality law that requires women to wear a headscarf, cover their arms and legs and wear loose clothing.⁠
⁠
The demonstrations, drawing school-age children, oil workers and others to the streets in over 100 cities across the nation, represent the most serious challenge to Iran’s theocracy since the mass protests surrounding its disputed 2009 presidential election. Many Iranian women have since removed their government mandated hijabs in public.⁠
⁠
At the airport, Rekabi maintained to reporters that not wearing a hijab in Seoul was “unintentional.” A statement allegedly from Rekabi was posted to social media this week where she claimed she “forgot” to wear her hijab after leaving a women’s-only waiting area prior to her competition.⁠
⁠
Rekabi appeared at the Imam Khomeini International Airport wearing a ballcap and hoodie to cover her hair.⁠
⁠
The Iranian government routinely pressures activists at home and abroad, often airing what rights group describe as coerced confessions on state television — the same cameras she addressed on her arrival back home.⁠
⁠
Click the link in the @GlobalNews bio to read more.⁠
⁠
Image: AP
Image Text: Samantant Elnaz Rekabi, Iranian climber who competed without hijab, greeted by cheering crowds in Tehran Global NEWS

click the link in the @globalnews bio to read more.⁠
⁠

Description:
The City of London Police has arrested a 17-year-old in Oxfordshire, London on suspicion of hacking. The City Police department's official Twitter handle has tweeted the following

While no further information is available at the moment, the internet is buzzing with people who believe this arrest is actually the 'teapotuberhacker', the mastermind behind the GTA6 leak, one of the biggest leaks in the history of the Gaming Industry.

The London City Police and the FBI are expected to give out a statement soon.

𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗱𝗼𝘁𝘀 - 𝗢𝘅𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗱𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗿𝗲, 𝗟𝗮𝗽𝘀𝘂𝘀$, 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗽𝗼𝘁𝘂𝗯𝗲𝗿𝗵𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗲𝗿, 𝗚𝗧𝗔𝟲
Lapsus$ hacking group has been creating a ruckus with the group targeting Tech giants like Microsoft, Samsung, and NVIDIA. In March this year, London City Police had arrested 7 teenagers in connection with these hacking incidents. One of the seven was a 16-year-old boy from Oxford, who was arrested because other hackers leaked his name and address online. The lad uses "White" and "Breachbase" as his online aliases.

It is reported that the teenager made around $14 million from his cybercrimes. After a lull of a few months, GTA6 leaks went viral, and over 90 videos of RockStar Games' most awaited video game got leaked on GTAForums, around the same time global ride-hailing giant Uber suffered a data breach as well.

Hackers have posted on Doxbin, that its 'Arion', the same teenager from Oxford, who goes by the online alias of 'White' or 'Breachbase', was behind the GTA6 and Uber data breaches.

Interestingly, The 'teapotuberhacker' gave 'Uber Hack' as a 'Past work' reference on the GTAForums while leaking the GTA6 videos. This could mean only one thing, that is Mr. 'teapotuberhacker', 'Breachbase', and 'White' is the same person, the teenage hacker from Oxford.

#LondonCityPolice #UberHack #DataBreach #News #TimesNow #TimesNowNews #InstaWithTimesNow
Image Text: TIMES NOW wasted 17-year-old hacker arrested in Oxfordshire, believed to be the mastermind behind GTA6 Leak and Uber hack

Description:
"The moon falls a thousand times" is a personal grief. My tribute to honor the Persian leopard's mythical wish to be above the moon. The idea came to my mind when I heard about the story of Mina and her friendship with a Persian leopard in the 19th century.
Yet stories are not to ignore the reality around us, are they? As they are coming out of true experiences, they can make changes for real, they can prevent some tragedies from happening again and again. 
_

Jina, officially named Mahsa Amini was a 22 years-old Kurdish woman visiting Tehran where she was arrested by Morality police for not complying with a compulsory hijab and later died in hospital due to potential police brutality. Her death lit such a fire in hearts that brought numerous people into the streets all over the country (Iran) to protest. Not only to demand justice for her death but for their stolen freedom and the respect every human being deserves.Their bravery is beyond my words!
_ 

Since yesterday, Iran has shut down the internet and blocked social media platforms to silence their voices. At this point, a possible massacre may happen as it happened in 2019. In such a critical condition, Anonymous hackers are supporting people against oppression while Meta is supporting oppression by removing related posts from Instagram (non-violent content), and by blocking Iranians What’s app accounts! Your voice matters cause you can be their voice!
_ 

Her official name Mahsa means "moon alike". Her given name Jina is a Kurdish name which I think has the same origin as the word gene, meaning reproductive, alive, and life-giver. Let's be her name, and let's multiply her by disseminate her story as a symbol who freed a land from demons of darkness. As her mother said, also her epitaph: "Jina, my dear, you won't die! Your name will become a symbol." 

This painting has been shared as an expression of sorrow, but not anymore. Please share this post and ask people to read the caption and share it using the hashtag #MahsaAmini if they like! It was her birthday yesterday and this is my gift to her!

#MahsaAmini
#mahsa_amini 
#opiran 
#jinjianazadi
#مهسا_امینی 
#ژینا_امینی

Description:
Ayub Khezrnejad, a graduate of Memorial University in Newfoundland, posted a video online on Nov. 19 of his father’s home in Iran, which he claimed had been raided by the Islamic Republic's security forces. 
•
Shortly after, he was summoned by the Iranian judiciary for questioning, according to social media posts by local media and community members. 
•
His friends have not heard from him since. They fear he has been arrested. 
•
Khezrnejad's disappearance comes at a time of great civil unrest in Iran. Protests and calls for the removal of the current Iranian government have been ongoing throughout the country since a young woman named Mahsa Amini died in police custody in September.
•
Those demonstrations have been met with increasingly brutal responses from the government-controlled Iranian security forces.
•
"I had never seen Ayub speaking this way. The feeling in his voice … stressed, frustrated, shocked,” his friend said about Khezrnejad’s 45-second video. 
•
CBC News is not naming the friend due to the potential danger to his family in Iran.
•
Khezrnejad completed his master's program in the fall of 2015 at Memorial University in St. John's. He returned home to Iran in early 2017.
•
When they last spoke in 2019, Khezrnejad was doing well, his friend said. 
•
His friend said nobody has heard an update from Khezrnejad since he showed up to the judiciary summons. It’s unclear when that was. Some of the earliest posts reporting that Ayub had been detained were on Nov. 24.
•
His friend hopes this will be one more example of why people outside of Iran need to speak up for those still living in his home country.
•
For more, tap the link in our bio. 
•
•
•
(Photo: Name withheld/Facebook; Reporting: Jonny Hodder/CBC News) #Iran #StJohns #Newfoundland #IranProtests
Image Text: This Memorial University grad disappeared in Iran. His friends fear he's been arrested.

Description:
Repost from yesterday, somehow Instagram deleted the entire caption when posting this.
This map shows the current religious majority of most countries in eastern Europe according to the PEW Research Institute. All credit goes to them.
Whilst the orthodox church dominates in the East a large portion of the West is mainly Catholic.
There are some outliers, such as Czechia which is mostly Atheist and the Baltics, which are mixed. 
Unfortunately the map doesn't show the majority Muslim countries of the Balkans, such as Bosnia and Herzegovina. 
All in all it provides a fair overview over the Christian faiths in the East, however.
#faith #faiths #religion #religious #christian #christianity #orthodox #orthodoxchurch #catholicism #catholic #catholicchurch #islam #muslim #history #europeanhistory #historyofeurope #anthropology #culture #church #jesuschrist #christ #jesus #god

Poland Kazakhstan* Czech Rep. Ukraine Slovakia Austria Hungary Moldova Romania Caspian Sea Croatia Bosnia- Serbia Black Sea Italy Georgia Azer. Arm. Bulgaria Mont. Mac. Albania Iran Greece Turkey Med. Sea Syria Med. Sea Iraq Kazakhstan was surveyed part of this study, but results not analyzedİn this report. Source: Survey conducted June 2015-July 2016 n18 countries. Description:
Several Virtual Private Network applications (VPN) rose to the top ranking apps downloaded in Jordan since TikTok was suspended by the authorities in December 2022.

Many resorted to VPNs to encrypt their internet traffic and disguise their online identity almost immediately after TikTok was suspended due to the spread of videos aimed at spreading false news and acts of violence, according to a statement from Jordanian authorities.

While the app is banned in several countries, such as India and Afghanistan, this is the first time Jordanians witnessed a banning of such sort. However, official sources told Roya that the authorities are currently negotiating legal and technical aspects before reinstating the app in Jordan.

One social media user commented on TikTok being banned saying, “The majority of the people who use TikTok here are still scrolling by VPN.”

Another agreed, writing, “Actually We have VPN I can't live without it.”

TikTok users also appeared to be helping each other when one user pleaded, “My vpn isnt working pls send help,” and was immediately met with a number of VPN applications available for use.

Notably, #Jordan’s Cybercrime Unit had announced on Dec. 16, 2022 that #TikTok was temporarily suspended in Jordan after users reported the application crashing.
Image Text: ‎'‎رفيا VPN 9 VPNS TOP LIST OF DOWNLOADED APPS IN JORDAN AFTER TIKTOK BAN RoyaNewsEnglish en.royanews.tv‎'‎

Description:
Urvashi Rautela has been receiving a lot of flak lately for ‘following’ her former partner Rishabh Pant to Australia where the Indian cricketer is stationed for his matches. 

She landed in Australia amid Team India’s matches and has been sharing cryptic posts on social media that raised several questions. Amid being termed as a stalker and accused of ‘harassing’ Pant by netizens, the actress shared her stance on this entire issue.

Taking to social media, she shared a video of hers and compared herself to Iran’s Mahsa Amini. For the unversed, Amini died on September 17 under suspicious circumstances which sparked protests across Iran led by women. Urvashi wrote, “FIRST IN IRAN 🇮🇷 #MahsaAmini 🙏🏻 & NOW IN INDIA….it’s happening with me they’re bullying me as a Stalker ??? No one cares about me or support me 😞A strong woman is one who feels deeply & loves fiercely. Her tears flow as abundantly as her laughter. She is both soft & powerful , is both practical & spiritual. She’s a gift to the world. #BringBackOurGirls #Yesallwomen."

#UrvashiRautela #rishabhpant #mahasaamini
Image Text: NEWS 18 Urvashi Rautela Compares Herself to Mahsa Amini Amid Accusation of Stalking Rishabh Pant

Description:
“Woman, life, freedom”: It’s been more than a month since Zhina (Mahsa) Amini’s arrest by Iran's ‘morality police’ on September 13th. Three days later she died. Her death marked the beginning of anti-government protests which within days spread over the entire country.

Tomorrow, on Saturday, from 3–8pm, the "Woman* Life Freedom Kollektiv" is organising a large protest in Berlin to support the weeks-long resistance across an innumerable number of Iranian cities, standing up against oppression and discrimination in the Islamic Republic.

The Berlin protest will take the following route:

Begin 3pm:
Hofjägerallee (Antreteplatz) - Großer Stern - Spreeweg - John-Foster-Dulles-Allee - Yitzhak-Rabin-Str. - Str. des 17. Juni - Straße des 17. Juni / Großer Stern (Endplatz / ausschließlich Großer Stern)

Follow @womanlifefreedomcollective for more information and updates on the Berlin protest, and @from____iran for reporting on the protests in Iran and globally in English.
The artist @baharnoorizadeh shares and translates into English news and posts coming from both within and outside Iran. Follow her for daily updates and reports which are often not covered in Western media.

#MahsaAmini
#JinaAmii
#IranProtests
#IranProtests 2022
#solidarity 
#SolidarityWithProtestersInIran
#Woman_Life_Freedom
#womanlifefreedom

Description:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky responded to Elon Musk’s poll about whether Ukraine should give up territory to Russia on Monday by turning the tables on the tech billionaire.

Zelensky tweeted out a poll of his own, asking Twitter users which Musk they like better: “One who supports Ukraine” or “One who supports Russia.” 

Musk’s Twitter poll drew widespread attention on Monday afternoon when the SpaceX and Tesla CEO asked users if they supported his peace proposal for the war in Ukraine.

Musk’s proposal was to redo elections in regions of Ukraine annexed by Russia, with the elections under United Nations supervision, have Ukraine cede the Crimean peninsula to Russia, and for Ukraine to remain as a neutral country between Russia and the West.

The poll earned a response from Ukrainian diplomat Andriy Melnyk, who told the billionaire to “f— off” shortly after the tweet was posted.

Source: The Hill

📚 If you like our content, never miss it. We strive to report the truth simply so that you can be empowered with the important facts of complex issues. Join 10,000+ readers and subscribe to our newsletter to get the simple news that matters in your inbox. Click the link in our bio to subscribe.
Image Text: ZELENSKYY ATTACKS MUSK On Monday, Elon Musk, who provides Ukraine with internet access through Starlink, tweeted about a possible peace solution between Russia and Ukraine. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy responded by asking his audience if they prefer Musk to be pro-Ukraine or ro-Russia. WWW.UPWARD.NEWS
description_lower:
ukrainian president volodymyr zelensky responded to elon musk’s poll about whether ukraine should give up territory to russia on monday by turning the tables on the tech billionaire.

zelensky tweeted out a poll of his own, asking twitter users which musk they like better: “one who supports ukraine” or “one who supports russia.” 

musk’s twitter poll drew widespread attention on monday afternoon when the spacex and tesla ceo asked users if they supported his peace proposal for the war in ukraine.

musk’s proposal was to redo elections in regions of ukraine annexed by russia, with the elections under united nations supervision, have ukraine cede the crimean peninsula to russia, and for ukraine to remain as a neutral country between russia and the west.

the poll earned a response from ukrainian diplomat andriy melnyk, who told the billionaire to “f— off” shortly after the tweet was posted.

source: the hill

Description:
A Michigan woman is accused of targeting two teens in a year-long catfishing scheme where she harassed them on social media.

Kendra Licari,42, was charged earlier this week with two counts of stalking a minor, two counts of using a computer to commit the crime and another count of obstruction of justice. According to FBI investigators, Licari targeted her daughter and her daughter’s boyfriend since last December and attempted to cover up her act by filing a complaint with the Beal City Schools‘ administration. Around that time, Licari worked as a girls‘ basketball coach at the school and at the end of the season, she was asked not to return due to coaching changes.

School district officials said the cyber bullying occurred off of school grounds and the school’s devices were not used. They decided to involve local authorities to look into the case as the harassment started in early 2021. Isabella County prosecutor David Barberi said the investigation was intense since Licari allegedly used slang to make it seem like the catfish was the same age as her daughter.

After authorities were stuck with no other options, they turned to FBI’s computer crime deviation in April and discovered a few months later that they believed Licari was involved in the cyberbullying. Superintendent William Chilman said in a statement that the FBI officials were able to track down the IP addresses used to send the messages to her daughter.

After Licari was confronted about the cyber harassment, she broke down and made a full confession. She was released often her arraignment and She faces multiple charges which included using a computer to commit the crime, stalking a minor, and obstruction of justice. Each count is a five-year felony.

However, it is unclear why Licari committed the crime and she is expected to appear in court on December 29⛓️👀🤦🏽‍♂️📲 Thoughts
Image Text: TEEN DISCOVERS ANONYMOUS CYBERBULLY WHO HARASSED HER FOR A YEAR WAS HER OWN MOTHER TVO APHOUSE RHT @raphousetv

Team 🇺🇸 USA 
Proud Iranian American 
#Repost @samanism
・・・
US national soccer team has removed the religious “ALLAH” emblem from middle of Iranian flag. This religious symbol represents Iran’s theocratic oppression, gender apartheid and hate which most Iranians reject and want removed. Allah was added to the flag after the Islamic revolution in 1979 by the regime. Thank you team USA. Many Iranians are also posting thank you comments under their page.

Description:
Climbing organizations and professionals, as well as the international community, should stand with professional climber Elnaz Rekabi, who is under extreme pressure by the Iranian government to cover up her heroic act of competing without a hijab earlier this week, said the Center for Human Rights in Iran (CHRI) in a statement today.

“While she was scaling that wall in Seoul without the state’s forced hijab, Ms. Rekabi was showing the world who she is: A professional climber and Iranian woman with a spine of steel,” said CHRI Executive Director Hadi Ghaemi.

“She, like countless women in Iran, has risked everything to tell the world that she opposes the state’s policy of forced hijab, and we are extremely worried about her safety,” he added.

“Ms. Rekabi risked her freedom and safety and has since been under extreme pressure by the government to cover up her courageous act of civil disobedience,” said Ghaemi. “It is now the responsibility of all people who support women’s and human rights to stand with her and not let the government in Iran cover up the true story.”

CHRI stands by Iranian athletes who are calling for the government in Iran to be held accountable for its repressive policies, and calls on the International Federation of Sport Climbing (IFCS) to suspend Iran’s membership.

CHRI also urges the IFCS, climbing professionals and the international community to not accept the Iranian government’s attempts to flip this story.

These groups and individuals should make statements in support of Rekabi, who has not been allowed to speak freely since she competed, and all women in Iran who are risking their lives to speak out against repressive state policies.

#Iran #IranProtests #IranProtests2022 #HumanRights #UN #FreeSpeech #Revolution #OpIran #MahsaAmini #IranRevolution #WomensRights #IranRevolution2022 #Iranian #Tehran #Mahsa_Amini

Description:
As protests over the death of a young woman in custody rage across Iran, calls are growing for authorities to release journalists who have been detained after covering the death and the resulting demonstrations.

Those journalists include Niloofar Hamed, who was the first person to report Mahsa Amini's story. 

She has now been in solitary confinement for almost a month, according to her lawyer.

Ms Hamedi shared a photo of Ms Amini's parents hugging each other in a Tehran hospital, where their daughter was lying in a coma. 

The photo, posted on Twitter on September 16, was the first sign to the world that all was not well with 22-year-old Ms Amini, who had been detained three days earlier by Iran's morality police for what they deemed inappropriate dress.

Ms Amini's death later that day would unleash a wave of mass protests across Iran that were still persisting nearly three weeks later in different parts of the country, despite a government crackdown.

The photo of Ms Amini's parents was also one of the last things Ms Hamedi, who worked for the pro-reform Sharq Daily, would post before she was arrested some days later and her Twitter account listed as suspended.

"This morning, intelligence agents raided my client Niloofar Hamedi's house, arrested her, searched her house, and confiscated her belongings," Ms Hamedi's lawyer Mohammad Ali Kamfirouzi tweeted on September 22.

The Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) has called on Iranian authorities to "immediately and unconditionally release … all journalists arrested because of their coverage of Mahsa Amini's death and the protests that have followed".

It said last month that at least 28 journalists had been detained by the security forces, including Ms Hamedi.

Friends of Ms Hamedi described her as a brave journalist, passionate about women's issues and rights.

"She always went beyond her limit to be the voice of voiceless women who were deprived from their rights, whether by their fathers, husbands or by social limitations," one friend told Reuters.

#MahsaAmini #PressFreedom #Iran #ABCNews
Image Text: 2 AP: Uncredited Calls to release Iranian journalists detained for covering death in custody, nationwide protests

Description:
When a picture is worth more than words could ever say. Today marks the 40th day since Jina Mahsa Amini was killed by the Irshad ‘morality’ police in Tehran, her death becoming the catalyst for this divine feminine revolution. In Iran and in many other Muslim countries the 40th day post death is very important. Thousands are seen here marching to the 22 year old Kurdish woman’s hometown of Saqqez showing up to honour her and to say their goodbyes at her resting place today despite the regimes efforts to block the roads who are no doubt putting themselves in even more danger by solely trying to attend. I am truly humbled, inspired and in awe every day of the courage and bravery of the women, girls and the people of Iran who are risking their lives every day by leading this revolution against the death grip of patriarchy and this inhumane regime in their struggle for freedom and liberation. 🕊

#womenlifefreedom #zanzendegiazadi #jinamahsaamini

Description:
📷: Protesters hold placards and chant slogans during a demonstration in support of Mahsa Amini, a young Iranian woman who died after being arrested in Tehran by the Islamic Republic's morality police, in Istanbul, Turkey, September 20, 2022. ⁠
⁠
The U.N. human rights office is calling for a prompt, impartial investigation into the death of a young Iranian woman arrested by the so-called morality police for allegedly wearing an improper hijab. ⁠
⁠
Iran’s morality police arrested Mahsa Amini, a 22-year-old woman from the minority Kurdish community September 13 in the capital, Tehran, for not wearing the hijab properly. ⁠
⁠
U.N. human rights spokeswoman Ravina Shamdasani says she fell into a coma shortly after collapsing at the Vozara Detention Center. She says Amini died three days later. ⁠
⁠
“There are reports that Ms. Amini was beaten on the head with a baton, and her head was banged against the vehicle by so-called morality police," she said. "Authorities have stated that she died of natural causes… In recent months, the so-called morality police have expanded street patrols, subjecting women perceived to be wearing a “loose hijab” to verbal and physical harassment and arrest.” ⁠
⁠
(AFP/VOA) ⁠
⁠
 👉 Tap the link in our bio to read more.⁠ ⁠
- ⁠
#Iran #UN #voanews

Re post: @persianswithpurpose After being held in solidarity confinement for over 40 days, Niloofar Hamedi, the reporter who broke the story of Mahsa Zhina Amini’s death and Elaheh Mohammadi, who reported on her funeral, have been accused by the IRGC of being spies “trained by the US’s mafia regime.”

The Islamic Republic has a long history of detaining and executing journalists without fair trial. 

International pressure can help to save Niloofar Hamedi and Elaheh Mohammadi from the same fate that so many other journalists have suffered. 

Help keep Niloofar and Elaheh safe. Share their story.

#iran #freeiran #iranprotests #iranprotest #iranprotests2022 #mahsaamini ‎⁧‫#اعدام_نکنید‬⁩ #opiran #نیکا_شاکرمی #mahsa_amini #helpiran #مهسا_امینی #iranrevolution #iranrevolution2022 #zhinaamini #zanzendegiazadi #niloofarhamedi #elahehmohammadi

Description:
In a letter from prison—where she has been unjustly held since November 2021—veteran rights activist Narges Mohammad has reported on instances of sexual harassment and assault by Islamic Republic forces amid the government's violent repression of protests. 

Mohammadi has proved to be a particular thorn in the authorities’ side, refusing to be silent either in prison or during her brief periods of release between convictions. She is taking grave risks to her personal safety and freedom by speaking publicly on this issue.

#Iran #IranProtests #IranProtests2022 #HumanRights #UN #FreeSpeech #Revolution #OpIran #MahsaAmini #IranRevolution #WomensRights #Iranian #Tehran #Mahsa_Amini #NargesMohammadi #FreeNarges #WomenLifeFreedom #IranRevolution2022 #StopExecutionsinIran #stopexecutioninIran

Description:
Iranian authorities arrested one of the country’s most famous actresses on charges of spreading falsehoods about nationwide protests that grip the country, state media said Saturday. ⁠
⁠
The report by IRNA said Taraneh Alidoosti, star of the Oscar-winning movie “The Salesman,” was detained a week after she made a post on Instagram expressing solidarity with the first man recently executed for crimes allegedly committed during the nationwide protests. ⁠
⁠
IRNA also said several other Iranian celebrities had ″been summoned by the judiciary body over publishing provocative content. ″ It did not say how many or provide further details. ⁠
⁠
According to the report published on the state media’s official Telegram channel, Alidoosti was arrested because she did not provide “any documents in line with her claims.″ ⁠
⁠
In her post, the 38-year-old actress said: ''His name was Mohsen Shekari. Every international organization who is watching this bloodshed and not taking action, is a disgrace to humanity." ⁠
⁠
👉Tap the link in our bio to learn more. ⁠
• ⁠
• ⁠
• ⁠
• ⁠
• ⁠
#iran #photography #photojournalism #voanews
Image Text: Iran Authorities Arrest Actress of Oscar-Winning Movie

Description:
🇮🇷 Unrest in #Iran goes on, close to a week and a month after the death of #MashaAmini at the hands of #Iranian regime forces. Protests continue across the country, one of many unrest issues over recent years that have led to anti-regime activity. Here are some protests from tonight. Anti-regime protests reported in Tehran and several other cities of Iran. Via Aleph on Telegram and Babak Taghvaee on Twitter.

-Dezful, #Khuzestan Province 
Regime forces shooting at the protestors 

-Sanandaj, #Kurdistan Province 
Baharan town.

-Dezful, Khuzestan Province 
Gunfire by regime forces, tear gas cannisters were reportedly launched as well Coords: 32.3828, 48.4016

-Arak, #Markazi Province 
Chanting "Woman, life, freedom"

-#Mahabad, #WestAzerbaijan Province

-Anti-regime protests in several streets of Mahabad, Iran tonight. 

-People in NaziAbad neighbourhood of #Tehran are protesting against Iranian regime tonight. Via Babak Taghvaee.

-Other protests in Tehran tonight for last three slides.

More footage from Iran on my Telegram channel.

Follow my other accounts:
@ourwarstoday.revival
@our.worlds.today
@ourwarsforever
@our.wars.today
Join my Telegram, link in bio, for up-to-date news and OSINT. 
---

Description:
On Friday the Government of Canada issued a statement regarding the recent death of 22-year-old Masha Amini at the hands of authorities in Iran. "Canada strongly condemns the reprehensible detention and killing of Mahsa Amini," said Foreign Affairs Minister Melanie Joly. 
 
"Her death was a direct result of the systemic and continued harassment and repression of women by Iran. We further condemn the violent crackdowns on civilians, which have caused additional deaths and injuries, in blatant violation of their human rights. We salute the courage of the Iranian women who are peacefully protesting and we join them in sending the regime a very clear message: they must end all forms of persecution and violence against women."
 
University Canada West fully supports the Government of Canada’s position.
 
In recent days I have been in contact with many people from UCW’s Iranian community. UCW is home to hundreds of international students from Iran, as well as Iranian faculty and staff. This is a time of deep anxiety for them amid concern for the safety of family and friends. On behalf of UCW, I express our community’s solidarity with them.
 
I remind all our students, faculty and staff that here in Canada, whether as citizens, landed immigrants or international students with a visa, your rights to peaceful assembly, freedom of speech and freedom from discrimination are protected by the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms. No advance permit is required to organize or gather in support of a cause.
 
I encourage students, faculty and staff who are affected by or concerned about these events to reach out to support services available both on campus and on-line. UCW is a truly international community with students from around the world here on our campuses. Let's pull together to support those who are struggling.
 
Sheldon Levy
UCW President & Vice-Chancellor

#mahsaamini

Description:
Who do you think is behind this hack? Actual hackers or FTX insiders themselves? 😱👨🏻‍💻

More than $600 million in crypto left bankrupt crypto company FTX’s wallets late Friday, with little clear explanation as to why.
Soon afterwards, FTX stated in its official Telegram channel that it had been hacked, instructing users not to install any new upgrades and to delete all FTX apps.
“FTX has been hacked. FTX apps are malware. Delete them. Chat is open. Don't go on FTX site as it might download Trojans,” wrote an account administrator in the FTX Support Telegram chat. The message was pinned by FTX General Counsel Ryne Miller.
According to on-chain data, various Ethereum tokens, as well as Solana and Binance Smart Chain tokens have exited FTX’s official wallets and moved to decentralised exchanges like 1inch. Both FTX and FTX US appear to be affected.

Description:
When I first met Iranian author and activist Hamed Esmaeilion, one morning this past October in California, I was already well aware of his story.
On Jan. 8, 2020, Esmaeilion’s wife, Parisa, and only child, 9-year-old Reera, were killed when the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps shot down Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752 shortly after it took off from Tehran’s international airport. The mother and daughter were returning to Canada after visiting family in Iran over the winter holidays. Esmaeilion, a dentist and writer whose novels critical of the Islamic republic were growing increasingly popular inside and outside Iran, had stayed behind in Toronto, knowing that if he traveled with his family, he would probably run into trouble with Iranian authorities.

After the horrific crash, Esmaeilion returned to Iran to take possession of his family’s remains for burial in Canada, overcoming threats and obstacles from Iranian authorities. In the months after his return to Toronto, Esmaeilion and relatives of others who died in the plane crash formed the Association of Families of Flight PS752 Victims, for which he continues to serve as spokesman.
Their simple goals were justice for the dead and accountability for the perpetrators. But their efforts ran into bureaucratic roadblocks, a pandemic, the war in Ukraine, and apathy from a world desensitized by an endless diet of bad news.

That is, until this past September, when protests erupted in Tehran after the death in police custody of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini. Among the many members of the Iranian diaspora who amplified the demands of protesters inside Iran were members of the Association of Families of Flight PS752 Victims.

Now Esmaeilion has become a leading voice outside Iran in the anti-regime movement — an essential bridge between Iranians in diaspora who want to promote a freer future for their homeland and the millions inside Iran who live under an abusive system that has long operated with impunity.
#iran #iranprotests #iranrevolution 
#hamedesmaeilion
Image Text: Opinion A moral leader emerges for Iranian protesters outside Iran By Jason Rezaian Global Opinions writer Follow December 28, 2022 at 7:00 a.m. EST JUSTICE FOR THE VICTIMS FLIGHT PS752
description_lower:
when i first met iranian author and activist hamed esmaeilion, one morning this past october in california, i was already well aware of his story.
on jan. 8, 2020, esmaeilion’s wife, parisa, and only child, 9-year-old reera, were killed when the islamic revolutionary guard corps shot down ukraine international airlines flight 752 shortly after it took off from tehran’s international airport. the mother and daughter were returning to canada after visiting family in iran over the winter holidays. esmaeilion, a dentist and writer whose novels critical of the islamic republic were growing increasingly popular inside and outside iran, had stayed behind in toronto, knowing that if he traveled with his family, he would probably run into trouble with iranian authorities.

after the horrific crash, esmaeilion returned to iran to take possession of his family’s remains for burial in canada, overcoming threats and obstacles from iranian authorities. in the months after his return to toronto, esmaeilion and relatives of others who died in the plane crash formed the association of families of flight ps752 victims, for which he continues to serve as spokesman.
their simple goals were justice for the dead and accountability for the perpetrators. but their efforts ran into bureaucratic roadblocks, a pandemic, the war in ukraine, and apathy from a world desensitized by an endless diet of bad news.

that is, until this past september, when protests erupted in tehran after the death in police custody of 22-year-old mahsa amini. among the many members of the iranian diaspora who amplified the demands of protesters inside iran were members of the association of families of flight ps752 victims.

now esmaeilion has become a leading voice outside iran in the anti-regime movement — an essential bridge between iranians in diaspora who want to promote a freer future for their homeland and the millions inside iran who live under an abusive system that has long operated with impunity.
#iran #iranprotests #iranrevolution 
#hamedesmaeilion

.
.
"Raise your daughters to shout, to scream, to hold their heads up high for being themselves before society tries to teach them how to silence themselves, how to wear shame like it's a second skin. Let them taste rebellion from the moment they are born and watch them become flames to start a revolution."
.
.
.
Author: Nikita Gill
.
.
.

.

Description:
No, Iran has not sentenced 15,000 prisoners to death. Not even “reputable” imperialist newspapers are reporting this. Please see @ustazamashriq’s latest post for a deep debunking. 

If you live in the West, your primary concern should be to agitate for non-intervention. Regardless of what’s happening in Iran, our governments have been frothing at the mouth for regime change since 1979. The same government that routinely denies essential goods to the citizens of the Islamic Republic are now standing on soapboxes demanding that the government respect “human rights.” Their hypocrisy is too blatant to ignore. They want to see the country toppled given the important role it plays in anti-imperialist struggles throughout the region. Remember: the Palestinian resistance has received material support from the country for many, many years.

You can support the women of Iran by defending their sovereignty. Don’t let this be another Afghanistan.

Description:
Every now and then, demons and monsters have taken a human form and used religion to lure the weak into a false crusade in the name of God.  Spreading fear and darkness everywhere they go. 

The Spanish inquisition, ISIS, and now the fundamentalist Islamic regime in Iran who hate in the name of God are vivid examples of how religious people who have no true connection with the light become false advocates of the light by their extremists and erroneous views forced fed by the Serious men ( extremists religious leaders). 

We as spirits have the amazing task to come to this realm and have a unique human experience to understand what it is to be God-like: a vehicle of Unconditional love and compassion.  This is exactly what Mohamed, Jesús, Buddha, and Krishna came to this realm to teach us. 

Unfortunately, the serious men with their strong egoic minds and fear in their hearts have conspired to conceal this truth from the masses, so they can be controlled with fear. 

The time has come for us to honor our divine nature and  remove the blindfolds, and the hijabs so we can no longer see the illusion of separation from the other spirits and with the Divine.  Women of Iran you are the descendants of a powerful empire you are the Goddess and the nucleus of your family.  Use your power to dissipate Darkness. The entire energy of the world is with you. Namaste  #Repost @kamiparsamd

#Iran #IranProtests #IranInReality #iranianlivesmatter #Mahsa_Amini #MahsaAmini #opiran #nikashakarami #womanlifefreedom #womanrights #humanrights

Description:
Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has joined the chorus of social media trolls circulating a brazen lie against the Islamic Republic, as a campaign of fake news targeting the country goes into overdrive.

Trudeau tweeted on Monday evening that Canada “denounces the Iranian regime’s barbaric decision to impose the death penalty on nearly 15,000 protestors. These brave Iranians were fighting for their human rights — and we continue to stand united in support of them, and united against the regime’s heinous actions.”

Within that tweet, however, there is a false premise that Iran is planning to execute “nearly 15,000 protesters” arrested in the wake of street protests and violent rallies sparked in mid-September by yet another piece of fake news – the alleged police killing of 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini.

Trudeau’s post, despite being immediately dismissed as false by several Twitter users, remained up for more than 11 hours and was shared thousands of times before it was deleted.

While the Canadian prime minister may have been the most important politician who shared the fake story, there were countless others who piled on – whether intentionally or unintentionally – and condemned the Islamic Republic thanks to the incredible lie.

The fake report especially went viral on Twitter and Instagram, where an infographic claimed that “Iran Sentences 15,000 protesters to death — as a ‘hard lesson’ for all rebels.” Many celebrities also fell for the lie and shared it with their followers.

#Iran #Canada #JustinTrudeau #FakeNews
Image Text: Canada's Trudeau, misinformed by fake news, claims Iran is executing '15,000 protesters' PRESSTV.IR
description_lower:

the fake report especially went viral on twitter and instagram, where an infographic claimed that “iran sentences 15,000 protesters to death — as a ‘hard lesson’ for all rebels.” many celebrities also fell for the lie and shared it with their followers.

#iran #canada #justintrudeau #fakenews

Description:
A satellite observed methane emissions in a remote corner of Fars Province, in southern Iran, on November 6.

The emissions monitoring company @ghgsat attributed the plume to the oil and gas sector and estimated methane was spewing at a rate of 795 kilograms an hour at the time of the observation. 

The emissions occurred near the Arsanjan-Kheirgoo Gas Compressor Station. The site’s three compressors help ship as much as 110 million cubic meters of gas a day from the South Pars field 1,050 kilometers (650 miles) north to Tehran and were designed to increase transmission capacity during the winter heating season, according to a promotional video from the site's operating subsidiary Sekafco.

National Iranian Oil spews more methane than any other global energy producer according to a report last week by the San Francisco-based Global Energy Monitor. The non-profit group found that just 30 fossil fuel companies account for nearly half of the sector’s emissions of the potent greenhouse gas. (See the list in the article at the link in our bio.)

Methane is the primary component of natural gas and responsible for about 30% of the Earth’s warming. Releases and leaks can occur during extraction and transport of the fossil fuel.

Scientists say reducing the emissions of methane, which has 84 times the warming power of carbon dioxide during its first two decades in the atmosphere, is one of the fastest and cheapest ways to cool the planet.

All throughout the #COP27 climate talks, Bloomberg Green will exclusively publish new satellite images of methane releases captured around the world, in collaboration with GHGSat.

Read more about this project for free at the link in our bio. 

The Bloomberg team is providing extensive coverage of the COP27 global climate talks. As a service to readers, Bloomberg.com has lifted its paywall for Bloomberg Green, providing all of its content for free from now through November 18.

Explore our archive: bloomberg.com/green

📷: @ghgsat
Image Text: Bloomberg Green Release location Iran Sector Oil and gas GHGSAT mapbox Methane emission rate/hr ~795 kg

Description:
As per a new report by Atlas VPN, with 303 vulnerabilities and a cumulative total of 3,159 vulnerabilities as of 2022, Google Chrome has become the most vulnerable browser available.

The report by Atlas VPN has stated that these figures are based on data from the VulDB vulnerability database, covering January 1, 2022 to October 5, 2022.

As per the report, Google Chrome is the only browser with new vulnerabilities in the five days in October. Recent ones are CVE-202203318, CVE-2022-3314, CVE-2022-3311, CVE-2022-3309 and CVE-2022-3307.

The CVE programme tracks security flaws and vulnerabilities across multiple platforms. The database does not list details for these flaws, but the report said they can lead to memory corruption on a computer.

Users can fix these by updating to Google Chrome version 106.0.5249.61. Reportedly, Mozilla’s Firefox browser is in second place for vulnerabilities with 117 of them.

Microsoft Edge was reported to have 103 vulnerabilities as of October 5, with 61% more than the entire year of 2021. Overall, it had 806 vulnerabilities since its release.

Talking about Safari, it has some of the lowest levels of vulnerabilities in comparison with others. In the first three quarters of 2022, it witnessed 26 vulnerabilities and its number of cumulative vulnerabilities were 1,139 since its release, the report said.

Notably, the Opera browser had no documented vulnerabilities so far in 2022 and only 344 total vulnerabilities.

As of May 2022, Safari has witnessed over a billion users and Apple has been working hard to make sure its browser is secure and safe to use.

#studywithexperts #india #google #apple #safari #internet #virus #safe #browser  #microsoft #googlechrome #vpn
Image Text: Google Chrome Chrome Is The Most Unsafe Browser In 2022 With 303 Vulnerabilities, Says Reports PUBLISHEDON STUDYWITHEXPERTS Goo Google gle Among The Safer Browser Is Apple's Safari, Which Is Currently The Second-Most Widely Used Browser After Google Chrome. INSTAGRAM/STUDYWITHEXPERTS
description_lower:
as per a new report by atlas vpn, with 303 vulnerabilities and a cumulative total of 3,159 vulnerabilities as of 2022, google chrome has become the most vulnerable browser available.

the report by atlas vpn has stated that these figures are based on data from the vuldb vulnerability database, covering january 1, 2022 to october 5, 2022.

as per the report, google chrome is the only browser with new vulnerabilities in the five days in october. recent ones are cve-202203318, cve-2022-3314, cve-2022-3311, cve-2022-3309 and cve-2022-3307.

the cve programme tracks security flaws and vulnerabilities across multiple platforms. the database does not list details for these flaws, but the report said they can lead to memory corruption on a computer.

users can fix these by updating to google chrome version 106.0.5249.61. reportedly, mozilla’s firefox browser is in second place for vulnerabilities with 117 of them.

microsoft edge was reported to have 103 vulnerabilities as of october 5, with 61% more than the entire year of 2021. overall, it had 806 vulnerabilities since its release.

talking about safari, it has some of the lowest levels of vulnerabilities in comparison with others. in the first three quarters of 2022, it witnessed 26 vulnerabilities and its number of cumulative vulnerabilities were 1,139 since its release, the report said.

notably, the opera browser had no documented vulnerabilities so far in 2022 and only 344 total vulnerabilities.

as of may 2022, safari has witnessed over a billion users and apple has been working hard to make sure its browser is secure and safe to use.

#studywithexperts #india #google #apple #safari #internet #virus #safe #browser  #microsoft #googlechrome #vpn

Description:
Tehran and Moscow are discussing the possible launch of a stablecoin for international settlements. The Russian Vedomosti news agency has revealed in an article that Russia and Iran are gearing up to launch a new gold-backed stablecoin.

This new stablecoin would be used for cross-border transactions instead of USD and other fiat currencies, and it would first  operate in a special economic zone in Astrakhan, where Russia is accepting cargo shipments from Iran. Iran is exploring new alternative methods of conducting foreign trade in the context of ongoing international trade sanctions against the country. 

According to Alexander Brazhnikov, executive director of the Russian Association of Crypto Industry and Blockchain, the token is anticipated to be released in the form of a stablecoin backed by gold (RACIB). Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath was excited at this news and tweeted, "Iran and Russia to issue a new stablecoin backed by Gold. Damn, if this picks up could be day 1, event 1 of establishing a new economic order everywhere. No idea why it's getting no oxygen from the global press."

Stablecoins are cryptocurrencies whose value is pegged to an external variable, for example, if a stablecoin is pegged to the Indian rupee with 1:1 parity, this would mean that the value of one unit of the cryptocurrency shall remain Rs 1 and will not change with market volatility. The stablecoin intends to replace fiat currencies like the US dollar, the Russian ruble, or the Iranian rial, for cross-border transactions.

#russia #iran #cryptocurrency #tnec #news

Description:
The scenes of fire and reports of gunshots from Evin prison are harrowing and deeply disturbing. We’ve seen loved ones desperately gathering outside the prison to check on their loved ones and friends unjustly detained there. For context: Over the decades since it was erected in 1972, Evin has been the site of untold numbers of tortures, violence, sexual harassment and executions. People imprisoned there include intellectuals, anti-regime resistance fighters, student protestors and journalists like Niloufar Hamedi (pictured here) the brave reporter who is the reason we know about #mahsaamini unjust death in custody. Evin is symbolic to Iranian regime of its tyranny and power to quash resistance, and is hugely important to psyche of the regime. More personally, I’ve had friends inside Evin who have been subject to torture and the scenes these last 24 hours have been extremely distressing to witness. The Iranian government has a duty of care to its prisoners that it hasn’t shown to date and it won’t likely do so now. Please keep posting and keep the story alive. After a month of uprisings, the Iranian people refuse to be silenced. ✊🏽💚 

#opiran #iran #evinprison #iranprotests #iranprotests2022 #niloufarhamedi #womenlifefreedom #whereistheun #mahsaamini

Description:
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said Thursday that his government “strongly supports” the ongoing protests for women’s rights in Iran. 

Trudeau’s statement comes after Iranians called on Canada to act in defence of the protesters who have come out in droves over the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini. Amini died while in police custody for supposedly violating the Islamist theocracy’s mandatory veiling laws. 

“Canada strongly supports people who are expressing themselves and protesting peacefully in Iran. We are calling on the Iranian regime to end its repression of freedom of expression – and to end the ongoing harassment of, and discrimination against, women,” tweeted Trudeau. 

Read more at www.tnc.news (link in bio)
Image Text: NEWS TRUE TRUENORTH NORTH Trudeau says says he "strongly supports" Iran protests Read more: tnc.news

Description:
1. Thank you for the overwhelming notifications regarding the fake account garzchanz
Please ALWAYS report accounts that solicit you. I don't EVER solicit people for my services. Please report garzchanz and any other fake accounts. Thanks!! (I find myself reporting fake profiles every other week for certain people I follow. It's very unfortunate. Maybe it's time to exit the gram...).

2. Gen Z Iranians did not come to play! Mad respect!! Project the best possible outcome. Project the best outcome. Project the best. 

3. Box breathing for anxiety. Practice for 3 minutes when you feel anxious. 

4. Remember who tf you are. You may be spiritual, but you ain't soft.

5. Divine Feminine Rising.

6. I only need when I compare myself to others. 

7. My generation was raised to tolerate and accept abuse; hence we have (as my son puts it) "really low standards." Enabling and excusing abuse and abusers gets to stop. 

8. No more pedestals. If you're fortunate enough, you'll find out why. 

9. Lightworkers/Alchemists - recharge. It's heavy. Tap out. Take turns. Rotate. Take shifts. Self-care.

10. Regulate the nervous system. 

#mahsaamini #nikashakarami #sarinaesmailzadeh #boxbreathing #anxiety #recover #heal #uterus #ovaries #cervix #reproductiverights #divinefeminine #meditation #worshipnoone #nervoussystemreset #freeiran #womensrights #humanrights #newearth #hijab #heal #revolution #garzchan

Description:
Hackers stole the email addresses of more than 200 million Twitter users and posted them on an online hacking forum, a security researcher said Wednesday.

The breach “will unfortunately lead to a lot of hacking, targeted phishing and doxxing,” Alon Gal, co-founder of Israeli cybersecurity-monitoring firm Hudson Rock, wrote on LinkedIn. He called it “one of the most significant leaks I've seen.”

Twitter has not commented on the report, which Gal first posted about on social media on December 24, nor responded to inquiries about the breach since that date. It was not clear what action, if any, Twitter has taken to investigate or remediate the issue.

To read the full article, visit Gadgets360.com (clickable link in bio)

#Twitter #Hacker #Hack #Hacking #Email #ElonMusk #TechNews #News
Image Text: 360 Twitter Hacked, Over 200 Million User Email Addresses Leaked: Researcher
