Description:
Posted @withrepost • @babaktafreshi A starry night in the Alborz Mountains near Tehran. For generations this volcano has been the symbol of endurance for Iranians, a unifying icon in their darkest times. The highest peak in the Middle East, Mt Damavand, is too massive for the Islamic Republic to take away from Iranians, as is their hope for freedom. What is currently happening in Iran, with brutal shooting at protestors, is crime against humanity. The world’s media and leaders remained mostly silent, with no international reporter allowed in Iran. The human rights organization @amnesty has started a petition for a UN investigation. 
For 4 decades Iranians have lost their today and tomorrow, peace and happiness. Art, culture, justice, honesty, and dignity have been constantly suppressed under the name of Islamic rules. 
In the previous two posts I explained why the largest uprising of Iranians against the Islamic Republic is started in mid-September with women rights movement. Brave young women lead this unstoppable tsunami of change. The protests are now also in major universities and high schools. 
Slide 3: enforced hijab and women control is the red line of the Islamic Republic. In an old bazaar of Tehran, women walk without hijab in a nation-wide form of protest. #4: the daughter of #minomajidi who was killed while protesting hold her cut hairs at the grave of her mother. #5: school students removed their hijab and express their disgust to ayatollahs. #6: Security forces shooting protestors in Tehran. #7: Forces attacked protesting students at Sharif University; Iran’s top university. #8: this movement started in 1979 right after the Islamic Revolution. About 100,000 women came to the streets of Tehran to protest the force use of hijab (photo by Hengameh Golestan). #iranprotests #mahsaamini #damavand

Description:
Elon Musk said Friday his rocket company SpaceX cannot indefinitely fund its Starlink internet service in Ukraine, which has helped the country's civilians and military stay online during the war with Russia. ⁠
⁠
Musk's comment on Twitter came after a media report that SpaceX had asked the Pentagon to pay for the donations of Starlink. The billionaire has been in online fights with Ukrainian officials over a peace plan he put forward that Ukraine says is too generous to Russia. ⁠
⁠
The billionaire who runs Tesla said that Starlink officials said they spend nearly $20 million a month for maintaining satellite services in Ukraine. Musk recently said that SpaceX had spent about $80 million to enable and support Starlink there. ⁠
⁠
"SpaceX is not asking to recoup past expenses, but also cannot fund the existing system indefinitely *and* send several thousand more terminals that have data usage up to 100X greater than typical households. This is unreasonable," Musk wrote Friday on Twitter. ⁠
⁠
"We’ve also had to defend against cyberattacks & jamming, which are getting harder," Musk wrote. ⁠
⁠
CNN reported on Thursday that SpaceX sent a letter to the Pentagon last month saying it could not continue to fund the Starlink service in Ukraine, and it may have to stop funding it unless the U.S. military gives the company tens of millions of dollars a month. ⁠
⁠
👉Tap the link in our bio to learn more. ⁠
- ⁠
#elonmusk #ukraine #russia #voanews
Image Text: Musk Says SpaceX Cannot Fund Ukraine's Starlink Internet Indefinitely REUTERS

Description:
WOMEN, LIFE, FREEDOM

📌 WHAT: Oslo-based NGO Iran Human Rights estimates that at least 133 persons, including women and children, have been killed in the last two weeks during protests over the custodial death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini. 

🩸 Iranian security forces in Zahedan city, Sistan and Baluchistan province shot at protestors, killing more than 40 people on September 30.

🇮🇷 Iranian state television has confirmed 41 deaths, including security forces. 

👉🏼 Over 1,200 people have been arrested, including at least 20 journalists, per Iran Human Rights.

✊🏾 The protests continue, 16 days on. They have now spread to over 150 cities. The rallying cry: Women, Life, Freedom. 

📷 The image in the post graphic has been sourced from Twitter, where people are crowdsourcing protest artwork, often anonymously from Iran. The image depicts the bleeding ear that can be seen in Mahsa Amini’s final photo from a hospital, right before she died, lending credence to eye witness claims and media reports that she was beaten by the morality policy after being detained for wearing her hijab ‘improperly’. 

#mahsaamini #mahsa_amini #mahsa_amini #iranprotests2022 #newsworthywithab
Image Text: [NEWSWORTHY] 133 killed in Iran protests #MahsaAmini

Description:
Its the fall season in northern hemisphere  and  I  see my talented  friends  are  busy creating beautiful  orange and yellow colour  images from pies, tarts to breads and cakes. So creative,  eye-catching and inspirational.  While ,  I scroll down these  fabulous images, I  see footage from my homeland Iran.  In one video, I watch a woman face is covered with blood and in other a mother mourns on his son grave. These scenes are  heartbreaking,  overwhelming and painful. I cry, yell and feel outrageous.
It is nearly a month  since #mahsaamini  a 22 years old girl was brutaly killed by the  Islamic regime of Iran. This  was the moment of  explosion as a result of  43 years  oppression,  gender apartheid, human right violence,  corupted economy, poverty,  and dictatorship.  Since then  Iranian  from largest to smallest cities including women,  men,  universities and even  high school students united together and put  thier lives in extreme danger  to fight for their freedom.  The Islamic regime is  murdering children and youths all over the Iran and  another genocide is happening right now. The regime  has arrested many students, journalists,  actors, and lawyers. They wont let to international journalists and authorities to freely enter Iran  and report the  protests. ( everyday, I am posting several stories about the current situation inside Iran.) Furthermore,  the internet has been cut off by the regime and we are the only voice they have.  If you care about human right  and your heart aches by watching, hearing or reading the news about Iran, please share the news about Iran and be the voice of people who are fighting so hard to get their freedom back.

گیرم که در باورتان به خاک نشسته ام

و ساقه های جوانم از ضربه های تبرهایتان زخم دار است

با ریشه چه می کنید؟

گیرم که بر سر این باغ بنشسته در کمین پرنده اید

پرواز را علامت ممنوع می زنید

با جوجه های نشسته در آشیان چه می کنید؟

گیرم که می کشید

گیرم که می برید

گیرم که می زنید

با رویش ناگزیر جوانه ها چه می کنید؟ 

#mahsaamini
#nikashakarami 
#hadisnajafi
#Iranianrevolution

description_lower:
its the fall season in northern hemisphere  and  i  see my talented  friends  are  busy creating beautiful  orange and yellow colour  images from pies, tarts to breads and cakes. so creative,  eye-catching and inspirational.  while ,  i scroll down these  fabulous images, i  see footage from my homeland iran.  in one video, i watch a woman face is covered with blood and in other a mother mourns on his son grave. these scenes are  heartbreaking,  overwhelming and painful. i cry, yell and feel outrageous.
it is nearly a month  since #mahsaamini  a 22 years old girl was brutaly killed by the  islamic regime of iran. this  was the moment of  explosion as a result of  43 years  oppression,  gender apartheid, human right violence,  corupted economy, poverty,  and dictatorship.  since then  iranian  from largest to smallest cities including women,  men,  universities and even  high school students united together and put  thier lives in extreme danger  to fight for their freedom.  the islamic regime is  murdering children and youths all over the iran and  another genocide is happening right now. the regime  has arrested many students, journalists,  actors, and lawyers. they wont let to international journalists and authorities to freely enter iran  and report the  protests. ( everyday, i am posting several stories about the current situation inside iran.) furthermore,  the internet has been cut off by the regime and we are the only voice they have.  if you care about human right  and your heart aches by watching, hearing or reading the news about iran, please share the news about iran and be the voice of people who are fighting so hard to get their freedom back.

گیرم که در باورتان به خاک نشسته ام

و ساقه های جوانم از ضربه های تبرهایتان زخم دار است

با ریشه چه می کنید؟

گیرم که بر سر این باغ بنشسته در کمین پرنده اید

پرواز را علامت ممنوع می زنید

با جوجه های نشسته در آشیان چه می کنید؟

گیرم که می کشید

گیرم که می برید

گیرم که می زنید

با رویش ناگزیر جوانه ها چه می کنید؟

Description:
Protesters rallied across Iran and strikes were reported throughout the country's Kurdish region Saturday as demonstrations against the death of a woman in police custody entered their third week. ⁠
⁠
The protests, sparked by the death of Mahsa Amini, a 22-year-old from Iranian Kurdistan, have spiraled into the biggest show of opposition to Iran's clerical authorities since 2019, with dozens killed in unrest across the country. ⁠
⁠
People demonstrated in London and Paris and elsewhere on Saturday in solidarity with Iranian protesters, some holding pictures of Amini, who died three days after being arrested by the Islamic Republic's morality police for "unsuitable attire." ⁠
⁠
In Iran, social media posts showed rallies in large cities including Tehran, Isfahan, Rasht and Shiraz. ⁠
⁠
In Tehran's traditional business district of Bazaar, anti-government protesters chanted "We will be killed one by one if we don't unite," while elsewhere they blocked a main road with a fence torn from the central reservation, videos shared by the widely followed Tavsir1500 Twitter account showed. ⁠
⁠
Students also demonstrated at numerous universities. At Tehran University, dozens were detained, Tavsir1500 said. The semi-official Fars news agency said some protesters were arrested in a square near the university. ⁠
⁠
👉Tap the link in our bio to learn more. ⁠
- ⁠
#iran #voanews

Description:
#NetSnippet | An Iranian man nicknamed the “dirtiest man in the world” for not taking a shower for decades has passed away. 

Amou Haji – not his real name, but an endearing nickname given to elderly people, died on Sunday in the village of Dejgah, the New York Post reported, citing state media.

He was buried in Farashband City in Fars on Tuesday.

As per IRNA (Islamic Republic News Agency), Haji had avoided showering over fears of “getting sick. However, for the first time a few months ago, “villagers had taken him to a bathroom to wash.”

According to New York Post Haji lived in isolation for most of his life in an open brick hut, which villagers made after he started sleeping in a hole in the ground.

Locals attributed Haji’s eccentricity to “emotional setbacks” in his youth. In 2014, the Tehran Times reported that Haji also avoided fresh food, opting instead for rotted porcupine, and smoked a pipe of animal excrement.

Reportedly, a short documentary film titled “The Strange Life of Amou Haji” was made about his life in 2013.

#dirtiestman #passedaway #Iran #NortheastToday
Image Text: NET Snippet 'World's dirtiest man' dies in Iran at 94, months after first bath in 70 years NET Northeast Today @NortheastToday

Description:
Iran has released prominent actress Taraneh Alidoosti on bail almost three weeks after she was jailed for expressing solidarity with protesters.

Prior to the arrest, Alidoosti criticised the Iranian government's executions of protesters in the Mahsa Amini movement and was pictured holding a sign saying "woman, life, freedom" on Instagram. Her Instagram account has been suspended since her arrest.

The actress is best known for her role in the Oscar-winning film The Salesman. An online campaign urging the release of Alidoosti was supported by @markruffalo, Kristen Stewart, @penelopecruzoficial, Jason Momoa and many others.

#10NewsFirst #TaranehAlidoosti #Iran #MahsaAmini #WomanLifeFreedom

Description:
We stand in solidarity with the women and girls of Iran. #WomenLifeFreedom #MahsaAmini
--
UN Women Australia, like so many other organisations has been frustrated by the limited access to information from Iran, other than news reports and social media content. The recent black out of the internet, is a testament to the courage the women and girls in Iran, staring down formidable and powerful oppressors.

As the women and girls of Iran fight to get their message out, we add our voice to theirs, and keep the spotlight on focusing international attention on the plight of the women of Iran, and their ongoing fight for justice. 

Women’s rights are human rights – let the women of Iran know we stand with them. Share their stories and amplify their voices.
--
English Translation: Women, Life, Freedom.
Image Text: ‎'‎زن زندگی آزادی‎'‎

Description:
Women in Iran are burning their hijabs in protest after a young woman died while in the custody of the country’s morality police, who are charged with enforcing the country’s dress codes. 

Mahsa Amini had been detained by authorities Thursday while visiting relatives in Tehran. She had been arrested for wearing “unsuitable attire,” Reuters reports. According to members of her family and other eyewitness accounts, Amini was beaten by authorities following her arrest. 

She died while in hospital on Friday, after three days in a coma. 

State authorities have denied that Amini was beaten, and instead allege that she died of a heart attack. 

Iranians across the country have been protesting since her death, many of them women, calling for reform of Iran’s theocratic laws, including strict dress codes which require women to remain largely covered while in public. The protests have been described as the largest since 2019, which occurred amid soaring gas prices. 

“I’ve covered #Iran for 15 years and lived there for 25 yrs. I believe what we are witnessing now is nothing like before,” wrote BBC journalist Rana Rahimpour in a message posted on Twitter.

Description:
More than $600 million in crypto left bankrupt crypto company FTX’s wallets late Friday, with little clear explanation as to why.
Soon afterwards, FTX stated in its official Telegram channel that it had been hacked, instructing users not to install any new upgrades and to delete all FTX apps.

DELETE FTX from your devices now.

Description:
HAS THE MORALITY POLICE BEEN DISBANDED? WE DON'T KNOW

🎤 What we know: The morality police “has nothing to do with the judiciary and has been abolished by the same authorities who installed it.” This quote of the Attorney General Mohammad Javad Montazeri on Dec 3 at a meeting with officials to discuss the unrest, according to the Iranian Students' News Agency (ISNA) was widely reported and interpreted by international and Indian news platforms, including us (post now removed), as Iran’s morality police being disbanded.

📌Since then: Iranians have taken to social media to dismiss this news as disinformation, calling it a throwaway remark that amounts to nothing on the ground, where the the Iranian government continues to suppress protestors through arrests, and violence.

📺 Arab-language Al-Alam state television has said that foreign media were depicting Montazeri’s comments as “a retreat on the part of the Islamic Republic from its stance on hijab and religious morality as a result of the protests”, but  all that could be understood from his comments was that the morality police were not directly related to the judiciary. "No official of the Islamic Republic of Iran has said that the Guidance Patrol has been shut."

❓What we don't know: 

👉🏼 If the Attorney General's statement will actually translate into the Morality Police being withdrawn.

👉🏼 Even if the morality police is disbanded, will the government take to other methods of enforcing compliance with Sharia laws?

👉🏼 Even if the morality police is disbanded, will it lead to a change in the strict Sharia laws on how women should dress and behave in public? 

👉🏼 The official stance of the government. Iran's Ministry of Interior is yet to issue a statement. 

🇮🇷 Bottom line: Iranian protestors have dismissed this news as a superficial, half-baked attempt to divert the western media's attention. They say their demands are no longer limited to the disbanding of the morality police, they want a complete regime change. 

#mahsaamini #mahsa #mahsaaminiمهسا_امینی #iranprotests #iranprotests2022 #iranprotest #newsworthywithab
Image Text: [NEWSWORTHY] Iran's morality police, 'disbanded' amid street protests Iran Disbands Morality Police, Considers Changing Hijab Laws, Official Says Iran Abolishes 'Morality Police' After Months- Long Protest Iran to disband morality police amid ongoing protests, says attorney general Iran Has Abolished Morality Police, an Official Suggests, After Months of Protests newsworthywithab A BIG WIN FOR PROTESTORS NOW: Iran has reportedly scrapped its morality police! Their main role was enforce strict rules how people, bumy women, dress and behave in public "Morality police have nothing to do with the judiciary

Description:
I think this came from @_the.wellness.therapist originally. Do read the caption 🙏🏼 #mahsaamini #womanlifefreedom #opiran 
👇 
Our sisters & brothers in Iran have lost access to the internet. They are risking their lives by simply refusing to wear the hijab & to peacefully protest. The regime of the Islamic Republic of Iran has shut down their connection to the outside world. They are being killed in the dark. I humbly ask for your support in sharing their stories & how they are courageously risking life & limb just to be heard. 

Iranians are asking for those outside of Iran to their voice.

1. Repost footage of protests to all social media platforms 

The Islamic Republic of Iran regime is blocking the internet. Iranians have to use VPN & other dangerous methods to get content out. When we reshare the videos/photos that do get out, we are helping to amplify the voices of Iranians. They want us to help get their stories out. 

Doing so also scares the regime because they don’t want the international community to see what is happening. Footage being widespread online also raises morale of Iranians to keep protesting. 

2. Use specific & creative hashtAgs to get thE word out 

Use these tags when you post: 
#mahsaamini #jinaamini #zhinaamini #Mahsa_Amini #iran #iranprotests

The tags above are designed for those who are already aware of whats happening in Iran. To get the story out to those who aren’t aware of it, use other popular hashtags such as: 

#food #fall #halloween #family #love #photography #news #politics etc. get creative! 

3. No war. No western intervention.
Keep your support focused on Iranian people fighting for their own liberation. Say No war on Iran. Iranians don’t want Western foreign intervention. They want to fight for their own liberation. They just want support from the international community. They want the atrocities documented. 

4. Organize to support iranians where you live 
Go out in the streets & make some noise. Attend support rallies in your country. DISCLAIMER: Due to sanctions against Iran, it is illegal to fundraise to send money there legally. If you see people collecting funds, be weary

Description:
As the Iranian Government continues to censor and isolate the people of Iran, it’s important to keep sharing the word out and join in community with those fighting for their bodily autonomy, a better life, and a free society. 
 
The @nytimes reports that outlets like Instagram, Twitter and Clubhouse “constitute the only means of holding the powers that be to account.” All of us sharing and reposting on social media has been “critical for a lot of people to wake up and see what's really going on,” said Shahin Milani, Executive Director for the U.S.-based Iran Human Rights Documentation Center (@iran.hrdc) “and that's really critical because no other outlet provides that." 
 
Join in this global community and uplift the fight by sharing this, reposting, and commenting for Mahsa Imani, the young woman who’s death in morality police detainment started these protests, and people all across Iran fighting for a better life, a just government and a free society. 

 
Keep sharing, keep re-tweeting, keep commenting, sign the petition, our voices can be a lifeline. More info at the link in our bio or at https://policy.futureswithoutviolence.org/resource_center/the-facts-about-iran/.
 
#MahsaAmini #JusticeForMahsaAmini #مهسا_امینی

Description:
Shameful. 

Islamic Republic agents arrested the father of Aylar Haghi at the Vadi Rahmat Cemetery in Tabriz, East Azerbaijan province, at a gathering marking the 40th day since his daughter’s killing. 

Aylar, a medical student, was killed on November 17. 

Mourning is a human right that is repeatedly violated by Islamic Republic forces to block attempts to hold them accountable for ongoing rights violations.

Description:
Iranian footballer Amir Nasr-Azadani could reportedly face execution for campaigning for women's rights in his country.

Footballers' union FIFPRO, the worldwide representative organisation for 65,000 professional footballers, tweeted on Monday night (December 12): "FIFPRO is shocked and sickened by reports that professional footballer Amir Nasr-Azadani faces execution in Iran after campaigning for women’s rights and basic freedom in his country.”

@iranwire @iranintltv @amirnasrazadaani

Description:
Breaking news via @gissounia (repost) AMAZING: the US has now formally requested a special meeting of ECOSOC to remove the Islamic Republic of Iran from the UN Commission on the Status of Women. This follows voiced commitments from VP Kamala Harris, US Amb to the UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield, NZ Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, Canada’s foreign minister Melanie Joly, Canada’s deputy prime minister Chrystia Freeland and other folks in government to kick the #IRIoffCSW, and a letter signed by powerful women leaders all over the world that appeared in the centerfold of the New York Times last month. H/t @hillelneuer for keeping us informed.

#mahsaamini #womenlifefreedom #iranrevolution

Description:
A hacker was reportedly attempting to sell the data of hundreds of millions of users that was stolen in a Twitter breach.

Twitter was recently impacted by a data breach in which email addresses linked to nearly 300 million accounts were leaked. 

The Washington Post reported that on Dec. 23, the reported hacker who claimed credit for the online attack was advertising the account data for sale online, claiming to have 400 million records available for purchase. 

Alan Gal, the co-founder of Israeli security firm Hudson Rock, claims to have first uncovered the leak by alerting the public on his Linkedin account. 

Click the link in our bio for more details on this incident.
Image Text: Nearly 300 million email addresses leaked in recent Twitter data hack FOX26 HOUSTON

Description:
Reports of at least one doctor being killed by state security forces and at least six others being arbitrarily arrested at peaceful protests in Tehran and Mashhad indicate Iran’s medical community is facing deadly state violence as the Iranian government deploys lethal force to crush the country’s growing protest movement, said the Center for Human Rights in Iran (CHRI).

“Doctors who’ve spoken out against Islamic Republic forces occupying medical buildings and who are trying to treat wounded protesters are engaging in a courageous defense of the right to life and deserve international solidarity,” said CHRI Executive Director Hadi Ghaemi.

“Members of the medical community shouldn’t have to risk their lives to call on authorities to allow them to provide care in a safe environment, yet that’s what’s happening in Iran as we speak,” he added.

“The international medical community should join human rights groups in urgently calling on the Iranian government to allow doctors to protect human life without the threat of death or arbitrary arrest,” said Ghaemi. “And call for the immediate release of all detained medical workers.”

Many people in Iran who’ve been wounded amid the protests are too afraid to go to a hospital for treatment because protesters seeking medical help have been detained, according to several accounts shared with CBS News from both inside and outside Iran.

On October 25, members of the Tehran Medical Council issued a statement condemning state security forces patrolling medical buildings in search of protesters: “As members of the Tehran Medical Council, we condemn the military, police, security, and unidentified forces for entering medical universities and hospitals and demand that they stop.”

The statement also called “for the protection of the detainees and their families.” 

Learn more on our website (link in bio).

#Iran #IranProtests #IranProtests2022 #HumanRights #UN #FreeSpeech #Revolution #OpIran #MahsaAmini #IranRevolution #WomensRights #IranRevolution #Iranian #Tehran #Mahsa_Amini #WomenLifeFreedom

Description:
❗️Content Warning:❗This content discusses death, violence and a deceased person. We will not tolerate Islamophobia on this post, and any comments of this sort will be removed and reported immediately.

The people of Iran are calling on us to amplify their voices and speak up on the frightening reality that protestors are facing the death penalty as a result of their demonstrations. What is happening in Iran is a horrific violation of human rights, and goes against the civil liberties of people being able to protest against their government. 

You can stand in support by staying informed on what’s happening in Iran, following accounts reporting and sharing information in relation to the protests, and/or signing the petition/s through our link in bio. Follow @persianswithpurpose to find out more.

Description:
As the @humanrightscouncil prepares to hold a special session on #Iran, UN representatives must pay close attention to the arrests and ongoing detentions of Iranian writers, creatives, and public intellectuals who are under threat for their #FreeExpression amid the #MahsaAmini protests. @PENamerica joins the chorus of UN experts and civil society organizations supporting the establishment of an independent investigative mechanism on Iran to hold all perpetrators accountable for human rights abuses.

Alongside the detentions and assaults on protesters, the Iranian authorities have jailed writers and high-profile critics. Blogger #HosseinRonaghi has been detained since September 24 and is in critical condition, after being tortured and on a hunger strike for more than 60 days. Writer, poet, and professor #BehnazAmani was arrested on October 20 and has reportedly been detained at Varamin women’s prison. Writer and former political prisoner @golrokhiraee has been jailed since September 26. Poets #MonaBourzei and #BehrouzYasemi were detained after reading and posting their poetry online in response to the protests. Bourzei and Yasemi have since been released. Rappers and lyricists #SamanYasin and @OfficialToomaj remain detained since their arrests in October.

In 2022, even before the #MahsaAmini protests, filmmakers #JafarPanahi, #MohammadRasoulof, and #MostafaAleahmad were arrested for criticizing the authorities’ brutal response to protests in Abadan. Writer #SaeedMadani was arrested after commenting on protests over food shortages. According to @PENamerica’s #FreedomToWrite Index 2021, Iran jailed the fourth-most writers and public intellectuals last year. Writers like #ArashGanji, #RezaKhandanMahabadi, and #KhosroSadeghiBorojeni are still imprisoned. Read more at link in bio.
Image Text: Life does not exist in Qarchak Prison of Varamin, the largest women's prison in the Middle East. And this IS what could be said in a nutshell. Here you can see the depth of the catastrophe created by those who hold the positions of power... This is a full reflection of our society under an authoritarian rule. Golrokh Ebrahimi Iraee PEN AMERICA

Description:
Over the last few days, I have been taking somewhat of a social media break and indulging in information about what’s happening in Iran. I can’t stop thinking about the death of #MahsaAmini and the many woman fighting on the frontlines for their rights and freedom. Their bravery is beyond admirable and inspiring. Unfortunately many people have suffered the same fate as Mahsa in Iran and so many have been killed in protest. This is a movement 40 years in the making. For almost half a century, men and women have been living under oppression in Iran. My parents left the country to escape the oppressive regime. Right now, Iran has blocked access to the internet. While my social media post does not measure up to the courage and action being taken by the Iranian people on the ground who have been risking their lives fighting for their basic human rights, I must use my treasured freedom of speech to amplify the Iranian voices at the forefront of this movement. I stand in support and solidarity with you. ✊🏻#iranprotests #standwithiranianwomen 

Picture by Ozan Kose, Getty Images

Description:
Anonymous testimony showing just how devastating the impact of fat calling can be. The PSH fat individuals experience is often more violent and sexualised, leading to worsening mental health impacts for the victim 💔

👇⁠
Our Streets Now is a campaign working to end public sexual harassment (PSH) through cultural and legislative changes. Public sexual harassment is unwanted sexual attention by strangers in public spaces including gyms, bars, parks, and the streets. PSH can be leering, unwanted comments, beeping from passing vehicles, and even following.⁠
👇⁠
As a campaign, we use real-life testimonies from victims in order to illustrate the impact and reality of PSH. If you would like to share your experience(s) of PSH, you can submit yours via our website.⁠
💖⁠
#feminist #feminism #ourstreetsnow #girl  #girls #woman  #women #nonbinary #lgbtq #queer #intersectionality #british #england #men #xr #politics #vawg #harassment #metoo #psh #catcall #catcalling #clothes #girlpower #intersectionalfeminism  #fashion #clothing #outfit  #nonprofit #change
Image Text: BEING 'FATCALLED' SERIOUSLY IMPACTED MY MENTAL HEALTH. THE SEXUAL HARASSMENT RECEIVED AS I CONTINUED TO PUT ON WEIGHT SEEMED TO JUST GET MORE VIOLENT, MORE DESCRIPTIVE AND SEXUALISED. WAS MADE το FEEL UNLOVABLE AND LIKE MY BODY COULD NEVER BE ACCEPTED BY SOCIETY. -Anonymous testimony

Description:
#Repost @wolfgang_tillmans
・・・
“Woman, life, freedom”: It’s been more than a month since Zhina (Mahsa) Amini’s arrest by Iran's ‘morality police’ on September 13th. Three days later she died. Her death marked the beginning of anti-government protests which within days spread over the entire country.

Tomorrow, on Saturday, from 3–8pm, the "Woman* Life Freedom Kollektiv" is organising a large protest in Berlin to support the weeks-long resistance across an innumerable number of Iranian cities, standing up against oppression and discrimination in the Islamic Republic.

The Berlin protest will take the following route:

Begin 3pm:
Hofjägerallee (Antreteplatz) - Großer Stern - Spreeweg - John-Foster-Dulles-Allee - Yitzhak-Rabin-Str. - Str. des 17. Juni - Straße des 17. Juni / Großer Stern (Endplatz / ausschließlich Großer Stern)

Follow @womanlifefreedomcollective for more information and updates on the Berlin protest, and @from____iran for reporting on the protests in Iran and globally in English.
The artist @baharnoorizadeh shares and translates into English news and posts coming from both within and outside Iran. Follow her for daily updates and reports which are often not covered in Western media.

#MahsaAmini
#JinaAmii
#IranProtests
#IranProtests 2022
#solidarity 
#SolidarityWithProtestersInIran
#Woman_Life_Freedom
#womanlifefreedom

Description:
Hundreds of protesters marched Friday in the southeastern Iranian provincial capital, Zahedan, marking three months since the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini while in police custody, sparking nationwide anti-government unrest. ⁠
⁠
Videos obtained by VOA's Persian News Network, PNN, along with similar video posted to social media, show crowds marching and chanting anti-government slogans. PNN reported they also taunted Iranian security forces, including the Iranian Revolutionary Guard, comparing them to the terrorist group, the Islamic State. ⁠
⁠
In one video, demonstrators packing the streets can be heard chanting, "This nation wants freedom, this nation wants a settlement." ⁠
⁠
The government has responded with a harsh crackdown, leaving hundreds dead and thousands arrested, and leading to international condemnation and sanctions. ⁠
⁠
PNN also quoted the Zahedan Sunni Imam Maulvi Abdul Hamid, who criticized the government Friday for not listening to the people as they have protested these past several few months. ⁠
⁠
Iranian officials have insisted the protests are being driven by agents of the United States and other Western nations. ⁠
⁠
👉Tap the link in our bio to learn more. ⁠
• ⁠
• ⁠
• ⁠
• ⁠
• ⁠
#iran #photography #photojournalism #voanews
Image Text: Iran Protests Continue Friday as Unrest Enters Fourth Month AFP

Description:
Revolution Conversations: Today I spoke to Washington Post journalist Jason Rezaian @rezaian about the situation for journalists inside Iran, including Nilufar Hamedi and Elahe Mohammadi, the two female journalists who’ve been bogusly accused of espionage by the regime for their reporting on the death of Mahsa Jina Amini. We talk about what we can all do right now to support the freedom movement, how the US and the west (and southern nations) can step up to disavow the regime, and what the media can do better in terms of covering the situation inside Iran. 

#mahsaamini #womenlifefreedom #pressfreedom #iranprotests #iranrevolution #iran #niloofarhamedi #elahemohammadi  #hosseinronaghi #shervinhajiaghapour

Description:
By Natasha Phillips ((@sobukira)) 

The United Nations Special Rapporteur on the Islamic Republic of Iran, Javaid Rehman, will hold a briefing at the UN’s headquarters in New York on Oct. 27 to address the state of human rights in the country.

The conference will take place during the 3,944th meeting of the 136th session of the UN Human Rights Committee (CCPR).

Iran has been shaken  by nationwide protests since Sept. 16, following the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini. Amini was detained by the country’s morality police for breaching the country’s strict female dress code, and died in custody.

Protests began as a show of resistance against Iran’s compulsory hijab laws, then grew into a collective call for regime change. The rallies entered their fifth week on Oct. 23 and now involve women and men; children; ethnic and religious minority communities; and workers.

More than 200 people — including at least 23 children — have been killed by government security forces, according to reports by organizations monitoring the protests.

The announcement of the UN briefing follows an Oct. 17 letter by the world’s leading human rights organizations asking the UN Human Rights Council to hold a special session on Iran.

The letter to the UN was signed by 43 human rights groups, including: Human Rights Watch; Amnesty International; Article 19; the Abdorrahman Boroumand Center for Human Rights in Iran; the Center for Human Rights in Iran; Iran Human Rights; the Kurdistan Human Rights Network; and the Siamak Pourzand Foundation.

The letter said: “Given the gravity of crimes under international law and other serious human rights violations committed in Iran and the prevailing systemic impunity [the council should establish] an independent, investigative, reporting and accountability mechanism.”
Image Text: UN EXPERT ON IRAN TO HOLD HUMAN RIGHTS BRIEFING AMID NATIONWIDE PROTESTS Javaid Rehman

Description:
The company announced the development on its Twitter page on Monday.

Isa Ali Pantami, Nigeria's minister of communications and digital economy, celebrated the milestone in a social-media post.

He tweeted: "We have made it again. @SpaceX thank you for hosting me in your Headquarters, USA in December, 2022 to complete the logistics for the deployment."

SpaceX's CEO, Elon Musk, announced Starlink's plans to expand into Africa last year. In May, he said Starlink had been approved to provide broadband internet in Nigeria and Mozambique.

Starlink operates in dozens of countries and has more than one million users. However, Musk said the service is losing money.

Musk said in October that Starlink was suffering from a lack of funds, in response to a Twitter user who referenced CNN's report about SpaceX asking the Pentagon to pay for the service in Ukraine. He later said SpaceX had withdrawn the request for funding over Starlink in Ukraine.

SpaceX has provided the country with thousands of Starlink dishes since Russia invaded in February. The billionaire said in October that only 10,630 out of 25,300 Starlink terminals in Ukraine were paying for service.
Image Text: SINESS INSIDER AFRICA MARKETS SPACEX'S STARLINK IS ACTIVE IN AFRICA FOR THE FIRST TIME

Description:
As a Muslim and a member of parliament, I am horrified to read and hear about the continued brutal suppression of protests in Iran since the death of the 22 years old #MahsaJinaAmini mid-September 2022. The Islamic Republic of Iran’s police (IRI) and the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (the IRGC) have been arresting and murdering peaceful protesters with impunity. No government should murder, mass arrest, torture and execute its people and no government should escape being held accountable for hundreds of lives it’s taken so far. The torture, to obtain forced confession, and sexual violence of those arrested have been reported widely and is a known fact. The UN, along with dozens of respectable Human Rights Organisations including Amnesty International, have exposed the brutal methods the IRI uses to suppress any protests and cry for basic freedom. I am worried that the Iranian regime is going to murder and execute more innocent people, therefore, I am announcing my political sponsorship of two young people accused of the vague and dubious crimes of “Moharebeh” or “Waging war against God” and “spreading corruption on earth” punishable by death. #ShirinMarashi and #BahmanBahmani. These are made up charges to intimidate and silence those who are opposing the regime. I will talk about them in my next two posts. The IRI must immediately end its torture of #ShirinMarashi and #BahmanBahmani and release them. I will do anything in my power to work for their freedom and hold the Iranian government and its representatives in Wellington to account. 
#MahsaAmini #StopTheExecutionsInIran #IranRevolution #PoliticalSponsorships

Description:
إيران تشكو للفيفا من "تغيير" العلم الإيراني في منشور للمنتخب الأمريكي 
تقدم الإتحاد الإيراني لكرة القدم بشكوى للاتحاد الدولي لكرة القدم الفيفا، على خلفية إزالة شعار الجمهورية الإسلامية من علم إيران، في منشور لمنتخب الولايات المتحدة على وسائل التواصل الاجتماعي.
وأزالت الولايات المتحدة شعار الجمهورية الإسلامية، في صور نشرت على تويتر وفيسبوك وإنستاغرام.
وأعلن الجانب الأمريكي إنه قرر ألا يستخدم صورة علم إيران الرسمي، لإظهار "الدعم للنساء في إيران في نضالهن من أجل حقوق الإنسان الأساسية"، وسط استمرار الاحتجاجات المناهضة للحكومة. 
Iran complain to Fifa over flag change on social media by US.
Iran's football federation has complained to Fifa after the Islamic Republic emblem was removed from its flag in social media posts by the United States team.
Before their World Cup meeting on Tuesday, the US removed the Allah symbol in graphics posted on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.
The US said they decided not to use Iran's official flag to show "support for the women in Iran fighting for basic human rights", amid mass anti-government protests in the country.

Description:
On Sunday morning October 9, Iker Casillas tweeted, “I hope I’ll be respected: I’m gay.” Just one day after the former Real Madrid goalkeeper was reported to be in a relationship with a Spanish actress. Later on, he clarified that his account was hacked. He explained on his twitter account and he also apologised to his followers- morover the LGBT community. 

Prior to him getting his account back, Carles Puyol the Spanish football player responded to his tweet implying that they were in a relationship. Puyol did not claim his account was hacked, instead apologising for “a clumsy joke with no bad intentions”. Thoughts? [📸via @ikercasillas]
-
#USSFeed
Image Text: COURTESY OF KER CASILLAS IKER CASILLAS MENGAKU KENA HACK SETELAH TWEET DIRINYA GAY.

Description:
#Repost at #CriticalThreats - 

Footage circulating on social media suggests that protests following #Mahsah_Amini 's death have occurred in 19 of #Iran's 31 provinces within the past three days.

Protests that were initially concentrated in #Tehran City and throughout #Kurdistan Province – where Amini was from – have since spread nationwide within the past day, reaching historically conservative cities like #Qom 

Protestors have chanted anti-regime slogans against mandatory veiling and against Supreme Leader #Khamenei 's son, #Mojtaba , who some have speculated will succeed his father as #SupremeLeader 

Iranian social media users reported arrests, violence, and severe internet outages and disruptions in cities like #Sanandaj Kurdistan Province and #Tehran City in response to recent unrest.

The regime has deployed its anti-riot units to crack down on unrest, but has not yet mobilized the #IRGC Ground Forces as it did in 2019.

#KayhanLife #iranprotests2022 #mahsaamini #mahsaaminiمهسا_امینی #iranprotests

Description:
BNB Chain has finished a hard fork upgrade called Moran in an attempt to recover and secure infrastructure following a large hack last week.

The hard fork — a blockchain upgrade that implements a major change to the network's underlying software — went through successfully at 4 a.m. ET on Wednesday at a block height of 22,107,423. It was mainly executed to implement a software patch that resolved a critical vulnerability exploited by an unknown attacker to steal more than $100 million from BNB Chain's cross-chain bridge last Friday.

The developer team announced the upgrade with a GitHub post on Tuesday, saying it would carry out a hard fork to deploy a patch and re-enable the network's “cross-chain infrastructure.”

This cross-chain bridge allows users to transfer assets between the two separate blockchains that fall under the BNB Chain network: Beacon Chain and Smart Chain. While BNB Beacon Chain handles the network's governance and staking, the Smart Chain is used as an Ethereum Virtual Machine-compatible smart contract platform to deploy apps. Both of these chains can connect to other third-party chains with the help of Token Hub bridge as well.

During the exploit, the perpetrator forged security proofs, leveraging a vulnerability tied to "iavl hash check," a security check baked into the bridge. In this way, the hacker was able to mint 2 million BNB tokens out of thin air, worth around $560 million at the time. On-chain data shows that the hacker transferred more than $100 million out to third-party chains including Ethereum, Fantom, Polygon, Avalanche and Arbitrum. The majority of the affected assets (nearly $430 million) remained in the hacker's wallet on the BNB Chain itself. 

#blocklantis #cryptoarts #nftbrasil #foundationnft #openseanfts #nftweets #cryptoartgallery #nftr #nftmarket #nftgames #nftsale #nft4art #nftcrypto #nftartcollector #augmentedrealityart #nftgiveaway #ethereumnews #nftmarketplace #smartcontract #cryptoartwork #ethereummining #nftartgallery #tokens #coolcats #nftcollector #augmentedreality #vr #blockchain
Image Text: Time BINANCE m 1H 1D 1W 1M 6789.00 BNB CHAIN EXECUTES HARD FORK TO SECURE NETWORK AFTER $100 MILLION HACK BLOCKLANTIS

the hard fork — a blockchain upgrade that implements a major change to the network's underlying software — went through successfully at 4 a.m. et on wednesday at a block height of 22,107,423. it was mainly executed to implement a software patch that resolved a critical vulnerability exploited by an unknown attacker to steal more than $100 million from bnb chain's cross-chain bridge last friday.

the developer team announced the upgrade with a github post on tuesday, saying it would carry out a hard fork to deploy a patch and re-enable the network's “cross-chain infrastructure.”

this cross-chain bridge allows users to transfer assets between the two separate blockchains that fall under the bnb chain network: beacon chain and smart chain. while bnb beacon chain handles the network's governance and staking, the smart chain is used as an ethereum virtual machine-compatible smart contract platform to deploy apps. both of these chains can connect to other third-party chains with the help of token hub bridge as well.

during the exploit, the perpetrator forged security proofs, leveraging a vulnerability tied to "iavl hash check," a security check baked into the bridge. in this way, the hacker was able to mint 2 million bnb tokens out of thin air, worth around $560 million at the time. on-chain data shows that the hacker transferred more than $100 million out to third-party chains including ethereum, fantom, polygon, avalanche and arbitrum. the majority of the affected assets (nearly $430 million) remained in the hacker's wallet on the bnb chain itself.

Description:
Please follow along @officiallyjoko account, which has been taken over by Iranian human rights activist Azam Jangravi
to spread awareness of the current situation in Iran.

Posted @withrepost • @officiallyjoko Niloufar Hamedi, a Shargh newspaper journalist, is the journalist who for the first time reported the death of #MahsaAmini and her family’s words from inside Kasra Hospital in Tehran. She has been in detention since Sept 21, 2022. Elaheh Mohammadi, a Mihan newspaper journalist, is also another reporter in detention for going to Saqqez to investigate and report on Mahsa’s funeral.

Today, the Intelligence Ministry of the Islamic Republic and the Intelligence Service of IRGC published a joint-statement about recent protests in Iran and officially accused Niloufar and Elaheh to help the “foreign media” to propagate a biased narrative of what happened around Mahsa’a death. They were accused of doing so by publishing photos of her on the hospital bed (which showed head trauma) and reports of her funeral in Saqqez and people’s protest after that. In the statement, they claim that the two reporters has been trained on foreign soil to work for “the US mafia-like regime”. In recent days many reporters have been detained and are said to be kept in very harsh conditions in the prisons of Iran. 
Please be Iranian voice.

Description:
Massive cryptocurrency outflows began on Nov. 11 and continued into the early hours of Nov. 12, moving funds out of FTX and FTX US's wallets. Follow @benzinga 

Several FTX workers acknowledged on Twitter to sleuth ZachXBT that they were unaware of the transfers.

FTX General Counsel Ryne Miller tweeted that the exchange was "investigating abnormalities with wallet movements" more than an hour after the alleged hack began.

He later pinned a message in FTX's official Telegram support channel that read: "FTX has been hacked. FTX apps are malware. Delete them. Chat is open. Don’t go on FTX site as it might download Trojans."

Throughout the chaos, the official FTX Twitter account was silent.

Miller's Twitter account posted a statement from FTX CEO John Jay Ray III on the afternoon of Nov. 12, confirming the hack and stating that company officials were in contact with law enforcement.

According to Bloomberg, the criminal probe is separate from the fraud case against ousted former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried.

The report further stated that officials were able to freeze a portion of the stolen money. @benzinga 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

Description:
The protests, which were concentrated in Iran's Kurdish-populated northwestern regions but have spread to at least 50 cities and towns nationwide, are the largest since a wave of demonstrations in 2019 over gasoline price rises. 

With no sign of the protests easing, authorities restricted access to the internet, according to accounts from Hengaw, residents, and internet shutdown observatory NetBlocks.

Description:
I stand in solidarity with the family of Mahsa Amini, the women and the people of Iran who are fighting for their rights and freedoms.

The Canadian government is calling on the Iranian regime to end its repression of freedom of expression – and to end the ongoing harassment of, and discrimination against, women.

People will gather at 6:00 p.m. today in front of Fredericton City Hall to show their support for the women and people of Iran. Please join them if you can. 

#MahsaAmini #Mahsa_Amini #IranProtests #IranProtests2022 #مهسا_امینی 

///

Je suis solidaire de la famille de Mahsa Amini, des femmes et du peuple iranien qui luttent pour leurs droits et leurs libertés.

Le gouvernement canadien demande au régime iranien de mettre fin à sa répression de la liberté d'expression ainsi qu’au harcèlement et à la discrimination continus à l’encontre des femmes. 

Les gens se rassembleront à 18 h aujourd'hui devant l'hôtel de ville de Fredericton afin de démontrer leur soutien aux femmes et au peuple iranien. Veuillez vous joindre à eux si vous le pouvez.

Description:
.
.
.
.
ودر آن بهشت اجباری دیگر
Meanwhile, in that other mandatory heaven.
.
.
Reposted from @apnews Noura’s determination to play sports was so great that she defied her family’s opposition for years.⁠
⁠
But the 20-year-old Afghan woman could not defy her country’s Taliban rulers. They have not just banned all sports for women and girls, they have actively intimidated and harassed those who once played, often scaring them from even practicing in private, Noura and other women say.⁠
⁠
A number of girls and women who once played a variety of sports posed for an @apnews photographer for portraits with the equipment of the sports they loved. They hid their identities with burqas, the all-encompassing robes and hood that completely cover the face, leaving only a mesh to see through. They didn’t normally wear the burqa, but they said they sometimes do now when they go outside and want to remain anonymous and avoid harassment.⁠
⁠
The ban on sports is part of the Taliban’s escalating campaign of restrictions that have shut down life for girls and women.⁠
Even before the Taliban, women’s sports were opposed by many in Afghanistan’s deeply conservative society, seen as a violation of women’s modesty and of their role in society. Still, the previous, internationally-backed government had programs encouraging women’s sports and school clubs, leagues and national teams for women in many sports.⁠
⁠
Read the full story at the link in bio.⁠
⁠
AP Photos/Ebrahim Noroozi

Description:
By Hritika Sharma

AL RAYYAN, Qatar, Nov 27 (Reuters) – The United States Soccer Federation temporarily displayed Iran‘s national flag on social media without the emblem of the Islamic Republic as a show of solidarity with protesters in Iran ahead of the two teams’ World Cup clash on Tuesday.

A now-deleted graphic of the Group B standings posted on Saturday across U.S. Soccer’s official Twitter, Instagram and Facebook accounts displayed a plain green, white and red flag.

Iran has been gripped by protests since 22-year-old Mahsa Amini’s death in September while in police custody after her arrest for flouting the country’s strict Islamic dress code.

The intent of the posts was to “support for the women in Iran fighting for basic human rights”, U.S. Soccer media officer Michael Kammarman told a news conference on Sunday. Players were not consulted on the decision to alter the flag.

The banner on U.S. Soccer’s Twitter page was also changed on Saturday to feature the flag without the emblem. It was changed back 24 hours later to the banner they had been using during the tournament.

Iran‘s state-affiliated Tasnim News Agency said the Iranian Football Federation will file a complaint against U.S. Soccer to the FIFA Ethics Committee for “disrespecting the national flag” of the Islamic Republic.

Iranian leaders have accused the United States and other foreign adversaries of fomenting the protests in which Iranians from all walks of life have mounted one of the boldest challenges to the theocracy since the 1979 Islamic Revolution.

Washington has imposed sanctions on Iranian officials over the crackdown on protesters.

The United States and Iran will face off in a decisive Group B clash with their place at the World Cup on the line, in a match which was already freighted by decades of emnity between the nations.

(Reporting by Hritika Sharma; Editing by Angus MacSwan)
Image Text: U.S. Soccer Briefly Removed Emblem From Iran Flag to Show Support for Protesters USA GROUP B SCHEDULE FIFAWORLD Qatar2022 USA vs WALES ENGLAND USA USA NOV IRAN USA AHMAD BIN ALI STADIUM AL RAYYAN, QATAR AL BAYT TADIUM AL KHOR, QATAR AL THUMAMA STADIU DOHA, QATAR … Check User U.S. Men's National Soccer Team @USMNT Following

Description:
Reposted from @punkorientalism The 1979 Iranian Revolution is part of a complex matrix akin to the tableaux featured here in Mitra Tabrizian’s photograph ‘Tehran 2006’, which is a reminder of Iran’s role as an ideological firewall against the USSR during the Cold War, supported by a US/ British foreign policy designed to mobilize the masses through orthodoxy. This policy ironically borrows from Karl Marx’s socialist anti-theocratic argument: ‘religion is the ‘opiate’ of the people’. My book ‘Punk Orientalism: The Art of Rebellion’ (Black Dog Press) explores artistic methodologies that subvert our normative understanding of ‘punk’ practices & extends to explore themes such as conceptual ‘whistle blowing,’ a poetic device employed by artists to unveil a perpetual cycle of puppet regimes, conflicts, coups, & collapses. Order your copy via: www.blackdogonline.com

Image credit: Mitra Tabrizian, Tehran 2006 (2006). Digital c-type print, Iran. 101 × 302 cm. Courtesy of the artist. 

#punkorientalism #mitratabrizian #iran

Description:
The women in #iran are changing the world rIght now with their awe inspiring fight. And they are being murdered by “security” forces for protesting the murder of #mahsaamini Please let them know you see and care.

#Repost @the.wellness.therapist 
・・・
To the international community, our sisters & brothers in Iran have lost access to the internet. They are risking their lives by simply refusing to wear the hijab & to peacefully protest. The regime of the Islamic Republic of Iran has shut down their connection to the outside world. They are being killed in the dark. I humbly ask for your support in sharing their stories & how they are courageously risking life & limb just to be heard. 

Iranians are asking for those outside of Iran to their voice. Share their stories. Don’t let their deaths be in vain. Scroll to learn ways to help them & share this post along with others.
 

1. Repost footage of protests to all social media platforms 

The Islamic Republic of Iran regime  is blocking the internet. Iranians have to use VPN & other dangerous methods to get content out. When we reshare the videos/photos that do get out, we are helping to amplify the voices of Iranians. They want us to help get their stories out. 

Doing so also scares the regime because they don’t want the international community to see what is happening. Footage being widespread online also raises morale of Iranians to keep protesting. 

2. Use specific & creative hashtAgs to get thE word out 

Use these tags when you post: 
#mahsaamini #jinaamini #zhinaamini #Mahsa_Amini #iran #iranprotests

The tags above are designed for those who are already aware of whats happening in Iran. To get the story out to those who aren’t aware of it, use other popular hashtags such as: 

#food #fall #halloween #family #love #photography #news #politics 

3. No war. No western intervention.
Keep your support focused on Iranian people fighting for their own liberation. Say No war on Iran. Iranians don’t want Western foreign intervention. They want to fight for their own liberation. They just want support from the international community. They want the atrocities documented. 

(Cont’d in comments)

Description:
Let’s be clear. The post that went viral 2 days ago + attracted the support of celebrities which was swiftly labeled as “fake news” is not fake.

Western media, which for 2 months has largely ignored, underreported or consciously created misinformation by supporting the narrative of the Islamic Republic over the voice of Iranian people, decided to play what’s best called “semantics gymnastics”. [Read that term on a post from the inestimable @smohyeddin, captures the essence of this Western media foolishness.]

Tap through these slides to understand. The IRI has mass executed thousands before. That level of brutality & terror is how they have held Iran hostage for 43+ years.

They currently have imprisoned MORE than 15,000 innocent people whose status is largely unknown because they don’t provide clear info. We don’t even know if some of these people have already been executed. Even after they murder people, they are known to keep their corpses from their family + promise to return the corpse if the family lies about the cause of death (“heart attack”, “suicide”, etc.) when they have been beaten to death by the IRI.

I and others have been saying the IRI will launch psychological + cyber warfare on us as we pull their heinous regime down. They want to distract us. This is all part of that.

Since when has Meta acted so swiftly over “fake news”? In less than 12 hours, posts shared by celebrities w/enormous followings were pulled. How come Meta didn’t challenge the actual fake news of the IRI stating Mahsa Amini’s death was due to a medical condition?

Listen to the people of Iran, not to Western, corporate-controlled media outlets who have their own agendas that rarely support actual human rights. We are telling you the reality of what is + has been happening in Iran for decades. This is a WOMAN-LED, intersectional, INCLUSIVE REVOLUTION and so-called feminist and progressive/liberal orgs in the West are ignoring or diminishing it.

Iranians across all socioeconomic levels, of all ethnic + religious backgrounds are united in our goal of eradicating the Islamic Republic. PLEASE SHARE.

Description:
SpaceX hosted a demo flight to showcase the capabilities of Starlink satellite internet service on a private jet last week as the internet service vies for more customers.

During a one-hour flight from Burbank to San Jose, California, SpaceX demonstrated the capabilities of Starlink to deliver WiFi for Netflix, YouTube, as well as video chats from 30,000 feet in the air, Bloomberg reported.

Bloomberg previously reported that SpaceX has pitched its internet service to four of the largest airline carriers in the US, including Delta, to no avail. The publication said that Musk's technology uses smaller and lower-flying satellites than competitors, which allows the WiFi signal to arrive faster. But, the smaller satellites might not be enough to power larger planes with more user demand, Bloomberg said. SpaceX has said Starlink can service planes of all sizes.

What's more, regulators have expressed doubt in SpaceX's satellite internet service.

Description:
Share these beautiful illustrations on your story to join us in celebrating CPJ’s International #PressFreedom Award honorees tonight in the 32nd annual #IPFA. And learn about their remarkable stories of courageous journalism below:

In Iraqi #Kurdistan, freelance journalist Niyaz Abdullah @niyazabdulla faces legal harassment by security forces and local authorities, and she was detained and threatened with violence over her work. In 2021, she fled to France to escape threats against her.

In #Cuba, freelance journalist Abraham Jiménez Enoa @jimenezenoa was strip-searched and handcuffed, interrogated for five hours, and both he and his family threatened over his writings in October 2020. Cuban authorities’ threats of legal repercussions if he continued to publish, persistent harassment, and censorship forced Jiménez to flee to #Spain in 2021, where he is currently living in exile.

In #Ukraine, despite the dangers of war, death threats, and Russia’s declared ban on her publication, @ukr_pravda’s Editor-in-Chief, Sevgil Musaieva @sevvvgil, has worked relentlessly since the invasion to ensure the safety of her staff and to inform the public.

In #Vietnam, human rights reporter Pham Doan Trang, who also founded the independent legal magazine @luatkhoatapchi, is currently serving a nine-year sentence after a one-day trial on charges of making or spreading news against the state.

CPJ will also honor Russian journalist Galina Timchenko, editor of the independent news website @meduza_en, which she founded in 2014 after fleeing to Latvia.

The livestream of the event begins this evening at 7:45 p.m. EST / 4:45 p.m. PST / 12:45 a.m. GMT, and you can watch it on Facebook — the link is in our bio.

Tonight, our presenters and speakers include @newsmom8, @abcnews; @paramountco; @cbsnews; @mariaesalinas; @Omarcnn, @CNN; @Rezaian, @postopinions; @yeganehrezaian; @mashagessen

Illustration: Gianluca Costantini (@channeldraw)

Description:
REPOST FROM JULY 2020.

“Graffiti in Tehran saying: "Our defenders are in danger of being executed"
In November, millions of Iranians protested against a corrupt government. Hundreds were killed on the spot and many others arrested. Amirhossein Moradi, Mohammad Rajabi and Saeed Tamjidi were among those arrested, and were due to be executed, however, social media pressure has bought the protesters some more time. Many are protesting in the streets and the govt has cut the internet in some places. Resistance art from Iran has been very difficult to find; once when we did post some with artist consent, they later asked us to remove out of fear for their safety. We need to amplify their voices more than ever.”

These three had their death sentence reduced to prison time due to outcry. Now they remain in prison with thousands of prisoners from this phase of the revolution. As many as 3000 protesters died in 2019-2020, mostly in Bloody November. Those martyrs didn’t have the chance to know what a revolution would come…to see what they fought & gave their life for. Many martyrs and prisoners preceded where the revolution is today. Resistance is a long road.

#womanlifefreedom #protests #revolt #iran

Description:
SpaceX has sent a letter to the Pentagon asking them to pick up the tab for funding the aerospace giant's Starlink satellite internet service in Ukraine. 

SpaceX founder Elon Musk said in an Oct. 7 tweet that Starlink in Ukraine has cost the company $80 million and will exceed $100 million by the end of the year. The letter, which was obtained and first reported by CNN, claims it would cost more than $120 million to fund Starlink in Ukraine for the rest of the year and could cost close to $400 million for the next 12 months. 

"SpaceX is not asking to recoup past expenses, but also cannot fund the existing system indefinitely *and* send several thousand more terminals that have data usage up to 100X greater than typical households," Musk wrote in a tweet Friday. "This is unreasonable."

In addition to the terminals, Musk emphasized that SpaceX has to create, launch, maintain and replenish satellites and ground stations, pay telecommunications companies for internet access via gateways and defend against cyberattacks and jamming.

"Burn is approaching ~$20M/month," he added.

SpaceX has sent roughly 20,000 Starlink terminals to Ukraine to date.

Pentagon Deputy Press Secretary Sabrina Singh confirmed that the Department of Defense received SpaceX's letter.

Reported By Fox Business
Image Text: Elon Musk's Spacex asks Pentagon to take over Starlink funding in Ukraine stock sharks

Description:
💻 Twitter suffered a data breach in which hackers stole over 200 million email addresses and posted them on an online hacking forum, according to a security researcher.

What Happened: Details of the hacking were shared by Alon Gal, co-founder and CTO of Israeli cybersecurity monitoring firm Hudson Rock in a LinkedIn post, first noted on Reuters.

Gal said the leaked email database was “circulating heavily" and contains "235,000,000 unique records of Twitter users, and their email addresses and will, unfortunately, lead to a lot of hacking, targeted phishing, and doxxing."

Gal described it as one of the “most significant” leaks he has seen, adding that the leak would be used to target cryptocurrency Twitter accounts with Ethereum’s symbol in the name.

He said other adverse effects include hacking of high-profile and political accounts and attacks on accounts with good usernames.

Not Recent? The hacking could have taken place as far back as 2021, before Tesla Inc CEO Elon Musk purchased Twitter, according to Reuters.

The scale of the breach is yet not clear with earlier accounts pegging the breach at 400 million email addresses. Follow @benzinga 
.
.
.
.
.
.
#hacked #twitter #business #money #data #investing #reuters #technology #cryptocurrency #crypto #cryptonews #cryptocurrencies #hack #money #ethereum #stockmarket #hacker #stockmarketinvesting #eth #it
Image Text: Follow @benzinga Twitter Hackers Stole More Than 200M Emails That Could Lead To Lot Of 'Targeted Phishing And Doxxing

Description:
GENEVA, Oct 28 (Reuters) – The U.N. human rights office on Friday voiced concern about Iran‘s treatment of detained protesters and said that authorities were refusing to release some of the bodies of those killed.

“We’ve seen a lot of ill treatment … but also harassment of the families of protesters,” Ravina Shamdasani, spokesperson of the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights, told a Geneva press briefing, citing multiple sources.

She added that in some cases, authorities were withholding the bodies of dead protesters from families or only releasing them on condition that they do not hold a funeral or speak to the media.

(Reporting by Emma Farge, Editing by Miranda Murray)
Image Text: IRAN WITHHOLDING BODIES OF PROTESTERS FROM FAMILIES, UN SAYS 1P5Y

she added that in some cases, authorities were withholding the bodies of dead protesters from families or only releasing them on condition that they do not hold a funeral or speak to the media.

(reporting by emma farge, editing by miranda murray)

Description:
Highly sensitive intelligence on Iran and China was in some of the documents recovered by the FBI during an August search of former U.S. President Donald Trump's home in Florida, The Washington Post reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

They included secret documents that described intelligence work regarding China and at least one of them described Iran's missile program, the report said, adding that the documents were considered to be among the most sensitive in the materials seized by the FBI.

The release of information in these documents would pose multiple risks, including endangering people helping U.S. intelligence efforts and compromising collection efforts, the newspaper cited experts as saying.

The U.S. Justice Department is investigating whether Trump broke the law by taking government records, including about 100 classified documents, to his Florida estate after leaving office in January 2021.

The department is also looking into whether Trump or his team obstructed justice when the FBI sent agents to search his home, and has warned that more classified documents may still be missing.

Representatives for Trump did not immediately reply to a request for comment on the newspaper report. The Justice Department did not respond to a request for confirmation of the Post report. @albanus_10
Image Text: tv47 digital) CLASSIFIED PAPERS SEIZED FROM TRUMP HOME HELD U.S. SECRETS ABOUT IRAN, CHINA tv47 digital

Description:
"My organization, HonestReporting, came under attack this week for its success in highlighting #antisemitic social media posts of journalists who praised #Nazi leader #AdolfHitler and #terrorist attacks that killed dozens of #Jews, #Muslims, and #Christians.

Normally, we don’t address such criticism, which comes and goes. But this time, we were shocked to see that we garnered the attention of #PressTV, a state-owned and funded news network of the Islamic Republic of #Iran, and this cannot be ignored.

The Iranian regime — which has killed more than 200 critics of its policies toward #women in recent weeks — found time to target HonestReporting, devoting its “#Palestine Declassified” program to the question: “Honest Reporting or Dishonest Intimidation?”

The show accused the staff of #HonestReporting of working for the #Israeli government and the Israel #Defense Forces, singling out staff members who served their compulsory #military service. The decision by The New York Times to no longer work with journalists following their antisemitic social media posts was falsely attributed to a vast conspiracy."

Please tap the link in our bio to continue reading this op/ed by Gil Hoffman.
Image Text: We Are Undeterred After Being Targeted by Iranian Press TV by Gil Hoffman OPINION

Description:
زخمی از بیداد گردونِ دون پرور، سرت افراشته، ایران، دلدار من

Iran survived the Genghis Khan army. Pellet bullets will not stop her. 300 are already killed, peacefully protesting death of one in custody of a "Morality Police", hundreds wounded, thousands arrested, some sentenced to death. They arrested a protester, then raped a protester, then shot her in vagina with these pellet guns. She died. The same doctor mentioned in this CBS article*, Keyvan Mirhadi, an Iranian Doctor based in New York @_dr.kay_ @_dr.kay1_ reports it in a post(in Farsi). Go look. Not even idf does this.

Now censor me again Instagram just like you removed my post with these same photos a week before this article was published yesterday, on November 11, for "keeping your community safe".

We can not remain a community of teenagers, forever, keep liking posts of cute teens, posing.

Times and again you removed my posts on suffering of Palestinians. CBS never publishes those photos and clips. No Media outlet does. They are not considered humans. Now you do the same with posts on Iranians'suffering. Rest in Peace Orwell.

All my rather short life has been opening mouth to speak up followed by broken teeth, in the U.S. and in the Middle East, freedom of expression that expires with expression. The whole concept is a fallacy. Anybody is free to express, even in North Korea. Freedom AFTER expression matters. I will keep speaking up. Silence suffocates an outlier like me, not all those gone teeth. I do not need them.

Let me repeat what I wrote in that post: Crimes must be seen to be stopped. 

World is not a Disneyland. 

Not everything is entertaining. 

Your ad income will not change. 

Let eyes see.

Description:
DUBAI, Nov 6 (Reuters) – Hardline Iranian lawmakers urged the judiciary on Sunday to “deal decisively” with perpetrators of unrest, as the Islamic Republic struggles to suppress the biggest show of dissent in years.

Widespread anti-government demonstrations erupted in September after the death of young Kurdish Iranian woman Mahsa Amini, who had been detained by morality police for allegedly flouting the strict dress code imposed on women.
“We ask the judiciary to deal decisively with the perpetrators of these crimes and with all those who assisted in the crimes and provoked rioters,” 227 lawmakers from Iran’s 290-seat, hardline-led parliament said in a statement, according to state media.

The activist HRANA news agency said that 318 protesters had been killed in the unrest as of Saturday, including 49 minors. Thirty-eight members of the security forces had also been killed, it added.

State media said last month that more than 46 security forces, including police, had been killed. Government officials have not provided an estimate of any wider death count.

Iranian leaders have vowed tough action against protesters they have described as rioters, accusing enemies including the United States of fomenting the unrest.

Demonstrations continued in many cities on Sunday, from Tehran to the central city of Yazd and the northern city of Rasht, according to rights groups and videos on social media.

A video posted on Twitter showed protesters in southern Tehran after nightfall chanting: “Clerics get lost”.

Reuters could not verify the rights groups’ reports independently, or the social media posts and footage.

In the Kurdish city of Marivan, rights group Hengaw said security forces opened fire on crowds who had gathered after the funeral of another woman, Nasrin Ghaderi, to protest against her death.

Hengaw said Ghaderi died in a coma on Saturday after suffering severe blows to her head by the security forces while demonstrating in Tehran.
Image Text: Iran Lawmakers Demand Severe Punishment for Demonstrators as as Protests Rage

Description:
By Parisa Hafezi

DUBAI, Oct 10 (Reuters) – Iranian security forces intensified a crackdown on anti-government protests in several Kurdish cities on Monday, as demonstrations elsewhere in Iran spread into the country’s vital energy sector.
Protests have swept Iran since Mahsa Amini, a 22-year-old from Iran‘s Kurdish region, died on Sept. 16 while being held for “inappropriate attire”, marking one of the boldest challenges to the Islamic Republic since the 1979 revolution.

While university students have played a pivotal role in the protests with dozens of universities on strike, unconfirmed reports on social media showed workers at Abadan and Kangan oil refineries and the Bushehr Petrochemical Project had joined in.

Iran‘s oil ministry was not immediately available to comment.

A combination of mass protests and strikes by oil workers and Bazaar merchants helped to sweep the clergy to power in the Iranian revolution four decades ago.

With U.S. sanctions imposed on Iran‘s oil exports over the country’s nuclear programme, analyst Karim Sadjadpour said large and sustained strikes among energy workers could bring the Islamic Republic to its knees.

“Iran is less dependent on oil as a percentage of GDP than they were in 1978, but energy exports are still the lifeblood of the economy,” said Sadjadpour, a senior fellow at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace.

China, Iran‘s biggest oil customer, is one of the few countries that continues to do business with Iran despite sanctions. But an oil workers’ strike, experts say, could mean there would be no oil to export, legally or illegally.

A video on Twitter showed dozens of workers had blocked the road to the Bushehr petrochemical plant, in Assaluyeh on Iran‘s Gulf coast, chanting “Death to the Dictator”.
Image Text: ‎fire and outdoor, ‎'‎Iran Toughens Crackdown as as Some Oil Workers Reported to Join Protests انا ALO‎'‎‎

Description:
Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau deleted a tweet containing false information on mass death sentences in Iran, after a viral campaign on social media circulated the fake news.

Celebrities and users shared a picture on Instagram showing a woman holding an Iranian flag with the caption “Iran sentences 15,000 protesters to death – as a ‘hard lesson’ for all rebels.”

Instagram has since tagged the post as “False Information” and said “Independent fact-checkers say this information has no basis in fact.”
.
.
.
.
#brandsynario #JustinTrudeau #Canada #Iran

Description:
Iran's famous 'Zombie Angelina Jolie' has finally revealed her real face.

Sahar Tabar, whose real name is Fatemeh Khishvand, rose to fame after she posted images of her looking like Hollywood star Angelina Jolie's zombie version. She was arrested in October 2019 for 'corruption' and 'blasphemy' and sentenced to ten years in prison. However, she was released from prison recently after widespread protests in the country, triggered by the death of Mahsa Amini last month, Mashable reported, citing Daily Mail.

After being released from prison, Tabar appeared for a TV interview where she revealed her face.

#Iran #AngelijaJolie #ZombieAngelijaJolie #SaharTabar #News #NewsAlert #NewsUpdate

Description:
.
Iranian security forces stole the body of a 16-year-old protester, and buried her secretly in a village.

The family had planned to bury #Nika_Shakarami on Monday, but her body was snatched and buried in a village about 40km away. Nika went missing for 10 days after protesting in Tehran on 20 September.

In her last message to a friend she said she was being chased by security forces.

Nika's family finally found her body in a morgue at a detention centre in the capital. "When we went to identify her, they didn't allow us to see her body, only her face for a few seconds," said Atash Shakarami, Nika's aunt.

Nika's family transferred her body to her father's hometown of Khorramabad on Sunday - on what would have been her 17th birthday. Under duress the family agreed not to hold a funeral but security forces "stole" Nika's body from Khorramabad and buried it in the village of Veysian. Hundreds of protesters gathered in Khorramabad cemetery and chanted slogans against the government, including "death to the dictator" ,a reference to Khamenei.

Atash, who posted about Nika on her social media accounts, was arrested on Sunday when security forces raided her house 

The security forces threatened to kill Atash if anyone in the family took part in protests.

The authorities have a history of using the bodies of protesters as bargaining chips to silence the families of victims.
Image Text: SEER Iran: Teen Protester Nika Shakarami's Body Stolen

Description:
WASHINGTON, Sept 19 (Reuters) – The United States wants accountability for the death of an Iranian woman after she was arrested in Tehran last week for wearing an ‘improper’ hijab, a spokesperson for the White House National Security Council said on Monday.

“Mahsa Amini’s death after injuries sustained while in police custody for wearing an ‘improper’ hijab is an appalling and egregious affront to human rights,” the official said. “Our thoughts are with Mahsa’s family and loved ones.”

“Women in Iran should have the right to wear what they want, free from violence or harassment. Iran must end its use of violence against women for exercising their fundamental freedoms,” the official said. “There must be accountability for Mahsa’s death.”

(Reporting By Steve Holland; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)

Description:
By Sabine Siebold and Gabriela Baczynska

Oct 17 (Reuters) – The European Union prepared to slap sanctions on Iran on Monday over a human rights crackdown and several ministers warned of separate, new sanctions if Tehran’s involvement in Russia’s war on Ukraine was proven.

The EU ministers are set to impose travel bans and freeze the assets of some 15 Iranians involved in the government crackdown that began last month against demonstrators outraged by the death in police custody of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini.

“We will launch … a sanctions package today that will hold accountable those who are responsible for the brutal crimes against women, youths and men,” German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock told reporters as she arrived at the meeting in Luxembourg.

“Amongst those listed is the so-called morality police – morality police being a misnomer, actually, if you see what crimes are committed there.”
Image Text: EU to Slap Human Rights Sanctions on Iran, Warns of More Over Ukraine kayhanlife.com 2 min read
