Description:
[IMPORTANT] • While the Iranian people continue to protest for freedom and democracy, their government has been restricting access to platforms like Facebook and Instagram in an attempt to block their messages from getting out to the world! 🚫📱

To help spread the cause of the Iranian people, many Iranian-Americans have been posting images and videos from the protests inside Iran.

Unfortunately, there have been reports of Meta, the parent company behind WhatsApp and Instagram, removing these posts.

We urge you to 🚨 TAKE ACTION 🚨 by writing to the appropriate members of congress urging them to tell Meta to stop removing content posted in support and solidarity with the people of Iran.

Iranian citizens are sacrificing their lives in pursuit of basic human rights, and their images, videos and messages should be allowed to be seen across the world.

Click our LINK IN BIO to fill out the form and we'll send it to the appropriate representation based on your district!

#iran #iranprotests #iranrevolution2022 #TorkLawActionCenter #iranianwomen #iranian #iranprotests2022 #women #life #freedom #mahsaamini #moralitypolice #humanrights #iranrevolution #justice #womensrights #freeiran
Image Text: STOP META FROM SILENCING IRANIAN VOICES THE TORK AW ACTION CENTER

Description:
Meta Platforms Inc.’s Oversight Board has overturned the decision to remove a Facebook post using the slogan “death to Khamenei,” to criticize Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, saying it did not violate a rule barring violent threats. 

The board, which is funded by Meta but operates independently, said in the context of the “broader social, political and linguistic situation” in Iran, “death to” should be understood as “down with,” according to a write-up of the decision.

#khamenei #deathtokhamenei
#downwithkhamenei
#iran
#meta
#facebook
#instagram
#freespeech
Image Text: Subscribe Bloomberg Technology Meta's Oversight Board Okays 'Death to' Iran Leader Post The slogan is commonly used to criticize the political regime Meta has grappled with hate speech and violence fo years 7

Description:
Reposted from @omar.haidari Unfortunately, the situation of Afghan refugees is often overlooked, with little attention paid to the horrific abuses they suffer at the hands of the Iranian regime. Reports of torture, rape, drowning, and murder of Afghan refugees have become commonplace, yet there has been a lack of action from Amnesty International and other human rights organizations in response to these violations. It is a disgrace that these atrocities continue to occur without consequence.
⠀
Last year, the Iranian regime committed unspeakable atrocities against Afghan refugees, leaving tens drowned, several burned alive, and reports of sexual assault and misbehavior documented in graphic videos. The horrific abuses are a reminder of the urgent need to protect the rights of refugees everywhere.
⠀
There used to be a sign hung at the entrance of parks in Tehran that stated “dogs and Afghans were not permitted”.
⠀
I wish the citizens of Iran success in overthrowing the oppressive government they face, and I hope they can do so without the manipulative interference of Western powers/institutions that only care about the situation insofar as it serves their own interests. Sadly, even in the mainstream media, the plight of women in Afghanistan is often overlooked and ignored, showing that the Western institutions and their media is selective in the conflicts it chooses to highlight, allowing them to control the narrative.
⠀
#Iran #Afghanrefugees #afghanistan @refugees @amnesty @amnestydeutschland
Image Text: Omar Haidari @OmarHaidari1 On Tuesday, December 6th, Iranian forces tragically opened fire on a car carrying Afghan refugees in the Sistan and Baluchestan Province, killing and injuring 17 refugees. This devastating news has barely made it to the media. #Iran #Afghanistan

Description:
Today the Oversight Board selected a new case related to #Iran, which has significant implications for freedom of expression and human rights on Facebook and Instagram.

The case relates to a Facebook post shared on July 2022. A user posted an image depicting a caricature of Iran’s Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali #Khamenei in a public group. Below the image is a caption calling for the death of the “anti-women Islamic government” and Ayatollah Khamenei. 

In the post, the user also calls the Islamic Republic the worst dictatorship in history, partly due to restrictions on what people can wear. It calls on women in Iran not to collaborate in the oppression of women. 

On the day the content was shared, Meta removed the post under its Violence and Incitement rules, prohibiting calls for death or high-severity violence against all people. Hours after Meta removed their post, the user appealed the decision. 

In their appeal to the Oversight Board, the user states that the post criticizes the Iran “dictatorship” and human rights violations in Iran. 

In our decisions, the Board can issue policy recommendations to Meta. While recommendations are not binding, Meta must respond within 60 days. As such, the Board welcomes public comments proposing recommendations relevant to this case. 

If you or your organization feel that you can contribute valuable perspectives that can help with reaching a decision on our new case, you can submit your comment via our link in bio 🔗

Deadline: 15:00 UTC, Tuesday 18 October 2022 

#OversightBoard #Iran #Protest #WomenRights #SocialMedia #Meta #Facebook #Instagram #HumanRights
Image Text: Iran Protest tranProtestSloganCase Slogan Case The Board has selected a new case on political content in Iran

Description:
Social media images posted October 2, show crowds gathered outside Tehran’s Sharif University following reports of clashes between hundreds of students and security forces, after forces surrounded the university at night, amid a wave of unrest sparked by the death of Mahsa Amini. 
Iranian supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said Monday the widespread protests following the death in police custody of the young woman last month are not the actions of “ordinary Iranians” as he accused the United States and Israel of planning the demonstrations. 
The protests, now in their third week, have been met with a crackdown by police and security forces. A tally of government statements compiled by The Associated Press gave a death toll of at least 14 people with 1,500 arrests, while rights groups say at least 130 are dead with thousands arrested. 
Khamenei said the death of 22-year-old Amini was a “sad incident” and that he was heartbroken. 
Iran’s morality police arrested Amini in Tehran for allegedly not following the country’s strict dress code and she died in a hospital three days later after falling into a coma. 
The government said she died of a heart attack. Her family rejected that account, saying Amini had no history of heart problems and that she was instead beaten. They called for accountability. 
#voa #voanews #voasocial #voadeewa #deewasocial #iran #tehran #iranprotest #mahsaaminiمهسا_امینی

Description:
Iran blocked access to Instagram and WhatsApp and imposed drastic restrictions on internet access Thursday as the official casualties from six nights of protests rose to nine.
"In accordance with a decision by officials, it has no longer been possible to access Instagram in Iran since yesterday (Wednesday) evening and access to WhatsApp is also disrupted," the semi-official Fars news agency reported.

The two apps were the most widely used in Iran after the blocking of other platforms in recent years, including Facebook, Twitter, Telegram, YouTube and Tiktok.

Our excitement for Hackfest 2.0 has quadrupled. ✨

Presenting BNB Chain as our partner for the world’s largest virtual hackathon - Hackfest 2.0.

BNB Chain is a global, decentralized network with developers, validators, users, HODLers and enthusiasts. BNB Smart Chain (BSC) supports the most popular programming languages, flexible tools, and comes with clear and canonical documentation. You can quickly start and deploy your application on a blockchain designed with real use in mind.

With BNB Chain and Hackfest 2.0, all tech enthusiasts can innovate new ways to solve technical problems and create new possibilities for the remote world with the power of blockchain.

Join us on 14th-16th October and meet the top 1% of global tech talent to learn about the latest tech trends, share ideas, take guidance, and build the remote world together. There’s a huge cash prize too!

Description:
Iranian authorities arrested one of the country's most renowned actresses on charges of spreading falsehoods about nationwide protests that gripped the country, state media said. 

The report by IRNA said Taraneh Alidoosti, star of the Oscar-winning movie The Salesman, was detained on Saturday, a week after she made a post on Instagram expressing solidarity with the first man recently executed for crimes allegedly committed during the protests.

Her account, which had some 8 million followers, has been suspended.

Description:
What Will Be - Will Be...

For the longest time, I have stared at Panic Cycles that were due the week of November 7th. I had assumed that this Panic Cycle was a warning that the US midterm election will be a traumatic event for neither side will accept the result. However, there is something else that has come on the radar with the West's constant harassment of Russia as the media seems to be intent on insulting Russia and praying for its demise. If you keep calling someone names and saying you are a loser, what will often happen is you provoke them into one of those events where they just start throwing punches and a brawl begins. All the press constantly put out the propaganda that Putin's invasion was unprovoked. I can confirm this was all intentional and the killing of both Nord Stream pipelines last week was part of the strategy to separate Germany from Russia. It is about the collapse of debt structures and the Great Reset.

The media will also not address how the deal was Ukraine was to remain neutral, yet Zelensky pushed for NATO membership. Then on February 23rd, Zelensky the day before Putin's invasion publicly stated Ukraine would seek nuclear weapons. This is the Western Press' propaganda when in fact this has been a provoked event to overthrow Russia for the Great Reset and to impose climate change directives to shut down their energy production which was 50% of the GDP. This was also to break the energy tie of Europe to Russia.

They are pushing Russia too hard and the Russian Neocons are clamoring for Putin to get serious. I do not see a major nuclear attack, but I cannot rule out a tactical nuclear weapon. Zelensky appears to be only interested in how much money he can stash offshore and has led his country to the brink of total destruction. Running to NATO for immediate membership is inviting a nuclear attack now.

As they say - What Will Be - Will Be.  We may see European conflict erupt going into 2023, but it still appears that we will be looking at World War III with China  joining Russia post-2024.

#Anonymous #CIA #Tyler #warondrugs #darkalliance #huffingtonpost  #nixon #red #psychedelicart #orange #russia #thewire #fractalart #humanity

Description:
🥷🪙 👾Crypto exchange Binance said late Thursday that $100 million was likely stolen as a result of a hack on its Binance Smart Chain blockchain network.

Binance Smart Chain temporarily suspended transactions and fund transfers, after detecting what it said was an exploit on a bridge between two blockchains. Activity resumed on the blockchain early Friday, a Binance spokesman said.

Changpeng Zhao, Binance’s chief executive, said on Twitter that the issue involved BSC Token Hub, a so-called cross-chain bridge. These enable the transfer of digital assets and information from one independent blockchain to another.

“The issue is contained now. Your funds are safe,” Mr. Zhao wrote, apologizing for the inconvenience.

Ransomware attacks are increasing in frequency, victim losses are skyrocketing, and hackers are shifting their targets. 

A spokesman for Binance said initial estimates for funds taken off the Binance Smart Chain are between $100 million and $110 million.

Binance Coin fell 3.4% from its level 24 hours prior to $284.56, according to CoinDesk data.

Cross-chain bridge hacks have become a common occurrence. In August, attackers drained $190 million worth of crypto from cross-chain bridge Nomad after a hacker exploited a vulnerability in an upgrade to the platform. So far this year, about $2 billion in cryptocurrency has been stolen in cross-chain bridge hacks, according to blockchain data firm Chainalysis.

Description:
Personal emails linked to 235 million @Twitter accounts hacked some time ago have been exposed according to Israeli security researcher Alon Gal - making millions vulnerable to having their accounts compromised or identities exposed if they have used the site anonymously to criticize oppressive governments, for instance. Gal, who is the co-founder and chief technology officer at cybersecurity firm Hudson Rock, wrote in a LinkedIn post this week that the leak "will unfortunately lead to a lot of hacking, targeted phishing, and doxxing". 

Link in bio!

#Twitter #Emails #Goverment #Tweet

Description: What a week…what a month…what a year…As we in the US celebrate the holidays, remembering all who are not as blessed and fortunate—and all who are as I write this are agitating for Freedom around the World—As the martyrs of the revolution in Iran continue to rise, as the arrests continue to rise, regime gets to be more desperate—the Top left of this grid is a tribute to one of the greatest contemporary Iranian Actresses Tarsney Alidoosti who was taken away by regime goons in front of her infant daughter earlier today our time—the second (as I am going clockwise) is a tribute to one of the Doctors noted by Dr Pirmoozan who was brutally murdered by Regime Goons after having been kidnapped (and her only crime—helping the wounded of the revolution—living up to the ultimate hypocratic oath by Doctors)…so thankful the world is noticing the revolution exemplified by one of the many murals that have arisen in tribute to the martyr who was the trigger, the beautiful angel of the revolution #mahsaaminiمهسا_امینی -and the last one is an image of the majestic view of Mt. Damavanad recently-As I finished the “rounds” of the latest, what I found even more horrifying was how as the regime hastily buried the dead and the executed, there are reports of them taking organs from the bodies and selling them—May the almighty bless the martyrs of the Revolution, continue to grant solace to the families of the fallen , and may every single member of the regime from the leader on down, enablers and apologists all burn in hell for what they’ve done—accountability is near….#زن_زندگی_آزادی #مرگ_بر_خامنه_ای_لعنت_بر_خمینی #نه_به_جمهوری_اسلامی #مهسا_امینی

Description:
A person in the Cypriot capital Nicosia checks a mobile phone on December 12, 2022, displaying a Tweet about the execution announced by Iranian authorities of Majidreza Rahnavard, the second capital punishment linked to nearly three months of protests. Iran's judicial news agency Mizan Online reported that "Majidreza Rahnavard, who was sentenced to death on November 29 for killing two security guards with a knife and wounding four other people", was executed in public in Mashhad. He was arrested on November 19 while trying to flee the country, according to Mizan.
AFP
#voa #voadeewa #iranexecution #MajidrezaRahnavard
Image Text: AFP #StopExecutionInIran YOA IRAN HUMAN RIGHTS PROTESTER MAJIDREZA RAHNAVARD PUBLICLY HANGED IN MASHHAD JUST 23 DAYS AFTER ARREST Twitter Web App 1,547 130 1,870

Description:
Iranian Protesters Turn to TikTok to Get Their Message Past Government Censors

(The Conversation) Images of the protests that followed the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Zhina Amini on Sept. 16, 2022, in Iran and reports of the government’s brutal crackdown have circulated widely on social media. This flow of information comes despite efforts by the Iranian regime to throttle internet access and censor information leaving the country.

One effective method the protesters have hit on has been to use TikTok, the video-sharing app better known for young people posting clips of themselves singing and dancing. The way video clips are shared on the social media platform and the protesters’ clever use of labeling have helped activists circumvent the information blockade of Iran’s tech-savvy security services and reach a wide audience.

As a researcher who studies young people and participatory culture – art and information produced by nonspecialists, including fan fiction and citizen journalism – I believe that TikTok is proving to be an effective tool of political activism in the face of severe repression.

Read the full article through link in our bio or story 👉 @thecaspianpost

#Iran #TikTok #MahsaAmini #Bareye #shervinhajipour

Description:
Earlier this year, Google launched its Pixel and Pixel 7 Pro smartphones at the ‘Made by Google’ event. Other than the flagship smartphones and Pixel watch, the company also announced free VPN services to its handsets via the Google One app.

As per a recent report by 9to5Google, the rolling out of VPN services have been initiated for Pixel 7 and Pixel 7 Pro users. There is a support page on the website of Google which mentions the countries where the VPN services will be available soon:

Ireland

Italy

Japan

Mexico

Netherlands

Norway

South Korea

Spain

Sweden

Switzerland

Taiwan

United Kingdom

United States

Austria

Australia

Belgium

Canada

Denmark

Finland

France

Germany

Iceland 

#Google #GooglePixel #GooglePixel7 #GoogleSmartphone #GoogleOneApp #Google7Pro #MadeByGoogle #VPN #VPNServices #vpn軟件 #TheFirstIndia

Description:
In a major security breach, email addresses of over 200 million Twitter users were stolen by hackers and posted on an online hacking forum. On December 24, 2021, security researcher Alon Gal announced that hackers had obtained the email addresses of more than 200 million Twitter users and posted them on a hacking forum online.
Initially, reports claimed that the hackers had obtained the email addresses and phone numbers of 400 million users.

Description:
Regulators in Beijing have removed 13 apps involved in cryptocurrency trading, a year after the country declared all crypto-related transactions illegal. ⁣
⁣
The latest crackdown, executed by the Beijing Local Financial Supervision and Administration, was revealed in a blog post from the People’s Court of Chaoyang District on a verified social media account. Chaoyang is one of Beijing’s largest and wealthiest districts. ⁣
⁣
The administration said it had also shut down 23 crypto media websites and online accounts belonging to 440 people promoting cryptocurrencies, as well as banned two bank accounts that were suspected of offering over-the-counter trading of cryptocurrencies.⁣
⁣
People’s Bank of China, the country’s central bank, has blocked 10 addresses for downloading crypto exchange apps, one crypto trading app and 32 domain names related to cryptocurrencies, according to the blog post that did not name any apps, websites or bloggers.⁣
⁣
Read the full story at Forkast.News⁣
⁣

Description:
Help keep The Foreign Desk free!

If you rely on our platform and work to get news from #Iran, #Afghanistan, #Israel, #Syria, #China and all over the world, please consider making a contribution that will help us continue our vital work.

In the last two months alone, we have worked around-the-clock to get vital and underreported news and analysis on Iran’s revolution out to social media as well as providing critical content from the ground to major news outlets.

You may not know, The Foreign Desk is a 501C3, which means we are a non-profit news outlet that relies on generous donors like yourself to continue our operations. That also means your contributions are tax-deductible. 

At a time when the mainstream media displays bias and censorship more than ever, news consumers like you rely on free, independent journalists more than ever. 

At The Foreign Desk, we are committed to pushing back on mainstream media culture and bringing our readers and podcast listeners critical, accurate and often underreported news, highlighting stories about human rights, global security, and U.S. foreign policy.

With your help, we can continue delivering critical coverage of breaking news from around the world with our daily email, our weekly podcast, our Zoom events and daily exclusive articles, all for free. No ads. No subscriptions. No paywalls.

We humbly ask you to be our partners in this endeavor. Every dollar we raise will go to expand and develop our news platform. 

Patrons who contribute $250 or more will receive a signature The Foreign Desk red mug as a symbol of our gratitude for your support.

Happy holidays, and thank you for your loyal patronage of The Foreign Desk.

Link to donate is available in our bio.

Description:
Cross-chain DEX (decentralized exchange) aggregator Transit Swap was exploited, resulting in US$23 million lost funds, crypto auditor SlowMist said on Sunday. The hacker has returned 70% of the stolen funds, Transit Swap said on the same day.⁣
⁣
Transit Swap has not returned the funds to users, saying it is collecting data to develop a refund plan.⁣
⁣
At 4:25 p.m. Sunday Hong Kong time, SlowMist said on Twitter that US$1.07 million BUSD had been stolen. Later, it updated the amount of total stolen funds to US$23 million in a blog post.⁣
⁣
Before the hacker made the refund, Transit Swap said it had obtained the exploiter’s IP and email address and was actively reaching out.⁣
⁣
Transit Swap says they are still trying to recover the remaining 30% of the funds.⁣
⁣
In August, blockchain analytics firm Chainalysis estimated that US$2 billion worth of cryptocurrency has been drained as of August from cross-chain bridges in 2022, which accounted for 69% of total stolen funds.⁣
⁣
More at Forkast.News⁣
By: Ningwei Qin⁣
📸 Canva ⁣
⁣
#cryptocurrency #cryptocurrencies #cryptotrading #cryptonews #cryptocurrencynews #cryptomining #blockchainnews #blockchaintech #blockchaintechnology #crypto #cryptomarket #hack #stolen #funds #bitcoin #transitswap #blockchain #web3 #digitalassets #btc #fintech #exploit #invest #investors #investment #finance #technology

Description:
🏜A $100-billion package of finance is required to help #Iraq adapt to #climate_change impacts such as droughts, rebuild agriculture infrastructure destroyed by the terrorist group #ISIS, and secure the water sector after being hampered by constrictions of dams along the #Tigris and #Euphrates rivers in neighboring #Turkey and #Iran.

🏜 As high temperatures, droughts, and water scarcity made Iraq the world’s fifth most vulnerable country to “climate breakdown” according to the United Nations, Jusoor Post conducted an interview with Sahar Hussein Al Jassem, Deputy Chief of the Iraqi National Center of Climate Change (#NCCC) at the Ministry of Environment, on the sidelines of the 2022 United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP27) that was held in the Egyptian city of Sharm El-Sheikh on November 6-19.

🏜 Jassem, who is a member of a 100-member delegation that attended #COP27, told Jusoor Post that Iraq has asked for $100 billion in its Nationally Determined Contribution (#NDC) report to be distributed to the development of 13 sectors. “The priority sectors include food and water security, health, climate risks, ecological systems, and energy. We will work on these five sectors in the period between 2020 and 2025,” she said.

🏜 Consequently, in a way to convince the major financial climate institutions that Iraq is strongly in need of financing in order to be able to adapt to these climate crises, the Iraqi negotiating delegation at the COP in Sharm El-Sheikh included for the first time representation from the Iraqi parliament.

🏜 “It is the first time that the delegation includes representatives from the parliamentary committee of health and environment, because we count on COP27 when it comes to financing,” she added, noting that a series of meetings took place with financial institutions like Global Environment Facility (#GEF).

🔗 http://bit.ly/3EsVAuE

#jusoor_post
Image Text: Jusoor post Deputy Chief of Iraqi NCCC to Jusoor Post: We need $100B to adapt to climate change impacts A $100 billion package of finance is required to help Iraq adapt to climate change impacts such as droughts, rebuild agriculture infrastructure destroyed by the terrorist group ISIS よ JusoorPostEn

Description:
Apple Releases iOS 16.1 With Support for iCloud Shared Photo Library, Matter, Live Activities and More

iCloud Shared Photo Library
- Separate library for seamlessly sharing photos and videos with up to five other people
- Setup rules allow you to easily contribute past photos based on start date or people in the photos when you set up or join a library
- Library filters for quickly switching between viewing the Shared Library, your Personal Library, or both libraries together
- Shared edits and permissions let everyone add, edit, favorite, caption, and delete photos
- Sharing toggle in Camera lets you choose to send photos you take straight to the Shared Library, or enable a setting to share automatically when other participants are detected nearby using Bluetooth

Live Activities
- Live Activities from third party apps are available in the Dynamic Island and on the Lock Screen for iPhone 14 Pro models

Fitness+
- Apple Fitness+ is supported on iPhone even if you don't have an Apple Watch

Wallet
- Key sharing enables you to securely share car, hotel room, and other keys in Wallet using messaging apps such as Messages and WhatsApp

Home
- Matter, the new smart home connectivity standard, is supported enabling a wide variety of smart home accessories to work together across ecosystems

Clean Energy Charging
- New setting that can try to reduce your carbon footprint by selectively charging when lower carbon emission electricity is available

Books
- Reader controls are automatically hidden as you start reading

This update also includes bug fixes for your iPhone:
- Deleted conversations may appear in the conversations list in Messages
- Dynamic Island content is not available when using Reachability

description_lower:
apple releases ios 16.1 with support for icloud shared photo library, matter, live activities and more

icloud shared photo library
- separate library for seamlessly sharing photos and videos with up to five other people
- setup rules allow you to easily contribute past photos based on start date or people in the photos when you set up or join a library
- library filters for quickly switching between viewing the shared library, your personal library, or both libraries together
- shared edits and permissions let everyone add, edit, favorite, caption, and delete photos
- sharing toggle in camera lets you choose to send photos you take straight to the shared library, or enable a setting to share automatically when other participants are detected nearby using bluetooth

live activities
- live activities from third party apps are available in the dynamic island and on the lock screen for iphone 14 pro models

fitness+
- apple fitness+ is supported on iphone even if you don't have an apple watch

wallet
- key sharing enables you to securely share car, hotel room, and other keys in wallet using messaging apps such as messages and whatsapp

home
- matter, the new smart home connectivity standard, is supported enabling a wide variety of smart home accessories to work together across ecosystems

clean energy charging
- new setting that can try to reduce your carbon footprint by selectively charging when lower carbon emission electricity is available

books
- reader controls are automatically hidden as you start reading

this update also includes bug fixes for your iphone:
- deleted conversations may appear in the conversations list in messages
- dynamic island content is not available when using reachability
- carplay may fail to connect when using a vpn app

Description:
Shanzy is an Arts student. She faced a lot of transportation problems as she had to go here and there to grab her art supplies and research for different projects. So her father decided to buy her a scooty to ease her everyday life. 
Shanzy going to her university on a scooter inspired more girls in her batch to get one and go around more feasibly. Now the only problem she and her fellows were facing was the unpleasant ride because of all eyes staring at them, unwanted comments passed on the streets, and sometimes even being followed and stalked by random people. 
Being harassed in a public space made them constantly worried about physical safety and feel a heightened sense of anxiety, or to be “on edge” at all times.

Just then they were introduced to Iyzil in one of their university seminars about “Women claiming public spaces without the fear of being harassed” and how Iyzil is doing its part to assure Pakistani women are empowered for their own safety.

Shanzy learned about the app’s Responders Ring feature, added all her five scooty fellows to her Iyzil responders ring. Now she has her own scooty gang and whenever any of her fellow members face any kind of street harassment or any other emergency situations, they just hit the panic alarm and whoever’s close by comes to rescue her friend. And also, Iyzil 24x7 Professional Monitoring Team contacts them to make sure that they are safe or if the situation is serious they involve emergency service on users consent.

Shanzy and her scooty gang say that they found saviors in Iyzil's Professional Monitoring Team and feel more empowered with Iyzil when on road.

Description:
The Binance Smart Chain (BSC) — the blockchain operated by the world’s largest crypto exchange, Binance Global inc. — has suspended operation as developers have identified a potential exploit on the network, according to an official Binance Twitter account.⁣
⁣
Blockchain security and data analytics company Peckshield Inc. tweeted on-chain analytics that suggested the network had suffered an exploit with hackers making off with roughly two million BNB, the native token of the chain, worth US$572 million.⁣
⁣
The extent of the hack and when the network will be running again are not currently known. Binance has not commented directly on the loss reported by Peckshield.⁣
⁣
The issue arose on a cross-chain bridge, BSC Token Hub, which resulted in an extra BNB token being created, Binance founder and chief executive officer, Changpeng Zhao, confirmed via Twitter.⁣
⁣
Zhao said all funds are safe and that the issue is now contained.⁣
BNB was trading down 2.9% to US$286 in the past 24 hours to 8:30 a.m. in Hong Kong.⁣
⁣
Cross-chain bridges allow for cryptocurrencies to be moved from one blockchain to another, but are considered to be highly vulnerable to exploits.⁣
⁣
More at Forkast.News⁣
By: Lachlan Keller⁣
📸 Binance Youtube⁣
⁣
#crypto #cryptocurrency #cryptocurrencies #cryptonews #cryptoexchange #cryptomarket #cryptotrading #cryptotrader #cryptomining #blockchain #blockchaintechnology #blockchainnews #defi #finance #investment #invest #digitalassets #dailynews #news #web3 #binance #bnb #cryptohack⁣
Image Text: BINANCE CRYPTO BINANCE Binance suspends Smart Chain on potential exploit; Peckshield reports US$572 mln hack

Description:
🇺🇳 The UN rights chief urged Iran Thursday to immediately halt violence against protesters, as countries debated whether to launch an investigation into Tehran's deadly crackdown.

Volker Turk opened an emergency session of the UN Human Rights Council, where countries were called to discuss Iran's "deteriorating human rights situation" and determine if a high-level international investigation is warranted.

The meeting, requested by Germany and Iceland with the backing of more than 50 countries, follows two months of protests in Iran sparked by the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, after she was arrested for an alleged breach of the country's strict dress rules for women based on Islamic sharia law.

"I call on the authorities immediately to stop using violence and harassment against peaceful protesters," said Turk, the United Nations' high commissioner for human rights.

"The unnecessary and disproportionate use of force must come to an end," he said, warning that Iran was in "a full-fledged human rights crisis."

"Accountability is a key ingredient of the pursuit of justice for human rights violations," he told the 47-member council, urging the body to vote in favour of an investigation.

Iranian authorities have grown increasingly heavy-handed in their response, as the demonstrations have spread across the country and swelled into a broad movement against the theocracy that has ruled Iran since 1979.

Turk said more than 300 people had been killed since Amini's death. Norway-based group Iran Human Rights has put the toll above 400, including more than 50 children.

"The security forces... have used live ammunition, birdshot and other metal pellets, tear gas and batons," said Turk.

#jusoor_post
Image Text: Jusoor post UN rights chief urges Iran to halt violence on protesters The UN rights chief urged Iran Thursday to immediately halt violence against protesters, as countries debated whether to launch an investigation into Tehran's deadly crackdown d JusoorPostEn

Description:
Google Chrome is by far the world’s most popular web browser used by millions around the world but in what may be a cause of concern for millions of its users it has been ranked as the most vulnerable browser by Atlas VPN, a part of Nord security.

A total of 3,159 cumulative vulnerabilities have been discovered in the popular web browser, out of which 303 have been reported this year. The Atlas VPN team has not disclosed the severity but has just published the number of vulnerabilities. The figures are from the VulDB vulnerability database. The report summarises vulnerabilities reported in the database between January 1, 2022, to October 5, 2022.

Mozilla’s Firefox browser comes second with 117 vulnerabilities, and Microsoft Edge comes third with 103 vulnerabilities, which is 61% higher than the previous year. Since its release, it has had 806 vulnerabilities in total, the report states.

Apple’s Safari is the second-most widely used browser worldwide after Google Chrome and is also the safest browser with just 26 vulnerabilities reported for 2022 and 1,139 vulnerabilities overall since its debut. The report advises users to be particularly careful while choosing plug-ins as they can be malicious and has asked users to choose only reliable providers.

Recently Indian cyber agency the Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-IN) issued a high-severity advisory regarding vulnerabilities in Chrome through which hackers can gain access and execute malicious operations in the system.

Google has one of the most transparent vulnerabilities reporting processes out of all the companies, and according to experts, the same will be fixed via updates. Current users can safeguard themselves by updating their browsers to the latest version.
.
.
.
#NewsCapital #BreakingNews #India #Google #Chrome #Browser #Safari #Firefox #Unsafe #Safe #Vulnerable #Hack #Security #Technology

Description:
I have received multiple messages from iranian women asking me to share this message — their government is shutting down their internet access and the last time this happened a massacre occurred.

Network data from NetBlocks confirm a near-total disruption disruption to internet service in parts of Kurdistan province in west Iran from the evening of Monday 19 September 2022. The regional telecommunications blackout in and around Sanandaj follows a partial disruption to internet service in Tehran and other parts of the country on Friday when protests first broke out. The Instagram social media platform and WhatsApp messaging app were subsequently restricted nationally on Wednesday 21 September, followed by a nation-scale shutdown of mobile networks.

The incidents come amid widening protests against the government after the death of Mahsa Amini from Saqqez in Kurdistan province after her arrest by Iran’s morality police for allegedly violating Iran’s strict hijab headscarf rules.

Observable connectivity was restored some 3.5 hours after the disruption came into place in Iran’s Kurdistan region, amid reports of at least four protesters killed by authorities. Users have also reported the disconnection or severe slowing of internet service in multiple cities since the first disruption was registered on Friday 16 September 2022. The network disruptions are likely to severely limit the public’s ability to express political discontent and communicate freely.

#Iran #IranCensorship #News #InternetShutDown #IranNews

Description:
DraftKings (DKNG) shares dove lower in mid-morning trading on Monday after a report from The Action Network that customer accounts were compromised.

According to the outlet, a number of customers were hit with sizable withdrawals and were locked out of accounts as hackers changed login details. The company acknowledged an account issue in a tweet late on Sunday evening via its customer support Twitter account.

“We are aware of reports of customers having issues with their accounts, and we are investigating,” the tweet read. “If any customers are having issues with their accounts, please contact Customer Experience Team at support@draftkings.com.”

The tweet received a number of angry replies from customers echoing the report’s allegations.

“Messaged the "24/7" support team multiple times as my money was being stolen,” one such reply read. “Could have easily been stopped in real time as I identified the scam immediately but no one was there on the 2 busiest sports betting days of the week.”

#dkng #draftkings #fanduel #betting #sports #sportsbetting #hack
Image Text: cubE LEARN DISCUSS INVEST 000 0010 DRAFTKINGS DROPS 10% ON REPORT OF HACK THAT DRAINED CUSTOMER ACCOUNTS WWW.CUBEWEALTH.COM

Description:
Fat women are often put into a category of fetishisation when considered sexually. This combined with the high prevalence of fat phobia in our society means when fat individuals do experience PSH it is often supercharged with entitlement and violence.

Meg- our streets now @themindfulmedic_ 
💙

👇
Our Streets Now is a campaign working to end public sexual harassment (PSH) through cultural and legislative changes. Public sexual harassment is unwanted sexual attention by strangers in public spaces including gyms, bars, parks, and the streets. PSH can be leering, unwanted comments, beeping from passing vehicles, and even following.
👇
As a campaign, we use real-life testimonies from victims in order to illustrate the impact and reality of PSH. If you would like to share your experience (s) of PSH, you can submit yours via our website.
💖

#ourstreetsnow #feminism #intersectionalfeminism #lgbtq #vawg #publicsexualharassment #catcalling #fat #fatphobia #fatphobic #bodypositivity #bodypositive #bodyneutrality
Image Text: |HAVE NOTICED THAT ON NIGHTS OUT MEN HARASS ME MUCH MORE AGGRESSIVELY THAN MY THIN FRIENDS. MAN TRIED TO GRAB MY BOOBS ON A NIGHT OUT AND TOLD ME SHOULD BE GRATEFUL FOR THE ATTENTION, BECAUSE WHO WOULD LOVE FAT GIRL. -Anonymous testinomy from an individual who has experienced fatphobia and PSH

Description:
Breaking News: #TaranehAlidoosti , one of Iran's most beloved actresses, has been arrested by the Islamic Republic. IRNA reports that Taraneh Alidoosti was brutally arrested in her home in front of her daughter, for an Instagram post expressing solidarity after execution of #MohsenShekari and for posting a photo of herself without compulsory hijab holding a sign of solidarity with #WomenLifeFreedom. She is being held in section 209 of Evin prison - where prisoners are notoriously tortured - and she requested her medication. Taraneh starred in the Oscar-winning movie, The Salesman. 
Please #BeTheirVoice and share her story.
#iranrevolution #freeiran #stopexecutionsiniran
#WomenLifeFreedom #mahsaamini 

#ترانه_علیدوستی یکی از محبوب ترین بازیگران زن ایران توسط جمهوری اسلامی بازداشت شد.  به گزارشIRNA، ترانه علیدوستی به دلیل انتشار پست اینستاگرامی در ابراز همبستگی پس از اعدام #محسن شکاری و انتشار عکسی از خود بدون حجاب اجباری در حالی که نشانه همبستگی با #زن_زندگی_آزادی در دست داشت، به طرز فجیعی در خانه اش مقابل چشمان دخترش بازداشت شد.  او در بند 209 زندان اوین - جایی که زندانیان شکنجه می شوند - نگهداری می شود و درخواست داروی خود را کرده است. 
 لطفا #صدای آنها باشید و داستان او را به اشتراک بگذارید.

  #مهسا_امینی

Description:
“Bricks of a revolution”
On view at Four Freedom park through Jan 1st, Part of the “eyes on Iran” Exhibition
Organized by @forfreedoms 

Engraved with the names of a fraction of those arrested during this revolution, these bricks represent the strength of the activists who are currently risking their lives, inside and outside prisons, to fight oppression. This installation is an homage to political prisoners and all those bravely paving the way to revolution in Iran. 

The Islamic Republic is heavily suppressing all forms of dissent and opposition. 
Your attention matters.
#MahsaAmini #مهسا_امینی 

Since 16 September 2022, Iranian people have taken to the streets to protest against the Islamic Republic following the brutal murder of Mahsa Jina Amini, a young Kurdish woman, at the hands of government forces. 

The Islamic Republic has been a major source of oppression against women, religious and ethnic minorities, and Iranian society as a whole. Freedom is non-existent, the economy is deteriorating, the environment is degraded. Protests spanning across 146 cities have rapidly turned into Iran’s first ever feminist-led revolutionary movement. Its motto is “Jin, Jiyan, Azadi” in Kurdish, “Zan, Zendegi, Azadi” in Farsi, or “Woman, Life, Freedom” in English. 

Over 18,000 people have been arrested since the start of this revolution. Amongst them are people of all genders, ages, beliefs, and sexual orientations: children, striking workers, artists, lawyers, actresses, athletes, nurses and doctors, students and teachers, families of those arrested or killed. All those actively opposing the current regime know they are at risk of incarceration.

In addition, the Islamic Republic’s parliament has formally called upon the judiciary to impose death penalties against all jailed protesters. Though few have been sentenced to death so far, this move provides the grounds for others to suffer the same faith. Even one death sentence is one too many. This is one of the many strategies used by the government to deter opposition and protest. Other strategies include violence, torture, rape, as well as intimidation, harassment, and threats against activists and their families.

Description:
The government in Iran is committing unprecedented atrocities, including against women and children. More atrocities will take place without meaningful global action.

We've outlined how the international community can help stop the carnage in a briefing available on our website. You can help support our advocacy work with world governments by urging your elected representative to call for the establishment of an urgent special session at the UN Human Rights Council so that governments can collectively address the violence against protesters, and establish an independent mechanism with investigative, reporting, and accountability functions to address the Islamic Republic’s crimes.

Description:
Remember their names and do not trust them! These are some of the people living in North America who have a long track record of lobbying in support of Khamenei’s regime occupying Iran. They’re mainly active on Twitter, in addition to making media appearances and publishing articles to echo the talking points of the regime in English to a Western audience. They do this by presenting themselves as “progressives” who just want peace and stability. Their main tactic is to use nice sounding terms such as “anti-war” and “diplomacy” to make it seem like they are not on the side of the regime. But their main goal is to keep this ISIS-style dictatorship in power no matter what. They have been lying to their Western audience for years, claiming that people in Iran do not want the regime gone, they just want “reforms”. This, of course, is absolute nonsense. They falsely accuse political prisoners, family members of innocent people killed by the regime, and other Iranian activists, of being “warmongers”. They whitewash the crimes of the regime and have always tried to hijack mass protests in Iran to misrepresent them.

With the recent huge anti-regime protests taking place in Iran and the clear message of the Iranian people, which is that they do not want the Islamic Republic in power, their constant rambling has not stopped one bit. Their tactics slightly change from time to time to fit the situation and not be too evident, but their goal is always the same. Some of them are desperately trying to save face now, even going back to delete their previous articles, tweets, and videos. Of course, it’s too late and completely pointless since people have downloaded, taken screenshots, and saved it all!

Stay alert, know their names, and do not fall for their tricks! Iran will be free one day, and when that day comes, I assure you that Iranian people will not forget or forgive those who for years lobbied for that barbaric oppressive regime while living comfortably in North America!

به امید آزادی ✌️

#نه_به_جمهوری_اسلامی 
#IranProtests 
#iranprotests2022 
#MahsaAmini

Description:
Thank goodness for Iranian friends who are the ultimate BS detector in all this. This just came out in The Economist @theeconomist. Can't find an author's name anywhere, nor editorial board endorsement, but it's out there.

Not sure what this reporter is on, or what revolution they're watching, but it's apparent that things are moving inside of Iran, and the regime is on its' heels. Not sure why The Economist has decided to post what is in my opinion propaganda for the regime, and does not accurately reflect things that are going on inside of Iran.

This is the crap that goes out and smothers all of our efforts to get a worldwide coalition of citizens to back the Iranian revolutionaries, and makes people who don't know any better to say, "Oh, it's over.", or "Oh, nothing to do here."

Nonsense. This is the time to topple the weakened regime over.

Description:
"The moon falls a thousand times" is a personal grief. My tribute to honor the Persian leopard's mythical wish to be above the moon. The idea came to my mind when I heard about the story of Mina and her friendship with a Persian leopard in the 19th century.
Yet stories are not to ignore the reality around us, are they? As they are coming out of true experiences, they can make changes for real, they can prevent some tragedies from happening again and again. 
_

Jina, officially named Mahsa Amini was a 22 years-old Kurdish woman visiting Tehran where she was arrested by Morality police for not complying with a compulsory hijab and later died in hospital due to potential police brutality. Her death lit such a fire in hearts that brought numerous people into the streets all over the country (Iran) to protest. Not only to demand justice for her death but for their stolen freedom and the respect every human being deserves.Their bravery is beyond my words!
_ 

Since yesterday, Iran has shut down the internet and blocked social media platforms to silence their voices. At this point, a possible massacre may happen as it happened in 2019. In such a critical condition, Anonymous hackers are supporting people against oppression while Meta is supporting oppression by removing related posts from Instagram (non-violent content), and by blocking Iranians What’s app accounts! Your voice matters cause you can be their voice!
_ 

Her official name Mahsa means "moon alike". Her given name Jina is a Kurdish name which I think has the same origin as the word gene, meaning reproductive, alive, and life-giver. Let's be her name, and let's multiply her by disseminate her story as a symbol who freed a land from demons of darkness. As her mother said, also her epitaph: "Jina, my dear, you won't die! Your name will become a symbol." 

This painting has been shared as an expression of sorrow, but not anymore. Please share this post and ask people to read the caption and share it using the hashtag #MahsaAmini if they like! It was her birthday yesterday and this is my gift to her!

#MahsaAmini
#mahsa_amini 
#opiran 
#jinjianazadi
#مهسا_امینی 
#ژینا_امینی

US national soccer team has removed the religious “ALLAH” emblem from middle of Iranian flag. Description:
Climbing organizations and professionals, as well as the international community, should stand with professional climber Elnaz Rekabi, who is under extreme pressure by the Iranian government to cover up her heroic act of competing without a hijab earlier this week, said the Center for Human Rights in Iran (CHRI) in a statement today.

“While she was scaling that wall in Seoul without the state’s forced hijab, Ms. Rekabi was showing the world who she is: A professional climber and Iranian woman with a spine of steel,” said CHRI Executive Director Hadi Ghaemi.

“She, like countless women in Iran, has risked everything to tell the world that she opposes the state’s policy of forced hijab, and we are extremely worried about her safety,” he added.

“Ms. Rekabi risked her freedom and safety and has since been under extreme pressure by the government to cover up her courageous act of civil disobedience,” said Ghaemi. “It is now the responsibility of all people who support women’s and human rights to stand with her and not let the government in Iran cover up the true story.”

CHRI stands by Iranian athletes who are calling for the government in Iran to be held accountable for its repressive policies, and calls on the International Federation of Sport Climbing (IFCS) to suspend Iran’s membership.

CHRI also urges the IFCS, climbing professionals and the international community to not accept the Iranian government’s attempts to flip this story.

These groups and individuals should make statements in support of Rekabi, who has not been allowed to speak freely since she competed, and all women in Iran who are risking their lives to speak out against repressive state policies.

#Iran #IranProtests #IranProtests2022 #HumanRights #UN #FreeSpeech #Revolution #OpIran #MahsaAmini #IranRevolution #WomensRights #IranRevolution2022 #Iranian #Tehran #Mahsa_Amini

Description:
Re post: @persianswithpurpose After being held in solidarity confinement for over 40 days, Niloofar Hamedi, the reporter who broke the story of Mahsa Zhina Amini’s death and Elaheh Mohammadi, who reported on her funeral, have been accused by the IRGC of being spies “trained by the US’s mafia regime.”

The Islamic Republic has a long history of detaining and executing journalists without fair trial. 

International pressure can help to save Niloofar Hamedi and Elaheh Mohammadi from the same fate that so many other journalists have suffered. 

Help keep Niloofar and Elaheh safe. Share their story.

Description:
In a letter from prison—where she has been unjustly held since November 2021—veteran rights activist Narges Mohammad has reported on instances of sexual harassment and assault by Islamic Republic forces amid the government's violent repression of protests. 

Mohammadi has proved to be a particular thorn in the authorities’ side, refusing to be silent either in prison or during her brief periods of release between convictions. She is taking grave risks to her personal safety and freedom by speaking publicly on this issue.

31 Refugee and Immigrant led Organizations in the U.S endorsed a letter initiated by the Pars Equality Center urging UN Member States to Heed the Call of Iranian Women and Remove the Islamic Republic of Iran from the Commission on the Status of Women and set up an independent UN mechanism to investigate and ensure accountability for the serious crimes under international law in Iran.

سی‌و‌یک سازمان مردم نهاد خدمات دهنده به مهاجران در آمریکا از ملیتهای مختلف، به درخواست مرکز برابری پارس با امضای نامه سرگشاده ای به دبیرکل سازمان ملل خواستار اخراج جمهوری اسلامی از کمیسیون زنان سازمان ملل و ایجاد یک مکانیسم تحقیق مستقل در مورد تمامی موارد نقض حقوق بشر در ایران شدند

Description:
Evin Prison update: Iranian officials have reported four deaths, 61 injuries, and four hospitalizations of individuals in critical condition so far. The actual numbers are likely higher. The government has provided zero evidence to back up its claims about what happened at the prison, which is why we are not reporting their statements right now.

Today families of prisoners in Evin gathered outside the prison, as shown in this video. 

Since last night, some prisoners, including some political prisoners, were able to call their families to let them know their condition, but the prison has a capacity of 15,000 and could be over-capacity due to the high influx of protesters who were sent there in the past four weeks—this means thousands of families are potentially still waiting for information about their loved ones.

Prisoners in the women’s ward were reportedly attacked last night with tear gas, tweeted former political prisoner Atena Daemi while referencing her source inside the prison. Her tweets below have been translated into English by the Center for Human Rights in Iran (CHRI):  “From a prisoner in the Women’s Ward: The siren was heard from 8:30 last night. Mohammadi, head of security, and Hayat-Algheib, head of State Prisons Organization, came to Evin Prison. [Inmates] broke the door and entered the outer area of the ward. Then they brought a sniper.” 

Follow up tweet: “Profanity was said. Prisoners without hijab chanted death to the dictator. They fired a lot of tear gas; some are still having lung problems today. Then [inmates] were guided inside the prison. At the moment everyone is fine, but they are worried about being transferred to other prisons, solitary confinement and interrogation.”

There were more protests in Iran today, five weeks after Mahsa Amini, 22, was pronounced dead just days after she was arrested by the morality police.

At Tehran University today protesters chanted, “Tehran has become a prison! Evin has become a slaughterhouse!”

#Iran #IranProtests #IranProtests2022 #HumanRights #UN #FreeSpeech #Revolution #OpIran #MahsaAmini #IranRevolution #WomensRights #IranRevolution2022 #Iranian #Tehran #Mahsa_Amini
#مهسا_امینی 
#نیکا_شاکرمی

Description:
Former student leader Soha Mortezaei was subjected to sexual and physical abuse while being taken to Evin Prison in a security van on November 21, according to a post by the University Students Trade Unions Council. "Officers tied her right hand to the top of one seat and her right leg to the top of another seat and while suspended, she was beaten and sexually abused by a female officer,” said the council. “When Soha complained, she was injured with punches to the leg and stomach.”

A previous post by the University Students Trade Unions Council said she was hospitalized that day for the injuries and was returned to Evin Prison at midnight. 

#Iran #IranProtests #IranProtests2022 #HumanRights #UN #FreeSpeech #Revolution #OpIran #MahsaAmini #IranRevolution #WomensRights #Iranian #Tehran #Mahsa_Amini #WomenLifeFreedom #IranRevolution2022

a previous post by the university students trade unions council said she was hospitalized that day for the injuries and was returned to evin prison at midnight.

Description:
Meet Arshia Takdastan.

He's 18, and on death row in Iran.

The teen was accused of "leading" anti-state protests. But he's just a teen, without a dollar to his name.

In Mazandaran’s Sari prison, Arshia was locked up in a solitary cell measuring four square meters for 28 days and was interrogated for hours, his cousin Parand Mahmoudi told IranWire, adding that the family did not have any information about the teenager during that time. 

"Forces blindfolded him and put a gun to his head. Arshia stutters. I'm sure he couldn't even scream against the harassment he was going through. He just signed whatever was put in front of him," said Mahmoudi. 
Raise your voice to help #StopExecutionsInIran

Description:
The Iranian government’s fabricated accusations against two unlawfully detained female journalists, Niloofar Hamedi and Elahe Mohammadi, who face severe punishments without access to due process, are part of the state’s efforts to slander the country’s protest movement and should be strongly condemned worldwide.

Both journalists are in great danger given Iranian intelligence agencies' cowardly attempts to pin the country's anti-state protests, which the Raisi government has been unable to crush, on the two women.

The intelligence agencies, both with documented histories of torturing and killing targets of the state, offered no evidence to justify their slander and incorrectly claimed that Niloufar had tweeted a photo of Mahsa Zhina Amini in the hospital, when she had only tweeted a photo of Amini's parents embracing in grief. Elahe, meanwhile, is being persecuted for reporting on Amini's funeral in Saqqez, Kurdistan province. In summary, these women journalists are being attacked for doing their jobs as journalists, which is legal even under the laws of the Islamic Republic. 

Learn more about their cases on our website, link in bio.

#Iran #IranProtests #IranProtests2022 #HumanRights #UN #FreeSpeech #Revolution #OpIran #MahsaAmini #IranRevolution #WomensRights #IranRevolution #Iranian #Tehran #Mahsa_Amini #WomenLifeFreedom #NiloufarHamedi #niloofarhamedi #elahemohammadi

Description:
It’s so much I don’t even know where to begin…
Begin to formulate into words how my life and my body has been harmed growing up in Iran placed in the category of female. 
It won’t happen in a post, or even ten…. Which part of it should I talk about even? Should I talk about the childhood they stole from me? The safety? The freedom? Or the fear I felt every day going out in the world? The countless small moments of harassment of my body that had become so normal I didn’t even think to tell anyone? Should I speak about the abusive relationship I was in and how the system kept me from escaping? Should I talk about the anxiety of morality police and body policing that even followed me to Berlin and the times I automatically reached for my headscarf after seeing a german police van pass me by? Like a reflex, practiced so many times it was almost instant. 
Should I talk about the years I didn’t have words to explain what happened to me? Or after I found the words constantly being silenced by so called activists and feminists and antiractists that always told me not now, or calling out everyone for not posting about their issues but when it came to iran (or anywhere that wasn’t the west) it was “well we can’t care about EVERYTHING..” 
Should I talk about the fact that I couldn’t escape the country that sentenced me to be a second class citizen or not being able to go back to a home that never felt like home? Should I tell you how it feels to choose between my autonomy and my safety? That deciding to speak out meant saying goodbye to the possibility to mend a part of me, the possibility to enjoy the beauty of my homeland and to speak in my mother tongue and be understood by strangers? 
Maybe I will tell you all about it some time,  but for now, I’m processing for the first time. I am able to open this chapter of my life without shame (including my shame) for the world. I am inviting you to listen to our stories, to feel with us. All of us who were not only silenced in our home country but even after and felt so voiceless for so long. I am beginning to let this part of me speak and it has a lot to say. #womanlifefreedom #mahsaamini #jinaamini #opiran #زن_زندگی_آزادی

Description:
The Iranian regime's officials use twitter and other Western platforms to broadcast their lies and propaganda. These hypocrites constantly chant "Death to America" as they use American apps, technology, and products, while they ban Iranian citizens from using them.

Pictured here are:
1) Ali Khamenei - The Supreme Leader (Dictator)

2) Ebrahim Raisi - "President" whose primary role is to be Khamenei's mouthpiece. There are millions of highly educated Iranians but this president doesn't have any formal non-religious education beyond the sixth grade. "Presidential elections" in Iran are a charade. All candidates are handpicked by the dictator.

3) Esmail Qaani - Commander of the Quds Force, a branch of IRGC, responsible for committing numerous acts of terrorism. Also appointed by the dictator.

4) Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf - Speaker of the circus called parliament. Responsible for executive affairs to ensure the theocratic legal system that oppresses the nation remains intact.

5) Gholam-Hossein Mohseni-Eje'i - Chief "Justice". Responsible for many of the regime's mass executions, including that of children.

6) Hossein Amir-Abdollahian - Foreign Minister. His primary task is to whitewash the crimes of the regime in front of the world and legitimize the dictatorship.

7) Peyman Jebelli - Director of the state-owned media that controls all domestic radio & TV services in Iran. Appointed by the dictator to use the media to spread the regime's lies and propaganda.

8) Ali Bahadori Jahromi - Spokesperson for the regime. His job is to spread misinformation, especially in regards to the suffering of the people at the hands of the regime. Many of his lies are unintentionally (or knowingly) repeated by some journalists outside of Iran.

9 & 10) And some of the numerous other previous and current regime officials (many have verified accounts)

Iranian citizens are banned from using Twitter, but their oppressors, these criminals and terrorists, are free to operate, while many videos exposing the crimes of this regime are removed by Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

#BanKhamenei 
#IranRevolution 
#MahsaAmini 
#IranProtests 
#NikaShakarami 
#مهسا_امینی 
#نه_به_جمهوری_اسلامی

Description:
Updated: #noushinzandvakil #shararehsaebimonfared #reyhanearmaghani are ALL FREED from prison 

When you share about people being held in prison in Iran, specifically by name, you are helping save their life. 
Fame buys safety.

On Nov 24, the UN Human Rights Council @unitednationshumanrights voted for a Fact-Finding Mission, into examining the human rights abuses In
Iran. This puts even more pressure on the
regime to portray a good image internationally.
Since the UN vote, the regime in recent days has released hundreds of detainees like Katayoun Mahmoudifar. Some of these released detainees include a prominent human rights activist, a famous 
actress and two former footballers among others. 
Posting on social media is the BEST way to help! 
Iranians are begging us to keep posting so that the regime is put under pressure. The Islamic Regime of Iran knows the world is watching, and is afraid of being held accountable.

One of the slides has a TW. While it may feel overwhelming to read; please remember that it is reality for many Iranians. Turning our eyes away from their pain, is invalidating their suffering. When we are aware, we are able to amplify better. 

Reach out to Iranians you know in your community. All of them are undergoing severe mental distress. Send them love, strength and solidarity. Ask how you can support them better. Share posts that they are sharing & stand united with them.

There is nothing as isolating than to have your yoga teacher or fellow practitioner invalidate what you, or the people in your country are going through. If you are a non-Iranian reach out to your yoga teacher and ask him/her to share. 
Stand in Solidarity. 

Simultaneously, do stand in solidarity with people from across the world facing war, protests, oppression, systemic violence, ethnic cleansing, genocide, gender/religious/race & caste based violence, climate events… 
From Palestine, Kashmir, Ukraine, China, Syria, India to Tibet…

“Nobody's free until everybody's free.”

‎#نوشین_زندوکیل #شراره_صائبی_منفرد #ریحانه_ارمغانی 
#katayounmahmoudifar  #کتایون_محمودی 

‎#مهسا_امینی #opiran #mahsaamini 

JIN JÎYAN AZADÎ
ZAN ZENDEGI AZADI
💚🤍❤️🕊✌🏽

Description:
The sentencing of prominent teachers and labor rights advocates to prison in Iran amid a violent crackdown on protests that has seen hundreds killed, including children, more than 12,000 arrested, and hundreds facing sham charges is a prelude to more severe repression if the international community does not act now, said the Center for Human Rights in Iran (CHRI).

“All across Iran, protesters have been risking their lives to call for an end to the Islamic Republic’s violent repression,” said Ghaemi.

“The state’s attempts to crush peaceful protest through killings, arrests, and imprisonment is a prelude to more severe state violence against Iran’s citizenry, which can only be halted through strong, collective, international action,” he said.

* CHRI calls on the Islamic Republic to release a public accounting of all political prisoners and detainees and their whereabouts, as well as a public listing of all those who have been killed since September 16, 2022, when anti-state protests erupted in the country.

* CHRI also urges the international community, including government leaders, the UN, and bar associations across the world, to call on the government in Iran to release all detained protesters and political prisoners and halt its crackdown on peaceful dissent.

* The U.S. and its partners should also pursue the establishment of an urgent special session at the U.N. Human Rights Council so that governments can collectively address the violence against protesters and establish an investigative, reporting, and accountability mechanism for the Islamic Republic’s many serious crimes.

Read more of our recommendations for the international community, and about this story, on our website (link in bio). 

#Iran #IranProtests #IranProtests2022 #HumanRights #UN #FreeSpeech #Revolution #OpIran #MahsaAmini #IranRevolution #WomensRights #IranRevolution #Iranian #Tehran #Mahsa_Amini #b2210

Description:
By cutting their hair, women across the world have been showing solidarity with Iranian women and their fight for freedom and against forced hijab.

In his first mural called “The Cut” ( see my previous post ), @alexsandropalombo showed Marge Simpson cutting her iconic hair in front of the Consulate General of the Islamic Republic of Iran in Milan. The consulate however had the artwork removed in less than a day. One day later, we have
“The Cut 2" ! Marge Simpson returned in front of the Consulate again and this time she was angry 😡. Just imagine her anger in the next mural! (📸 courtesy of the artist)🙏🏻🙏🏻

I’m going to dedicate this account for the time being, to cover the murals that have been created around the world to honor Mahsa Amini and the fight of Iranian women for Justice and freedom.

Please support them by raising awareness about what Iranian women are fighting for🙏🏻.

If you have a 📷 of streetart dedicated to the fight of women for equality and freedom in general (and Iranian women in particular) either tag me or use #thegraffitihub in your streetart 📷 with a chance to be featured.

 ❗️❗️❗️

Please note that by adding #thegraffitihub in your hashtags, I assume that you are ok with me to feature your media on my page. description_lower:
by cutting their hair, women across the world have been showing solidarity with iranian women and their fight for freedom and against forced hijab.

in his first mural called “the cut” ( see my previous post ), @alexsandropalombo showed marge simpson cutting her iconic hair in front of the consulate general of the islamic republic of iran in milan. the consulate however had the artwork removed in less than a day. one day later, we have
“the cut 2" ! marge simpson returned in front of the consulate again and this time she was angry 😡. just imagine her anger in the next mural! (📸 courtesy of the artist)🙏🏻🙏🏻

i’m going to dedicate this account for the time being, to cover the murals that have been created around the world to honor mahsa amini and the fight of iranian women for justice and freedom.

please support them by raising awareness about what iranian women are fighting for🙏🏻.

if you have a 📷 of streetart dedicated to the fight of women for equality and freedom in general (and iranian women in particular) either tag me or use #thegraffitihub in your streetart 📷 with a chance to be featured.

Description:
A year after poet Baktash Abtin died in Islamic Republic state custody due to denial of medical treatment, friends gathered at his grave in Tehran under state surveillance this past weekend to honor his life.

Abtin had been sentenced to prison for his writings peacefully criticizing state policies, and had initially refused to report to prison, citing the COVID-19 pandemic, which was raging in unvaccinated Iran in 2020. Yet he was forced to go to jail and died from denial of treatment for COVID-19 months later. No official has been held accountable for the political prisoner's preventable death.

#Iran #IranProtests #IranProtests2022 #HumanRights #UN #FreeSpeech #Revolution #OpIran #Khamenei #MahsaAmini #IranRevolution #WomensRights #Iranian #Tehran #Mahsa_Amini #WomenLifeFreedom #IranRevolution2023 #StopExecutionsinIran #stopexecutioninIran
#زن_زندگی_آزادی
#زندان_اوین
#مهسا_امینی
#بکتاش_آبتین

Description:
As the Iranian Government continues to censor and isolate the people of Iran, it’s important to keep sharing the word out and join in community with those fighting for their bodily autonomy, a better life, and a free society. 
 
The @nytimes reports that outlets like Instagram, Twitter and Clubhouse “constitute the only means of holding the powers that be to account.” All of us sharing and reposting on social media has been “critical for a lot of people to wake up and see what's really going on,” said Shahin Milani, Executive Director for the U.S.-based Iran Human Rights Documentation Center (@iran.hrdc) “and that's really critical because no other outlet provides that." 
 
Join in this global community and uplift the fight by sharing this, reposting, and commenting for Mahsa Imani, the young woman who’s death in morality police detainment started these protests, and people all across Iran fighting for a better life, a just government and a free society. 

 
Keep sharing, keep re-tweeting, keep commenting, sign the petition, our voices can be a lifeline. More info at the link in our bio or at https://policy.futureswithoutviolence.org/resource_center/the-facts-about-iran/.
 
#MahsaAmini #JusticeForMahsaAmini #مهسا_امینی

Description:
Shameful. 

Islamic Republic agents arrested the father of Aylar Haghi at the Vadi Rahmat Cemetery in Tabriz, East Azerbaijan province, at a gathering marking the 40th day since his daughter’s killing. 

Aylar, a medical student, was killed on November 17. 

Mourning is a human right that is repeatedly violated by Islamic Republic forces to block attempts to hold them accountable for ongoing rights violations.

Description:
Reports of at least one doctor being killed by state security forces and at least six others being arbitrarily arrested at peaceful protests in Tehran and Mashhad indicate Iran’s medical community is facing deadly state violence as the Iranian government deploys lethal force to crush the country’s growing protest movement, said the Center for Human Rights in Iran (CHRI).

“Doctors who’ve spoken out against Islamic Republic forces occupying medical buildings and who are trying to treat wounded protesters are engaging in a courageous defense of the right to life and deserve international solidarity,” said CHRI Executive Director Hadi Ghaemi.

“Members of the medical community shouldn’t have to risk their lives to call on authorities to allow them to provide care in a safe environment, yet that’s what’s happening in Iran as we speak,” he added.

“The international medical community should join human rights groups in urgently calling on the Iranian government to allow doctors to protect human life without the threat of death or arbitrary arrest,” said Ghaemi. “And call for the immediate release of all detained medical workers.”

Many people in Iran who’ve been wounded amid the protests are too afraid to go to a hospital for treatment because protesters seeking medical help have been detained, according to several accounts shared with CBS News from both inside and outside Iran.

On October 25, members of the Tehran Medical Council issued a statement condemning state security forces patrolling medical buildings in search of protesters: “As members of the Tehran Medical Council, we condemn the military, police, security, and unidentified forces for entering medical universities and hospitals and demand that they stop.”

The statement also called “for the protection of the detainees and their families.” 

Learn more on our website (link in bio).

Description:
Please follow along @officiallyjoko account, which has been taken over by Iranian human rights activist Azam Jangravi
to spread awareness of the current situation in Iran.

Posted @withrepost • @officiallyjoko Niloufar Hamedi, a Shargh newspaper journalist, is the journalist who for the first time reported the death of #MahsaAmini and her family’s words from inside Kasra Hospital in Tehran. She has been in detention since Sept 21, 2022. Elaheh Mohammadi, a Mihan newspaper journalist, is also another reporter in detention for going to Saqqez to investigate and report on Mahsa’s funeral.

Today, the Intelligence Ministry of the Islamic Republic and the Intelligence Service of IRGC published a joint-statement about recent protests in Iran and officially accused Niloufar and Elaheh to help the “foreign media” to propagate a biased narrative of what happened around Mahsa’a death. They were accused of doing so by publishing photos of her on the hospital bed (which showed head trauma) and reports of her funeral in Saqqez and people’s protest after that. In the statement, they claim that the two reporters has been trained on foreign soil to work for “the US mafia-like regime”. In recent days many reporters have been detained and are said to be kept in very harsh conditions in the prisons of Iran. 
Please be Iranian voice.
#iranrevolution #مهسا_امینی #guiltyfeminist #guiltyfeministpodcast #theguiltyfeminist #deborahfranceswhite #dfw  #feminismeverday  #feministissues #feminismuk #feminismforall #sexuality #iran #inranprotest #womensrightsarehumanrights

Description:
I stand in solidarity with the family of Mahsa Amini, the women and the people of Iran who are fighting for their rights and freedoms.

The Canadian government is calling on the Iranian regime to end its repression of freedom of expression – and to end the ongoing harassment of, and discrimination against, women.

People will gather at 6:00 p.m. today in front of Fredericton City Hall to show their support for the women and people of Iran. Please join them if you can. 

#MahsaAmini #Mahsa_Amini #IranProtests #IranProtests2022 #مهسا_امینی 

///

Je suis solidaire de la famille de Mahsa Amini, des femmes et du peuple iranien qui luttent pour leurs droits et leurs libertés.

Le gouvernement canadien demande au régime iranien de mettre fin à sa répression de la liberté d'expression ainsi qu’au harcèlement et à la discrimination continus à l’encontre des femmes. 

Les gens se rassembleront à 18 h aujourd'hui devant l'hôtel de ville de Fredericton afin de démontrer leur soutien aux femmes et au peuple iranien. Veuillez vous joindre à eux si vous le pouvez.

Description:
.
.
.
.
ودر آن بهشت اجباری دیگر
Meanwhile, in that other mandatory heaven.
.
.
Reposted from @apnews Noura’s determination to play sports was so great that she defied her family’s opposition for years.⁠
⁠
But the 20-year-old Afghan woman could not defy her country’s Taliban rulers. They have not just banned all sports for women and girls, they have actively intimidated and harassed those who once played, often scaring them from even practicing in private, Noura and other women say.⁠
⁠
A number of girls and women who once played a variety of sports posed for an @apnews photographer for portraits with the equipment of the sports they loved. They hid their identities with burqas, the all-encompassing robes and hood that completely cover the face, leaving only a mesh to see through. They didn’t normally wear the burqa, but they said they sometimes do now when they go outside and want to remain anonymous and avoid harassment.⁠
⁠
The ban on sports is part of the Taliban’s escalating campaign of restrictions that have shut down life for girls and women.⁠
Even before the Taliban, women’s sports were opposed by many in Afghanistan’s deeply conservative society, seen as a violation of women’s modesty and of their role in society. Still, the previous, internationally-backed government had programs encouraging women’s sports and school clubs, leagues and national teams for women in many sports.⁠
⁠
Read the full story at the link in bio.⁠
⁠
AP Photos/Ebrahim Noroozi

Description:
زخمی از بیداد گردونِ دون پرور، سرت افراشته، ایران، دلدار من

Iran survived the Genghis Khan army. Pellet bullets will not stop her. 300 are already killed, peacefully protesting death of one in custody of a "Morality Police", hundreds wounded, thousands arrested, some sentenced to death. They arrested a protester, then raped a protester, then shot her in vagina with these pellet guns. She died. The same doctor mentioned in this CBS article*, Keyvan Mirhadi, an Iranian Doctor based in New York @_dr.kay_ @_dr.kay1_ reports it in a post(in Farsi). Go look. Not even idf does this.

Now censor me again Instagram just like you removed my post with these same photos a week before this article was published yesterday, on November 11, for "keeping your community safe".

We can not remain a community of teenagers, forever, keep liking posts of cute teens, posing.

Times and again you removed my posts on suffering of Palestinians. CBS never publishes those photos and clips. No Media outlet does. They are not considered humans. Now you do the same with posts on Iranians'suffering. Rest in Peace Orwell.

All my rather short life has been opening mouth to speak up followed by broken teeth, in the U.S. and in the Middle East, freedom of expression that expires with expression. The whole concept is a fallacy. Anybody is free to express, even in North Korea. Freedom AFTER expression matters. I will keep speaking up. Silence suffocates an outlier like me, not all those gone teeth. I do not need them.

Let me repeat what I wrote in that post: Crimes must be seen to be stopped. 

World is not a Disneyland. 

Not everything is entertaining. 

Your ad income will not change. 

Let eyes see.

*https://www.cbsnews.com/news/iran-news-protests-deaths-people-shot-afraid-hospital-arrest-us-doctors-help/
