Description:
Posted @withrepost • 

@lilika_49 Every #Iranian woman I know has had some awful account or horrific encounter with the ‘morality police’ . Day after day these people continue to harass and assault women all over Iran. Women have no rights over their bodies, what they wear or what they do. You can’t hold hands with your loved ones, you can’t show your hair, you can’t wear sandals and show your toes. The list goes on. Violation of women’s rights in Iran is at catastrophic levels. The death of #mahsaamini for the simple reason of a few strands of her hair showing under her scarf MUST be the last straw. Share the hashtags and demand for the rights of Iranian women until the world can’t turn a blind eye.
#mahsaamini 
#مهسا_امینی #نه_به_جمهوری_اسلامی ظ #justiceforthewomenofiran #justiceforiran #womensrights #feminist @the_female_lead @feministfightclub @amnestyuk @amnesty

Description:
Women have NEVER had the chance, EVER to be fully formed versions of a free human being. Think about that. From stupid hair and clothes restrictions, to being pushed into poverty by way of forced pregnancies, to daily sexual harassment and rape- women around the world have had ENOUGH. I rise and stand with you #iran and thank the men who also fight this fight with you. All we want is equality and we are being killed for it. Daily. We are not OK.
#mahsaamini
Image Text: ‎'‎#MAHSAAMINI RISE WITH THE WOMEN OF IRAN #MAHSA_AMINI مهسا_امینی مهساِ #1BILLIONRISING #UNTILTHEVIOLENCESTOPS‎'‎

Description:
به #پرواز شلیک نکنید  To kill a mockingbird

Birds are being shot. 

There are different types of ammunition for these Pellet guns 

This type is for hunting birds.

Each round, once fired, releases tens of small metal pellets. The ammo is called "BirdShot" rounds. 

Instagram, please do not remove this post. They are now published in article around the word including a CBS article published 2 days ago and cited below 

Let eyes see what is happening to birds who peacefully protest killing of one mockingbird, Mahsa (Jina) Amini, in custody of a "morality police", in Iran, and in response, over 300 more are killed, so far. Thousands are caged, some sentenced to death.

Shooting at birds must stop!

*https://www.cbsnews.com/news/iran-news-protests-deaths-people-shot-afraid-hospital-arrest-us-doctors-help/

Description:
From today, users on Instagram and Facebook will be able to use the phrase "death to Khamenei", which is the literal translation of "marg bar Khamenei", in the context of the ongoing protests in #Iran!

Last week, we overturned Meta's original decision to remove a Facebook post protesting the Iranian government, containing the slogan "marg bar Khamenei." As part of our recommendations, we told Meta to permit the general use of the slogan on its platforms during protests in Iran, which they fully implemented effective today.

The Iranian government systematically represses freedom of expression, and digital spaces have become a key forum for dissent. It is vital that Meta supports users' voice. "Marg bar" is used as a political slogan in Iran to mean "down with," not as a credible threat.

We will continue to closely scrutinize how Meta implements recommendations made in the "Iran slogan protest" case, and related recommendations issued in decisions since and share updates of our assessment in our quarterly transparency reports. 

We look forward to receiving Meta's other responses to our recommendations in this case ahead of the 60-day deadline. 

You can read the full decision and recommendations on our website [link in bio 🔗]

#OversightBoard #Iran #IranProtests #Protest #مهسا_امینی #mahsaamini
Image Text: Oversight Board @oversi ightboard In response to a recent Board recommendation about the phrase "death to Khamenei" ("marg bar Khamenei"), Meta announced that it will allow the phrase in the context of the ongoing protests in Iran. We are glad to see Meta fully implement our recommendation ASAP in this case.

Description:
Today the Board overturned Meta's original decision to remove a post containing the slogan "marg bar Khamenei" which literally translates as "death to Khamenei." The Board recommends that Meta permit the general use of the slogan on its platforms during protests in #Iran. 

The Iranian government systematically represses freedom of expression, and digital spaces have become a key forum for dissent. "Marg bar" is used as a political slogan in Iran to mean "down with," not as acredible threat. It is vital that Meta supports users' voices. 

Public comments submitted to the Board also indicate that "marg bar Khamenei" has been used widely during the recent protests in Iran. Many of these posts would have been removed without benefitting from the newsworthiness allowance, which permits otherwise violating content if the public interest outweighs the risk of harm. The Board found that Meta rarely applies it. 

The centrality of language and context should be reflected in Meta's policies, especially when assessing threats to heads of state who are legitimately subject to criticism. 

Meta must do more to respect freedom of expression in protest contexts, including in Iran. 

#OversightBoard #Protest #IranProtests #مهسا_امینی #MahsaAmini

Description:
Yesterday, we announced that the Board had overturned Meta’s original decision to remove a Facebook post protesting the Iranian government, which contains the slogan “marg bar... Khamenei.” This literally translates as “death to Khamenei” but is often used as political rhetoric to mean “down with Khamenei.” 

In the Iranian context, the Board finds that Meta must do more to respect freedom of expression, and permit the use of rhetorical threats. The Iranian government systematically represses freedom of expression and digital spaces have become a key forum for dissent. In such situations, it is vital that Meta supports users’ voice. 

The content in this case was posted days before Iran’s “National Day of Hijab and Chastity". Given the national day was approaching, Meta should have anticipated issues around the over-removal of Iranian protest content, and prepared an adequate response. For example, by instructing “at-scale” reviewers not to remove content containing the “marg bar Khamenei” slogan.

As this case shows, its failure to do so led to the silencing of political speech aimed at protecting women’s rights, including through feature-limits, which can shut people out of social movements and political debate.

The Board has made recommendations to better protect political speech in critical situations, such as that in Iran, where historic, widespread, protests are being violently suppressed. This includes permitting the general use of “marg bar Khamenei” during protests in Iran.

You can read more about this case decision on our website [link in bio 🔗]

#OversightBoard #Iran #IranProtests #Protest #مهسا_امینی #mahsaamini
Image Text: Oversight Board @OversightBoard The Iranian government systematically represses freedom of expression and digital spaces have become a key forum for dissent. It is vital that Meta supports users' voice. "Marg bar" is used as a political slogan in Iran to mean "down with," not as a credible threat.

yesterday, we announced that the board had overturned meta’s original decision to remove a facebook post protesting the iranian government, which contains the slogan “marg bar... khamenei.” this literally translates as “death to khamenei” but is often used as political rhetoric to mean “down with khamenei.”

as this case shows, its failure to do so led to the silencing of political speech aimed at protecting women’s rights, including through feature-limits, which can shut people out of social movements and political debate.

Description: We will be resuming our regular business content more strongly in order to avoid being blocked by Meta. We will however continue to update and amplify Iran’s voice in between. We appreciate your understanding and are forever grateful for your support and patience. I know this has been a lot for our non-Iranian followers and my gratitude is limitless for your generosity of spirit in sending love and kindness to me and the people of Iran. 🙏♥️🙏 #womanlifefreedom #mahsaamini #زن_زندگی_آزادی ♥️♥️

Description: What a week…what a month…what a year…As we in the US celebrate the holidays, remembering all who are not as blessed and fortunate—and all who are as I write this are agitating for Freedom around the World—As the martyrs of the revolution in Iran continue to rise, as the arrests continue to rise, regime gets to be more desperate—the Top left of this grid is a tribute to one of the greatest contemporary Iranian Actresses Tarsney Alidoosti who was taken away by regime goons in front of her infant daughter earlier today our time—the second (as I am going clockwise) is a tribute to one of the Doctors noted by Dr Pirmoozan who was brutally murdered by Regime Goons after having been kidnapped (and her only crime—helping the wounded of the revolution—living up to the ultimate hypocratic oath by Doctors)…so thankful the world is noticing the revolution exemplified by one of the many murals that have arisen in tribute to the martyr who was the trigger, the beautiful angel of the revolution #mahsaaminiمهسا_امینی -and the last one is an image of the majestic view of Mt. Damavanad recently-As I finished the “rounds” of the latest, what I found even more horrifying was how as the regime hastily buried the dead and the executed, there are reports of them taking organs from the bodies and selling them—May the almighty bless the martyrs of the Revolution, continue to grant solace to the families of the fallen , and may every single member of the regime from the leader on down, enablers and apologists all burn in hell for what they’ve done—accountability is near….#زن_زندگی_آزادی #مرگ_بر_خامنه_ای_لعنت_بر_خمینی #نه_به_جمهوری_اسلامی #مهسا_امینی
